Security forces rescued 2 children who had been abducted a few days earlier by LRA force from the town of Aba, DRC. They were rescued near the community of Vurani, DRC.
On July 14th, 2010, security forces clashed with LRA forces in Kalimbea, DRC and 2 LRA abductees were rescued.

LRA forces released 1 man north of the Dungu-Faradje road in the DRC shortly after he was abducted because he could not keep up with the group. He was released in the Garamba National Park, roughly 10 km north of the road.

LRA forces attacked the community of Lopa, near Doya, DRC, killing a 60-year old man and stealing food and goats from his field. This was part of a series of attacks over several days in the area. 200 people fled as a result of the attacks.
8 LRA members were seen in the Faradje-Aba area which is east of Faradje in the DRC.

An LRA man carrying an AK-47 surprised a woman 3 km northwest of Djabir, DRC, as she was tending to her field.  He motioned for her to come over, but she fled out of fear and alerted security forces who responded, but were unable to find the man.

Northwest of Niangara, DRC, suspected LRA forces killed a teenage girl, injured a 4-year-old child, and abducted 2 boys. The assailants then proceeded to loot 30 households. The group fired 2 warning shots as they left. Security forces arrived late.
LRA forces abducted 2 women (a mother and daughter) as they were fetching water at 9:00 AM by the Aaru river which is 7 km east of Limai, DRC.

30 LRA attacked and looted Bilali, a community near Djabir, DRC. 1 LRA combatant was killed, and 2 adults were injured during the attack. 1 child later died due to injuries sustained during attack. 9 children were abducted. Location of attack approximate.
LRA forces released a mother who had been abducted with her daughter earlier in the day east of Limai, DRC. The daughter is still in captivity.

10 suspected LRA members, with women and children, looted corn, ducks, a goat, cassava, cassava flour, sweet potatoes, and a plastic sheet from Drandu, DRC, on the morning of January 29th. The assailants moved west after the attack.

An armed LRA soldier was looting corn from a field at Drandu, DRC, when the farmer who owned the field surprised the soldier, who kept harvesting. After a brief and non-violent conversation, the soldier left with the corn.

4 suspected and armed LRA forces returned to the same field at Drandu, DRC, that had been looted several days earlier by the lone LRA soldier and looted 4 bags of peanuts. The same farmer witnessed the event and called for help to no avail.
On roughly September 18th, 2009, 3 LRA members were seen in Limai, DRC. Security forces captured 1 of the LRA members. The listed date is an estimate.
LRA forces abducted a woman near Limai, DRC.
LRA forces killed a young woman in Limai, DRC on February 2nd, 2010.
LRA forces abducted 2 people from Limai, DRC, over the 11th and 12th of March, 2010.
LRA forces attacked Limai, DRC, and abducted 1 child.
LRA forces attacked Limai, DRC . There are no further details surrounding the attack.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 1 person from Limai, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces shot and wounded a woman in Limai, DRC. Security forces responded and fended off the attack.
LRA forces and security forces clashed near Limai, DRC. 2 abductees were able to escape during the fight.
Near Limai, DRC, LRA forces were reportedly seen crossing a road.
A group of civilians with a security force escort were ambushed by LRA forces near Limai, DRC. 2 civilians were abducted.
Security forces and LRA forces engaged each other which resulted in 2 LRA members being killed. That battle took place near Limai, DRC.
2 suspected LRA ambushed a man near Limai, DRC and questioned him about the location of local security forces.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a man from Limai, DRC.

Suspected LRA forces were spotted at the edge of a field near Limai, DRC. The man who spotted them fled and then the suspected LRA forces fired 2 shots into the air. Security forces heard the shot and went to investigate.
In response to a series of recent lootings, security forces ambushed LRA forces near Avorkiri and Aba, DRC. 3 LRA were killed and 1 was captured.
An alleged LRA presence in Bandueli, DRC, causes a panic in the nearby towns of Ango and Dingila.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians at Bandueli, DRC, on July 8th, 2009.
LRA forces abducted 4 people from Bandueli, DRC.
A boy who was abducted by suspected LRA forces from Djabir, DRC, managed to escape the same day, June 17th, 2011. There is no information regarding the 18-year-old boy abducted with him.
A man was attacked and looted by the LRA on June 27th, 2011 in outside of Limai, DRC.
3 suspected LRA attempted and failed to abduct a man and woman on the road near Ngilima, DRC.
Park guards encountered a group of 15 suspected LRA crossing a road 15km north of Nagero, DRC. Upon seeing the guards, the combatants fled.

Security forces attacked 2 LRA camps, 1 near Gurba and 1 near Nambia, DRC (near Niangara) freeing a total of 113 people from both the camps. The total number has been divided between the two camps as the individual numbers are unclear.
On April 3, 2010, LRA forces attacked Nambia, DRC, and killed 2 civilians.
LRA forces killed 2 elderly civilians after abducting them near Nambia, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 2 elderly men near Nambia, DRC.
Reported LRA forces attacked Nambia, DRC, killing 1 civilian and injuring another.
Reported LRA forces attacked the village of Nambia, DRC twice in one day, killing a total of 5 people and injuring 1.

8 LRA members were sighted camped close to a local elementary school in Nambia, DRC. Security forces were sent to the area and clashed with the LRA upon arrival. 7 of the 8 LRA were killed in the clash. This was reported on September 30th.
2 civilians abducted by LRA forces during a skirmish were quickly rescued by security forces in Nambia, DRC.
Skirmishes over a couple of days broke out north of Nambia, DRC between LRA forces and security forces. 1 LRA fighter was killed and another captured. During the clash, the LRA abducted 2 people.
Security forces and 13 LRA fighters clashed  in Nambia, DRC, resulting in the rescue of 1 boy.
LRA combatants ambushed a group of 6 civilians  while they were gathering palm oil outside of Nambia, DRC. 1 civilian was killed during the attack.

LRA fighters attacked a group of security force soldiers Nambia, DRC. The security forces then returned fire, causing the LRA members to disperse. The security forces tracked the LRA members into the bush. No further details are known.
Security forces conducted a patrol in Nambia, DRC and rescued a boy who had been in LRA captivity for one year.
A 12-year-old boy, who was abducted in May 2010 escaped in Nambia, DRC on approximately December 29th 2010. Security forces then took the boy to Duru, DRC.
On March 23rd, 2011, 2 female LRA members came out of captivity into the town of Nambia, DRC, saying they no longer wanted to fight. They were treated by an NGO in Niangara and Nambia, respectively.
6 LRA members looted a community in Nambia, DRC on May 27th, 2011 around 2:00 AM. This cluster of LRA is believed to have as many as 20 people acting as porters to carry their loot.

3 LRA forces attacked Nambia, DRC on June 11th, 2011. LRA members abducted a 12 year-old girl and a 12 year-old boy, and looted food from several households. They were both either released or found the next day.

A 12-year-old girl was released on June 12th, 2011 after being abducted from Nambia, DRC, on June 11th, 2011. She was released with this message from the LRA forces: "It is useless to escape. We will always get you back."
The 12-year-old boy who had been abducted by LRA forces from Nambia, DRC, on June 11th, 2011, was found tied up to a tree on June 12th. There are no further details on his condition.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 1 woman from Nambia, DRC on June 13th, 2011.  Corn from her field was looted.

1 woman who was abducted by suspected LRA forces from Nambia, DRC, on June 13th, 2011 returned  on June 14th. The woman said she had not been raped. It was also reported that her abductors were interested in defecting from the LRA.
Suspected LRA forces, who were speaking Acholi, released the 4 people they had recently abducted from Nambia, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces, who were speaking Acholi, abducted 4 people near Nambia, DRC.
Suspected LRA attacked a group of 5 people near Nambia, DRC. 4 of the civilians fled, but 1 was injured by a machete.
Roughly 10 LRA forces attacked and looted the health center in Nambia, DRC and fired warning shots into the air. Security forces chased the LRA forces into the forest.

As reported on May 10, a 12-year-old boy escaped from LRA captivity near Nambia, DRC. He reported that he was abducted along with his father in April 2012 from Bangadi, DRC. The exact date of the escape is unknown.

10 suspected LRA forces, comprised of men, women, and a child, abducted 2 people and looted manioc from Nambia, DRC. The suspected LRA forces interrogated the abducted individuals about the security forces in the area.
LRA forces released 2 people, who had been abducted during an attack on Nambia, DRC.

A 16-year-old girl and a 20-year-old woman escaped from an attempted abduction by three suspected LRA armed and in unidentified uniforms,  3 km from Nambia, DRC.  They were on their way to fetch water when the attacked occurred.
A Congolese man who had reportedly been abducted in Bangadi, DRC, two years earlier, escaped when the LRA was attacked in CAR. He arrived in Nambia, DRC, on February 17th, 2013.
3 of the 5 people abducted by LRA forces near Limai, DRC, were able to escape. The 3 escapees included 1 adult and 2 children. 2 young girls remain in LRA captivity.

16 LRA forces, including 6 children, clashed with security forces when they attacked a community 1 km northeast of Limai, DRC. The assailants abducted 5 civilians, including 2 young girls, and looted goats, food, and various household items.
LRA forces attacked Liakango, DRC, killing 1 civilian.
4 armed suspected LRA men abducted a man as he was working in his field west of Nambia, DRC.  The assailants interrogated the man about local security forces and then used him as a guide.
Civilians found 2 letters written by the LRA west of Limai, DRC. The letters warned civilians to not defend themselves against the LRA or help with military operations.
On roughly June 13th, 2009, 2 LRA soldiers surrendered to civilians along the Yei-Kaya road in South Sudan. They said they were tired of fighting.

As 4 suspected LRA forces were being led by a recently abducted farmer, they ran into a group of villagers and security force soldiers. The suspected LRA forces fled and the abducted farmer was able to escape.
On January 28th, 2010, a group of LRA members clashed with security forces in Limavi, DRC. 2 civilians were killed.

4 suspected LRA forces were seen attempting to steal sugar cane from a field 2 kilometers northwest of Limai, DRC. They were armed and wore both civilian clothing and old military uniforms. The woman who witnessed this alerted the community.

2 armed LRA forces ambushed 16 Congolese civilians, including 5 men, who were returning from fishing west of Nambia, DRC. The assailants looted an empty container and a flashlight. They told the 16 civilians that they were only looking for food.
2 Congolese men out hunting were ambushed west of Nambia, DRC, by 2 armed LRA forces who were reportedly wearing military uniforms.  The 2 civilians threw their bikes and ran away.
LRA forces attacked the village of Li-Au, DRC, near Ngilima, killing 2 people.

3 Congolese men aged respectively 30, 24 and 17 years were fishing east of Nambia, DRC, when they were surprised by 2 suspected LRA forces  armed with AK47s, wearing civilian clothes. The oldest of the civilian men was shot in the head.

2 fishermen were abducted after 7 suspected LRA invaded the community of Mbwele, DRC, on May 13th at 14:00.  A 3rd fisherman was able to escape the attack, while the 2 others were taken into the bush.
On March 23rd, 2009, LRA forces attacked Boso, DRC. According to the single source, 2 civilians were killed and 20 were abducted, including 2 Mbororo children.
LRA forces killed 13 people and abducted 2 others in an attack on Angar, DRC, which is near Boso.
On August 1st, 2009, LRA forces reportedly attacked the Sunday market in Boso, DRC.
On August 15th, 2009, LRA forces reportedly attacked the Sunday market in Boso, DRC. 3 civilians were killed and an unknown number were abducted.
LRA forces killed 2 people during an attack at Angar, DRC, which is near Boso. The attack took place in September, 2009.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 15 people from Boso, DRC, on October 21st, 2009.
LRA members abducted 3 civilians from Boso, DRC, on February 18th, 2010.
LRA forces attacked security forces on the road between Dungu and Bangadi, DRC.
Security forces clashed with the LRA near Pudupudu, DRC on January 23rd, 2010.
LRA forces attacked Pudupudu, DRC on January 23rd, 2010, killing 2 civilians.
Suspected LRA forces attacked a group of civilians in Pudupudu, DRC, while travelling from Ngilima to Dungu, DRC, on June 20, 2011. 1 man escaped while at least 2 other people were abducted.
3 presumed LRA attacked a man and woman near Pudupudu, DRC. The civilians fled, and were unharmed, but their motorcycle battery was looted.
10 suspected LRA forces ambushed 3 men traveling through Pudupudu, DRC. The men abandoned their belongings and fled from the assailants unharmed.
4 suspected LRA forces ambushed 5 men as they were traveling near Pudupudu, DRC. 2 of the men were abducted and all their goods were looted.
LRA forces released 2 men after they were abducted on August 21 near Pudupudu, DRC. Upon their release, they immediately informed security forces of their abduction.
An unknown number of LRA forces attacked and looted a Mbororo camp near Nambia, DRC. The assailants were all armed and wearing camouflage type uniforms, and spoke a poor Lingala and Acholi.
2nd incident in a series of LRA attacks near Munuku, DRC. The LRA killed 7 civilians in Kpanga, DRC, on February 2, 2010. Multiple victims were found tied up and shot and/or beaten to death.
LRA forces attacked Kpanga, DRC, killing at least 80 people.

5 armed LRA forces  looted food and non-food items near Nambia, DRC. They abducted  the 12-year-old son of one of the HF operators, a 59-year-old man and 3 women, all Congolese civilians. The assailants spoke Acholi and a poor Lingala.
Suspected LRA abducted a woman and her 8-year-old daughter near Kurukwata, DRC.
Suspected LRA abducted a civilian near Kurukwata, DRC. Security forces were informed but were unable to track the combatants.
LRA forces abducted a 16-year-old boy who was from a community called Domo, DRC, near Kurukwata, DRC.
Security forces clashed with the LRA in Mabiki, DRC.

Following the earlier attack on their camp by LRA forces, Mbororos were on the move when they were attacked again by LRA forces. They exchanged fire, creating panic in the population. Security forces, due to limited capacity, were not able to respond.
LRA members clashed with security forces in Sukune, DRC resulting in the death of 3 LRA fighters.

Park guards discovered an abandoned LRA camp 15km north of Nagero, DRC. 1 woman, who later escaped the LRA in May, confirmed that the camp had housed 110 total LRA, 50 of whom are armed men and 60 are women, some with children.
LRA forces attacked the community of Manzi in DRC and abducted more than 10 people. Security forces engaged the LRA. No deaths or injuries were reported.

18 LRA forces, comprised of 3 women, 2 children and 13 men, all armed with AK-47?s, were seen by travelers near Manzi, DRC. The LRA group was moving in the direction of Bangadi. The armed group wore unidentified uniforms and spoke an unknown language.
LRA forces attacked the community of Gungu, DRC, on January 3rd. 1 man was killed and 2 other people abducted, though they managed to escape the next day.

After helping loot a field, a 15-year-old boy escaped from the LRA after 5 years in captivity while his captors slept near Gungu, DRC. He was originally abducted in a nearby location 5 years ago in 2008.
3 armed LRA forces abducted 2 Mbororo children and killed 2 cows owned by Mbororo civilians near Nambia, DRC.
3 armed LRA forces attempted to abduct a 32-year-old man near Nambia, DRC, but the man was able to escape.
On December 6th, 2010, a 22-year-old woman escaped from LRA forces and arrived in Nango, DRC. She had spent over 2 months in captivity.
2 people who were abducted on January 3rd, 2011 were released by LRA forces near the community of Nango, DRC, on January 4th.

Suspected LRA attacked 2 men on June 11th, 2011, near Nango, DRC. One 25-year-old man was abducted, and the other was able to escape. Security forces reported traces of a group moving towards Ngilima after the attack.
5 people were killed by suspected LRA on June 11th, 2011 in Nango, DRC.
A hunter who had been abducted from Nango, DRC, on June 11, 2011, by suspected LRA forces was found a day later beaten to death by sticks and a machete.

Community members in Nango, DRC sighted 2 suspected LRA on July 21st. The community members threatened to shoot them, thwarted their looting attempt and alerted regional security forces to LRA presence.
LRA forces clashed with security forces near Nango, DRC, south of Ngilima on July 26th, 2011.
A large number of suspected LRA were seen just south of Ngilima, DRC near a security force checkpoint. Allegedly one unidentified man attempted to loot home but was captured by security forces.
An LRA combatant invaded a 2 men's homes on August 6th in Nango, DRC asking for saucepans, clothing, and food. Neither man had the items, so the LRA combatant left and returned to the forest.

While traveling to Ngilima, DRC on motorcycle, two civilians were stopped by four armed LRA forces in Nango. Leaving the motorcycle, the two people ran into the forest, escaping abduction. All of their goods were taken.
A suspected LRA combatant shot at a member of local security forces near Nango, DRC on January 2nd, 2012.

Suspected LRA forces ambushed 2 civilians near Nango, DRC, about 5 km from Ngilima on August 24th, 2012.The civilians were able to escape and alert security forces who returned to the scene and found the civilian's goods had been looted.
A hunter spotted 12 suspected LRA forces northwest of Limai, DRC. They consisted of 8 armed men and 4 armed children.
LRA forces abducted 30 IDPs travelling from Niangara, DRC, on March 14th, 2010.
During the week of June 10th to June 17th, security forces discovered 3 suspected LRA camps along the Kapili River, northeast of Niangara, DRC.
LRA forces looted a plantation 5 km south of Ngilima, DRC. The assailants claimed that the LRA has returned to the region with strong force.

9 suspected LRA forces ambushed 3 travelers near Kumbongilima, DRC and looted flour and corn. The civilians abandoned their goods and fled. Security forces responded and exchanged fire with the assailants, who fled eastward.

8 suspected LRA forces shot a man in his right leg as he was fleeing. They interrogated him on the locations of local security forces before leaving him to loot a nearby community 4 km NE of Nambia, DRC. 3 women were abducted to help carry the goods.

8 suspected LRA forces released 3 women who were abducted the day before near Nambia, DRC. They were used as porters to carry the looted goods. The man who was shot in the right leg was taken to hospital in Niangara to receive care.

2 Congolese farmers, a man and woman, were working in their field when 3 suspected LRA forces tried to stop them. The farmers managed to escape. The assailants were armed and in unidentified military uniforms, speaking an unidentified language.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a boy and his grandfather from a field just west of Aba, DRC.

A hunter sighted 4 armed LRA forces, 2 with AK47 and 2 with machetes, all dressed in civilian clothes. They were observing a board displaying information on LRA defection and discussing between themselves. They then reportedly set fire to the bush.
During the night of January 7th and into the morning of the 8th, LRA forces looted Birichai and Azoba, DRC. 4 girls were abducted and the towns were heavily looted.
Sometime between January 22nd and 30th, 2009, a group of boys sighted 5 suspected LRA men killing 1 civilian and torturing an unknown number in Aba, DRC.
On the night of April 1st, 2009, suspected LRA forces killed 5 civilians and burned several homes in Aba, DRC.
LRA forces looted various villages around Aba, DRC. It is unknown how many villagers were hit or what was taken. The date is an estimate give or take a couple of days.
An unknown number of LRA forces surrendered to security forces in Aba, DRC on October 4th, 2009.
Security forces captured 5 LRA forces near Aba, DRC.
1 woman was able to escape from LRA forces after her abduction near Aba, DRC, on October 27th, 2009.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians from Aba, DRC, on October 27th, 2009.
LRA forces clashed with security forces on April 30th, 2010, at Aba, DRC. At least 1 LRA member was captured.
A teenage boy escaped from LRA captivity near Aba, DRC.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 2 people along the road just northeast of the town of Aba, DRC.
1 woman escaped from the LRA near Zulibi, DRC, which is near Aba, DRC, with the help of security forces.
LRA forces attacked Aba, DRC at 1:30 AM abducting 3 girls and 2 boys and burning 2 houses.
During the night of April 28th, 2011, LRA members abducted 4 children (including 2 girls) and 1 woman from various communities surrounding Aba, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 2 children from Aba, DRC on April 28th, 2011. Regional security forces pursued the attackers as they fled towards Faradje.
LRA members abducted 2 children near Aba, DRC, on May 4th, 2011.
A 17-year-old boy was abducted from a community called Toka Mogh, DRC near Aba, DRC, on July 16th. Food was also looted from the community the same day.
1 woman escaped LRA forces immediately after being abducted on July 25th. She escaped near Aba, DRC.
5 LRA members were captured near Aba, DRC at the village of Ndanda. 1 LRA was captured by residents of the village, while 4 others were captured by security forces.
During the week of August 5th, it was reported that 4 LRA combatants were captured by security forces in Aba, DRC. All 4 LRA elements have been transferred to Dungu, DRC.
Suspected LRA released a woman and her 8-year-old daughter near Aba, DRC after they were abducted 2 days earlier.
LRA forces released a boy, but not his grandfather two days after he was abducted with his grandfather from west of Aba, DRC, on March 10th.

LRA forces composed of 4 armed men and 2 armed women speaking Arabic looted Aba, DRC. They also abducted 4 girls, including one 12-year-old girl,  and 1 boy, to carry the looted goods. The assailants then left and moved towards South Sudan.
A Congolese female, who had been a "wife" of an LRA soldier managed to escape to Aba, DRC, after a year and a half with the LRA.
Groups of 4 to 5 men suspected LRA were sighted in Kandri, DRC, 30 km northwest of Alu.
Groups of 4 to 5 suspected LRA were sighted in Kandri, DRC, 30 km northwest of Alu.
7 suspected LRA forces were spotted south of Kiliwa, DRC, traveling from west to east toward the Garamba National Park.
Reported LRA forces attacked the village of Nanago, DRC on July 7th, 2010.
Suspected LRA forces attacked a Nanago, DRC, killing 1 person and abducting another.
In a clash between security forces and LRA forces on June 1st, 2011 in Gurba, DRC, 4 abducted children were freed and 2 children died during the clash.
LRA forces abducted two children from the community of Natikpo, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 3 people in Natikpo, DRC.
LRA forces reportedly attacked near the banks of the Tongo river, near Limai, DRC killing 1 man and abducting 5 women.
Of the 4 civilians abducted earlier by 13 LRA forces near Nambia, DRC, 3 managed to escape. The 13-year-old boy is still in captivity.

13 LRA forces, composed of 4 armed men, 4 women, 2 boys and 3 girls, were sighted near Nambia, DRC. The armed assailants spoke Swahili and a bad Lingala and attempted to abduct 4 civilians. 3 escaped, but a 13-year-old boy was abducted.
On October 29th, 2008, LRA  forces ambushed 5 security forces on patrol near Kiliwa, DRC, killing 3 of them.
LRA forces attacked security forces at the village of Luwo near Ngilima, DRC on December 28th, 2009.

A women and her 4 children were reportedly rescued by local security forces after being abducted by suspected LRA forces near Ngilima, DRC, on December 1, 2013. No other details were provided regarding their rescue.

On Dec 1, 2013, a group of suspected LRA forces were spotted near Ngilima, DRC.  Around the same time, a family was abducted by suspected LRA.  The abductees consisted of 1 woman and 4 children who were later rescued by security forces.
The LRA attempted to attack a man on the road between Kiliwa and Limai, DRC on January 1st, 2011. He was able to evade the 2 LRA combatants and reach a nearby security force outpost for safety.

2 Congolese civilians were surprised by 3 armed assailants, who  gestured for them to come closer. The civilians ran away and were pursued by the assailants for 2 km. The suspected LRA forces looted the clothes and utensils left behind by the civilians.

3 LRA forces abducted 1 man near Ngilima, DRC. This was the second of two abductions by this group of assailants on February 19th, 2012. The assailants also looted food and household goods from a number of homes in the area.
Security forces reportedly clashed with LRA forces near Aba, DRC in the week prior to September 13th, 2009. 3 LRA combatants were killed in the clash.
Security forces found an abandoned camp in the Gagilidangwe forest, which is approximately 50 km southwest of Bangadi, DRC. The camp is suspected to have belonged to the LRA.
LRA forces looted goods from traders who were headed to the market in Bamunga, DRC on February 28th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian near Bamunga, DRC.
LRA forces killed 2 civilians near Bamunga, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian at Bamunga, DRC on April 18th, 2010.

A fisherman sighted 14 LRA forces including a woman, reportedly armed with 4 AK guns and a machine gun. The group also included 2 boys and a man who had his hands tied. The fisherman then came out of the bush and informed security forces of this sighting.

LRA forces reportedly attacked Bamunga, DRC. A civilian managed to escape from Bamunga and relayed this information to the radio operators of Nambia, DRC, 7 km south. Security forces based in Nambia went to the reported location of the attack.

An unknown number of LRA forces looted the household of a 45-year-old Congolese civilian. After the looting, the assailants left in the same direction in which they arrived, east of Bamunga, DRC, and crossed  the Galamulo river.
Suspected LRA forces were sighted traveling between Limai, DRC, and Taduru, DRC. Security forces were informed.

As 3 cyclists passed through Kiliwa, DRC, 3 armed and uniformed LRA stopped them. The cyclists ran, but one LRA threw a large stone toward them, hitting one man in the hip and causing him to collapse. The cyclists escaped, but LRA forces looted all goods.
In the night between July 31st and August 1st, 2009, 7 LRA forces reportedly abducted 8 civilians in Angar, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces were spotted at Angar, DRC, on October 26th, 2009.

On his way back to Bangadi after a visit in Nambia, DRC,  a 28-year-old man fell into an ambush and was abducted by suspected LRA forces. Another passerby noticed his abandoned bike by the side of the road and reported the news to Nambia, DRC.
A 28-year-old man reportedly returned from LRA captivity a day after his abduction on the Nambia-Bangadi road, DRC. The assailants were reportedly composed of 10 armed LRA forces.
Suspected LRA forces quickly abandoned the young boy they had abducted from Ngilima, DRC, because he would not stop crying.
Suspected LRA forces fired warning shots, looted food from 2 households, and abducted a child from just south of Ngilima, DRC, overnight.
LRA forces attacked Nango, DRC, on November 14th, 2009. 4 civilians were killed and 12 were abducted, including 2 children.

A Congolese man went to draw water when he was surprised by a group of suspected LRA forces, including women and children. 2 of them were armed and 1 was dressed in a UPDF uniform. They looted the man's palm oil. The assailants spoke a poor Lingala.

A 37-year-old Congolese man was fishing when 2 LRA forces, one in a UPDF uniform and the other in civilian clothing, speaking a poor Lingala, surprised him. The man ran away and the assailants pursued him. Failing to capture him, they destroyed his bike.
Security forces found an abandoned LRA camp north of Nambia, DRC. The security forces found an 11-year-old boy in the same area.

Suspected LRA destroyed the VHF antenna used by park guards near Nagero, DRC. Park guards found the broken antenna and cut wires on February 10, 2012. The radio charger and relay reception box were also stolen.

A fisherman was drying fish near Nambia, DRC, when an armed LRA member surprised him. He started a conversation with the fisherman and sat down with him. After a few moments, the fisherman took the pretext to fetch firewood to flee back to his community.
LRA members killed 2 civilians and abducted 3 civilians from January 2-4, 2010 in Negilidangwa, DRC.
LRA forces abducted and looted goods from an unreported number of people in Negilidangwa, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted an unknown number of people from Negilingdawa, DRC and looted the community on December 2nd, 2010.
LRA combatants killed 2 people in front of their homes in Negilidangwa, DRC on 3 December 2010.
15 LRA members exchanged fire with security forces near Taduru, DRC. A civilian man who was traveling with the security forces was shot in the leg.
An LRA member was captured by security forces south of Kiliwa, DRC on December 23rd, 2009.
LRA forces attacked a Catholic Church in Ongwa, DRC, abducting 4 people, including two women, a priest and his attendant.
A priest and his attendant escaped from LRA captivity after being abducted on January 1st in Ongwa, DRC. The precise location of their escape is unclear.
The woman who had been abducted with her brother earlier that day near Nambia, DRC, was released at an unknown location with a letter.

A group of LRA forces, composed of 4 armed men and 3 children, abducted a brother and sister in their field 15 km north east of Nambia, DRC. The corpse of the brother was later found on January 20th, 2013.
Security forces were ambushed by 7 LRA at Sidabo, DRC. The security forces pursued the LRA as they attempted to flee which resulted in 1 LRA being killed.
On March 5, 2010, LRA forces killed 1 civilian 25 km west of Ngilima, DRC.
According to local leaders, there is a suspected LRA camp southwest of Bangadi, DRC.

4 suspected and armed LRA forces, including 1 woman, briefly held an Mbororo group hostage overnight near Ngilima, DRC, and forced them to kill their own cow and dry the meat. The next morning, the assailants looted the meat and other goods and moved NW.
On July 9, 2010, LRA forces killed 3 civilians in an attack near the Ngilima, DRC.

3 armed suspected LRA forces attacked a 25-year-old man and looted his merchandise and money in a community near Mabadabada, DRC. 2 of the assailants spoke Acholi and 1 spoke Lingala. The victim was able to escape.
4 LRA soldiers attacked the community of Talu, DRC on June 7th, 2010. 3 youth were abducted and 3 adults were injured in the attack. Their homes were also looted.
7 LRA members attacked near Talu, DRC, and abducted 1 woman.
3 LRA forces released a man and a woman, abducted on February 19th, near Ngilima, DRC. They are currently being held with security forces.

3 LRA forces, all armed men, temporarily stopped a Congolese civilian as he was going to his field near Kiliwa, DRC. After 15 minutes, they released him with a message for the local authorities. The assailants spoke Acholi and a poor Lingala.
3 LRA members attempted to kidnap 1 female and loot goods from Ngilima, DRC. The abduction and looting were unsuccessful because the LRA forces fled as security forces arrived.

A boy spotted a large LRA group from the top of a tree. 3 armed LRA forces surprised him and said they wished to defect and asked where various towns, countries & security forces were located. They took the boy's pants before he fled to alert the locals.
LRA members killed 1 civilian on February 15th, 2010 on Nkwa, DRC.
LRA members killed 2 civilians and abducted 1 civilian on January 23rd, 2010, in Awe, DRC.

2 Congolese fishermen were surprised by 2 suspected LRA forces by the Kilibo river, near Nambia, DRC. The LRA forces released the fishermen with a warning that community members were not to cross the river because the group had a camp there.
LRA forces and security forces clashed south of Ango, DRC on May 29th, 2010. 1 civilian was killed during the clash.
There was a clash between the LRA and security forces in the area surrounding Mangba, DRC. No details surrounding the outcome of the clash were reported.
3 LRA forces released 2 women who had recently been abducted just outside of Kiliwa, DRC. However, the 9-year-old girl who was abducted at the same time remains in captivity.

3 LRA forces attacked a group of 5 women and a 9-year-old girl as they traveled to get water. The assailants abducted 2 of the women and the young girl. The 3 women who were not abducted fled back to Kiliwa, DRC, to inform the community.

LRA forces attacked Kiliwa, DRC, killing 20 men and abducting 41 students. They burned the market, the church, peoples houses, and bicycles. This is part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.
3 LRA forces were spotted near Kiliwa, DRC on May 20th, 2009. The left after security forces arrived.
A lone, suspected LRA member attacked Kiliwa, DRC, and was subsequently killed by the villagers' defense efforts
LRA forces killed 2 civilans at Kiliwa, DRC on MAy 8th, 2012, the same day as another attack on Kiliwa. The local civilians fought back and killed 1 LRA member.
LRA forces injured 1 civilian near Kiliwa, DRC on May 8th, 2010.
LRA forces abducted 1 child from Kiliwa, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Kiliwa, DRC . There are no further details surrounding the attack.
Suspected LRA forces killed 1 woman and looted goods from Kiliwa, DRC on June 5th, 2011. The LRA forces reportedly clashed with security forces.

A 19-year-old Sudanese woman was able to escape into Kiliwa, DRC, before LRA combatants invaded the same community that night. The woman had been captive for 4 years and was 5 months pregnant because she was given to an LRA commander as a wife.

15 armed LRA abducted 7 women and 5 men in Kiliwa, DRC, and immediately forced them to attack their own village which resulted in 1 civilian being wounded and 2 more killed. Food and various goods were stolen.
Several households were looted and 1 woman abducted after the LRA invaded Kiliwa, DRC on July 27th. Regional security forces arrived on the scene after the attack took place.
A 15-year-old girl escaped LRA forces on October 9th after being in captivity for 2 months. She escaped when 3 LRA combatants were sleeping and is now in Kiliwa, DRC.
Security forces pursued the suspected LRA forces who had abducted 3 children from Kiliwa, DRC. They were able to rescue the 9-year-old boy, but the 2 other girls remain in captivity.

3 armed suspected LRA forces abducted a 9-year-old boy and 2 girls from the market in Kiliwa, DRC. The assailants also looted food that had recently been distributed before fleeing. The boy was forced to carry the food.

Approximately 20 suspected LRA forces comprised of fighters, women, and porters, burned 1 home and looted 4 others near the center of Kiliwa, DRC. At that point, the local militia interfered and wounded 1 of the assailants, who then fled west.

4 armed and suspected LRA men speaking poor Lingala broke into multiple homes at Kiliwa, DRC. At least 1 couple was attacked. Various food and non-food items were looted. Security forces responded too late, but found evidence of the group moving east.

Approximately 20 suspected LRA forces looted 7 homes at 22:00 in Kiliwa, DRC. The assailants spoke Acholi and Bangala and looted food, blankets, oil, chickens, money and other unspecified goods. Security forces responded several hours later to no avail.
1 of the 2 brothers who had been abducted from Mangba, DRC on September 4th, 2010 escaped later that same day and reported that his brother had been killed.
LRA forces abducted 2 brothers from Mangba, DRC.

A single LRA man surprised a woman at Lisolo, DRC. He asked her for two buckets of cassava flour, which she gave him. He then gave her a letter that was difficult to read. The man had rasta-style hair and spoke poor Lingala.
At least 7 suspected LRA forces looted food and other goods from 6 households just northeast of Kiliwa, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces ambushed 2 motorcyclists and 3 cyclists along a road just northeast of Kiliwa, DRC. All their goods were looted except their bikes.
5 suspected and armed LRA men released a man and a woman after abducting them 4 hours earlier near Magombo, DRC.

5 suspected and armed LRA men briefly abducted a man and a woman near Magombo, DRC. The assailants looted the captives' goods, asked them several questions and then told them that they were hungry and needed food. The man and woman were not harmed.

At 11:00 AM, 7 suspected LRA forces ambushed several different groups of people near Magombo, DRC, along the road between Bangadi and Niangara.  They were armed with guns, machetes and knives and looted clothes, money, shoes and food.
LRA forces passed through near Tadu, DRC, and an abducted 16-year old boy was able to escape.
A group of LRA attacked a boy and his grandfather near Taduru, DRC, along the road. The boy was abducted, but his grandfather managed to escape.
On April 28th, 2009, LRA forces abducted 3 civilians and killed 1 other civilian in the Dungu territory in the DRC. At least 1 of the abducted was a 19-year-old girl who was taken near Ngilima, DRC.
Between November 7th and 8th, 2009, LRA forces abducted 2 children and burned 4 homes in Ngilima, DRC.
A large number of LRA forces were seen approximately 7 km from Ngilima, DRC on December 16th, 2009. Security forces sent troops to investigate the LRA activity.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 1 woman, mutilated another woman, and killed 2 women near Nglima, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Ngilima, DRC, killing 2 men, mutilating 1 woman, and abducting another.

Later on December 21st, 2009 (the same day as the civilian's abduction), the LRA members killed 3 of the original 10 abductees and released the remaining 7. The 10 civilians were originally abducted from Ngilima, DRC.
LRA members abducted 10 civilians from Ngilima, DRC as reported on December 21th, 2009.
Security forces captured 3 LRA members on December 25th, 2009 near Ngilima, DRC.
On December 25th, 2009, LRA forces were repulsed during an attack on Ngilima, DRC by security forces. One LRA member was wounded.

It was reported on January 7,  2010, that a woman who was abducted in Kpaika, DRC, in early December 2009 was able to escape LRA captivity. Date and location of her escape is unknown, however Ngilima is where she was debriefed.
LRA members abducted 1 young man on January 30th, 2010 from Ngilima, DRC. He was released the next day (see related incident).
On January 31th, 2010, LRA forces released 1 young man who had been abducted the day before near Ngilima, DRC.
Reported on February 6th, 2010, a young man escaped from LRA captivity near Ngilima, DRC. He had been abducted five months earlier, and there are very little details surrounding his abduction.
LRA members abducted 1 civilian on February 15th, 2010, from Ngilima, DRC.
An estimated 20 LRA members were seen around Ngilima, DRC on February 15th, 2010.
LRA forces abducted a 12-year-old child  near Ngilima, DRC, on May 10, 2010.
LRA forces abducted a young boy in Ngilima, DRC.
LRA combatants attacked 2 civilians near Ngilima, DRC on June 18th, 2010. 1 civilian was killed.
On June 24th, 2010, suspected LRA forces killed 3 civilians, and looted homes in Ngilima, DRC. LRA forces also reportedly abducted civilians, though the number is unknown.
A child who was abducted earlier in the day on July 10th, 2010 from Ngilima, DRC was able to escape from LRA captivity.
LRA forces reportedly looted a farm near Ngilima, DRC.
LRA forces reportedly attacked in the Ngilima area of the DRC killing and abducting an unknown number of people.
LRA forces were reportedly spotted near Ngilima, DRC.
On July 19, 2010, LRA forces attacked Pele, DRC, a community 25km from Ngilima, and abducted 2 civilians.
Suspected LRA forces attacked security forces at a checkpoint near Ngilima, DRC. The LRA forces stole various goods.
LRA forces attacked Ngilima, DRC and abducted a man.
3 members of the LRA were arrested by the security forces while trying to loot corn from a farm near Ngilima, DRC.
LRA elements reportedly attacked a couple in an IDP camp at Ngilima, DRC. The man was fatally shot and the woman was severely injured.

LRA forces attacked the villages Nambiongo, Ngilima and Limai, DRC reportedly killing 5 people and igniting a population movement towards Dungu, DRC. It is estimated that up to 1,700 people have been displaced.
2 LRA combatants entered Ngilima, DRC and abducted an 8-year-old boy east of the town, very close to a security force checkpoint. The LRA claimed to be there to protect civilians.
300 people have been displaced from Ngilima, DRC, to Bamokandi, DRC, due to LRA activity in and around Ngilima.
LRA forces attacked an elderly fisherman and 3 other men south of Ngilima, DRC. 1 man resisted and was killed, the others 3 were abducted.
LRA forces released 1 elderly man due to his age near Ngilima, DRC. The man was abducted on January 2nd. The 2 other men who were abducted with him are still missing.
Suspected LRA forces killed a total of seven people between June 13th and June 15th, 2011 in Ngilima, DRC. Reports indicate that eight LRA members were present.
Suspected LRA members released 3 bikers who had been abducted to carry goods, after several hours of captivity, on June 20th, 2011, in Ngilima, DRC.
On June 20th, 2011, suspected LRA members stopped 3 civilians on bikes on a road in Ngilima, DRC. The civilians were abducted to act as porters and their goods were looted.
During the week of August 5th, 15 LRA elements attempted to abduct a 15-year-old girl near Ngilima, DRC.

A hunter abducted by suspected LRA on February 6th 2012 escaped the same night near Ngilima, DRC. He described the combatants as including 3 armed men, 1 unarmed 18-year-old  person and 3 girls, who acted as translators.
7 LRA interrogated a Catholic catechist about the current state of Congolese politics near Ngilima, DRC. Several female members of the group reportedly translated from Acholi to Pazande.

3 LRA forces abducted a 40-year-old woman near Ngilima, DRC. They also looted food, clothing, machetes and other household items from a number of homes in the area. This was the first of 2 abductions by this group of assailants on February 19, 2012.
A group of 11 suspected LRA attacked 2 motorcyclists between Ngilima, DRC and the border of South Sudan. 1 of the travelers was killed during the attack, and the other is still missing.
Security forces clashed with a group of 8 LRA forces who had looted Ngilima, DRC earlier in the day. Upon hearing shots fired, the LRA abandoned their looted goods and fled.
On September 24, 2010, LRA forces attacked Taduru, DRC, killing 1 civilian and abducting another.
A large group of presumed LRA were spotted by 2 hunters along a path near Taduru, DRC.
Shortly after his initial abduction by LRA forces while hunting, a man escaped or was released from captivity near Taduru, DRC.
A group of 12 suspected LRA, consisting of 8 armed men and 4 boys, stole a man's watch, his tarp, and his bag of groundnuts as he was gathering them in his field east of Taduru, DRC.
4 suspected LRA attacked Mayabo, DRC, on June 5th, 2010 where they abducted 2 children, a woman, and wounded another civilian.
The woman who was abducted by the LRA in the attack on Mayabo, DRC, on June 5th, 2010, was released on June 6th, 2010, but the children were not.
On March 23rd, 2009, LRA forces attacked Melinda, DRC. No further details are known.
LRA forces attacked a member of a security force in Kirikwa, DRC.
3 presumed LRA combatants approached a woman while she was working in her field just west of Ngilima, DRC, and looted her machete and crops.

A 55-year-old Congolese man was abducted by 8 LRA forces, including 2 women and 1 girl. They were waiting for him in his home, east of Kiliwa, DRC. The group then looted a field belonging to two other civilians.
Two days after his abduction by 8 LRA forces, a 55-year-old Congolese man was released in the morning of December 23rd, 2013, at a field  previously looted by this same LRA group.
A suspected LRA member attempted to abduct a 60-year-old man as he was gathering palm nuts 1 kilometer northwest of Taduru, DRC. The man was able to escape and informed the community.

In the early morning of January 16th. 2013, 5 armed LRA men attacked 3 fishermen. 1 of them managed to escape but the other 2 were abducted. Their bodies were found on the following day, with a letter on them.
4 LRA members killed a civilian right outside of Ngilima, DRC on June 24th, 2010.

2 men and 1 woman fell into an ambush of 10 LRA forces. The assailants looted the victims and asked them questions regarding the movement of civilians on the road. The LRA forces then released the victims, warning them against going to security forces.

At least 4 LRA forces looted food and non-food items near Ngilima, DRC. 2 of the assailants were armed. Before leaving the assailants left this message: "We do not want to kill, but we are looking for food."
LRA forces killed 3 people, abducted 1 youth, and looted crops in an attack on Ngilima, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces attacked a home near Ngilima, DRC, seriously wounding a man and abducting his wife and 2 children.
As reported on Dec. 10th, 2009, 4 of the 8 abductees from the attack in Kpegba were released the same day as their abduction, and the other 4 the next day, in the week prior to this report.
As reported on Dec 10th 2009, LRA forces attacked Kpegba, DRC leading to 4 killed and 8 abducted. 4 of the abductees were released the same day and the other 4 the next day.
LRA attacked the community of Kpegba, DRC, killing 4 people, abducting 8, and mutilating 2.
LRA forces mutilated 6 people at the village of Kpegba, DRC on December 19th, 2009. Their lips and ears were cut off.
3 men abducted by LRA forces in Kpegba, DRC earlier during the day on July 18th, 2010 were quickly able to escape.
Reported LRA forces abducted 3 men in Kpegba, DRC, but they were quickly able to escape.
Suspected LRA forces attacked the community of Kpegba, DRC.

12 LRA forces ambushed and abducted 4 people, including 2 men and a boy near Kpegba, DRC as they were traveling from Anduala to Ngilima,. The group of LRA and their abductees traveled back toward Anduala, DRC after the incident.

A man escaped from the LRA and arrived in Kpegba, DRC, where the Chef de localit fed him and gave him shelter before sending him on to Ngilima. He was abducted a day earlier by a man with one eye, a woman, and a girl, who all spoke an unknown language.
11 suspected LRA forces abducted 2 men from a village about 2.5 km north of Ngilima, DRC.

11 suspected LRA forces looted 8 homes about 2.5 km north of Ngilima, DRC. 2 men who had been abducted earlier by the group managed to escape. After the looting, the group of suspected LRA headed west in the direction of Niangara, DRC.
7 suspected LRA abducted a hunter on February 6th, 2012 near Ngilima, DRC. He had been on the way to warn his family of a suspected LRA presence in the area when he was abducted.

Security forces captured 1 suspected LRA member near Ngilima, DRC. The individual claimed that he was sent to obtain food and batteries for flashlights. He also reported that his group consisted of 20 people and that they were extremely hungry.
LRA members abducted 7 civilians on May 27th, 2010, at Bamudanga, DRC.
During the month of May 2011, suspected LRA forces abducted a combined total of 22 civilians during attacks on Bamundanga, Lolo, Balipio and Mulundu, DRC.
3 civilians were abducted on May 25th, 2009 in Buye, DRC.
More than half of the 55 abductees from the recent LRA attack on Dakwa, DRC, escaped when security forces engaged the LRA near Buye, DRC.
On September 1st, 2009, 3 civilians were killed and 2 were abducted by LRA forces in Buye, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Buye, DRC, killing four people and looting homes.
Security forces and LRA forces clashed in Buye, DRC, around March 19th, 2010. 1 young girl who had been abducted was able to escape and later be reunited with her family.
Suspected LRA abducted 2 civilians near Buye, DRC.

2 armed and suspected LRA men stopped a woman 3 km north of Kiliwa, DRC, as she was traveling to her field. They asked her if she was alone and she lied, telling them that they there were many people close behind her. The men then fled into the bush.

Park guards battled with 27 LRA forces northeast of Nagero, DRC, in the Garamba National Park. The LRA forces fled, and the park guards retreated to find reinforcements. This group of LRA is under the command of a man named "Mandela".
3 suspected LRA ambushed and looted a group of cyclists near Anduala, DRC. No one was injured during the attack.

2 LRA officers were killed in a series of clashes with security forces. These clashes happened in the general Garamba National Park/Faradje region of the DRC. These clashes also occurred over a number of days.
1 person was killed and an undetermined number were abducted in an attack on Samongo, DRC. Around 678 people fled south (including 413 children) and were displaced as a result of this attack.
LRA members abducted 1 civilian from Samongo, DRC, on September 15th, 2009.
A several day clash from June 14th, 2010 and June 18th, 2010 in Samongo, DRC between security forces and the LRA  led to the death of 2 LRA and the freeing of 9 civilians.
7 suspected LRA (3 armed, 2 women, and 2 young boys) stopped a man on his motorbike and looted his food, phone, and money. This happened north of Djabir, DRC on the road between Aba and Tekadje, DRC.

16 LRA forces, comprised of 8 armed men, 3 armed boys, and 5 unarmed women, ambushed 5 men traveling toward Nambiapai, DRC. 3 of the men were abducted, while the other 2 escaped immediately. Food, clothing, and money were looted from the victims.
LRA forces clashed with security forces on January 3rd, 2009, near Lasu, southern Sudan, which led to the capture of 5 LRA forces.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a man who was hunting with his 2 friends about 5 km northeast of Taduru, DRC. The victim's friends fled to Taduru to report the incident.
On November 26, 2009, LRA forces killed 8 civilians in Nakwa, DRC.
6 suspected LRA members stopped 2 men near Nakwa, DRC and stole their clothes before releasing them.

34 armed LRA forces, including 4 women, ambushed an elderly man and his young son near Kiliwa, DRC. The assailants said that they did not want to hurt them, but that they needed food. The man and the boy then took them to a field, which they looted.

Approximately 40 armed LRA forces looted multiple fields of corn, cassava and peanuts 3 km north of Kiliwa, DRC. Security forces followed the assailants, but could not engage them due to being heavily outnumbered.
A day after their initial abduction, 3 civilians were released by LRA forces after their clothes, money, and food had been stolen. They were released roughly 17 km east/northeast of Kiliwa, DRC.
Security forces fired on suspected LRA forces, resulting in the deaths of an unknown amount of LRA near Mabadabada, DRC.

6 LRA forces, comprised of 3 men and 3 women armed with AK-47's, stopped a motorcyclist near Mabadabada, DRC. They looted the man's luggage but left him 5 pieces of clothing after he begged them. The assailants spoke poor Lingala and Acholi.
LRA forces ambushed and looted goods from at least 4 groups of civilians over a period of 2 hours on the road north of Kiliwa, DRC.

13 suspected and armed LRA forces attacked Basokpio, DRC, and systematically looted several households overnight from April 9th to 10th. They assailants looted various items, and fired many bullets into the air to disperse the population.

A group of 4 suspected LRA forces were spotted carrying an injured man east across the Kiliwa-Nambiapai road in the DRC. This is possibly related to a clash between the LRA and security forces earlier in the day.

4 armed and suspected LRA forces, comprised of 2 men & 2 women, attempted to stop a Congolese man and a 10-year-old child who were traveling near Li-soki, DRC by motorcycle. However, they managed to escape and report the incident.

2 hunters sighted a camp and a large group of suspected LRA forces composed of men, women and children on the bank of  the Tuku stream near Nambia, DRC. On the other side of the stream, they could see a decaying corpse tied up to a tree.
LRA forces abducted 2 young women from Ngalu, DRC, on February 5th, 2011.
On January 30th, 2010, a clash between security forces and LRA members in Ngilima, DRC resulted in the death of 1 LRA member and 1 LRA member was injured.
LRA forces attacked Nagilidangwa, DRC, on January 5th, 2010, killing 4 people, abducting 5, and wounding 5. Following this attack LRA forces clashed with security forces in the same community.
LRA forces and security forces clashed at Nagilidangwa, DRC on June 16th, 2010. 3 children were able to escapes during the clash.
Suspected LRA forces clashed with a security force in Nagilidangwa, DRC. An unknown number of LRA were wounded.

After LRA forces abducted young boy in Ngilima, DRC on June 6th, he was brutally attacked while in captivity and was left for dead. When he regained consciousness, he walked to Anduala, DRC and was transferred for medical help.
On Christmas Eve, the LRA attacked Anduala, DRC, killing a 40-year-old man.
LRA combatants attacked Anduala, DRC, killing 2 and abducting an unconfirmed number of civilians.
LRA forces attacked Anduala, DRC, on January 5, 2011, and killed 1 man.
LRA forces attacked Anduala, DRC, killing 1 man and abducted another man.
A young man who was recently abducted by LRA combatants while gathering palm oil escaped near Anduala, DRC, and fled back into the town.
LRA  forces released a 9-year-old boy in Anduala, DRC, after looting all of his belongings. The boy was then instructed to inform security forces that there are large numbers of LRA in the area.
4 LRA combatants abducted a 9-year-old boy from Anduala, DRC, and looted all of his belongings. He was released shortly after being abducted.
After killing a man who was abducted with his wife and child earlier in the day, the 7 LRA forces released the wife and child near Liakangu, DRC, which is near Ngilima, DRC.
LRA forces fatally shot a man in the head as he attempted to escape near Liakangu, DRC. The man had been abducted earlier in the day, along with his wife and child.
Suspected  LRA reportedly abducted 7 civilians in the evening in Liakangu, DRC.

7 LRA forces came across a 55-year-old woman and her son in Liakangu, DRC, and looted their food. The woman was abducted, but the son quickly escaped. He reported that the assailants consisted of 4 armed men and 3 women and that they spoke a poor Lingala.
After abducting a 55-year-old woman, 7 LRA forces released the woman the next day and abducted 2 Congolese boys of 12 and 13 years old. They then looted food and non-food items from 3 households.
LRA members killed 2 civilians on January 21, 2010 at Nangba, DRC.

LRA forces released a man and a 27-year-old woman who had been abducted the previous day along the Dungu-Faradje road in the DRC. They were released in the Garamba National Park, roughly 30 km north of the road. The 13-year-old girl remained in captivity.

16 LRA forces, comprised of both men, women, & children, clashed w/ a group of park rangers 23 km north of Nagero, DRC, in the Garamba Nat'l Park. The rangers returned fire, killing 2 Congolese LRA girls and wounding 1 Ugandan LRA man, who they captured.

A day after LRA forces looted fields between Nambili and Kapili, DRC, security forces tracked the group to an LRA camp south of Kapili. The camp had been freshly abandoned as evidenced by the valuables left behind and the still-warm cooking water.
4 suspected LRA ambushed a 35-year-old man as he was riding his motorcycle near Soki, DRC, and looted all of his belongings, including used clothing, money, and the motorcycle battery.

Shortly after 2 travelers were abducted near Soki, DRC, and used as porters by suspected LRA forces, they were released. The travelers retrieved their abandoned bikes and reunited with their other 2 companions before continuing on toward Doruma.

3 suspected LRA forces made up of 2 men and 1 boy, ambushed 4 travelers and briefly abducted 2 of them who were used to transport looted goods. Various goods were looted including clothing and a motorcycle battery. This incident took place near Soki, DRC.

Several suspected LRA soldiers opened fire on a soldier and a taxi driver 7 km north of Kiliwa, DRC. The soldier fell and pretended to be dead and when an assailant approached, the soldier shot and killed him. The other assailants fled.
LRA forces abducted 2 adults just north of Kiliwa, DRC, on March 21st, 2010.

7 armed and suspected LRA forces ambushed 3 men east of Kiliwa, DRC. 2 of the men managed to escape, but the 3rd was caught and beaten with his own gun until it broke when he refused to transport goods for the assailants.

A group of 30 LRA combatants, under the command of a man named "Mandela", attacked a group of national park guards approximately 12km from the Garamba National Park headquarters in Nagero, DRC. The combatants and park guards exchanged fire for 1 hour.
Security forces rescued 1 child from LRA forces during a pursuit of the group. The group of LRA had recently abducted 3 children from Bwere, DRC.
LRA elements attacked Bwere, DRC. They abducted 3 children and looted several homes. Security forces pursued the group.
2 pregnant females, a Congolese girl and a Ugandan woman, escaped from LRA captivity. They reported to security forces based in Bwere, DRC.
LRA members killed 2 civilians and injured 1 civilian outside of Ngilima, DRC on January 25th, 2010.
7 LRA forces released 3 men near Ngilima, DRC on the same day as their abduction. The men were interrogated during their captivity. One of the abducted men was deaf.
Park guards discovered a suspected LRA camp in the Garamba National Park in the DRC. Clothing, food, shelter and a 5 liter water tank were found.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces at Magbusulu, DRC on April 21st, 2010. 2 LRA forces were killed and 5 abductees were released.
5 LRA members abducted 4 civilians from Mandungula, DRC on March 23rd, 2011.
While in captivity, both the women in the group of 4 who were abducted from Mandungula, DRC were brutally raped, 1 of whom was pregnant and lost her child.
The 4 abductees abducted from Madungula, DRC on March 23rd returned. The men were able to escape unharmed, however, both the women were brutally raped, one of whom was pregnant and lost her child.

7 suspected LRA members ambushed 2 men on motorcycles at Kulugbangu, DRC.  The armed men looted their goods including 35,000 Congolese francs and their motorcycle batteries. They were described as wearing tattered uniforms and speaking broken Lingala.
A 20-year-old man was abducted near Ngilima, DRC. This abduction was the first of three by the same group of 7 suspected LRA, in the same location and on the same day.
3 presumed LRA combatants approached a group of men working in a field near Ngilima, DRC. The civilians fled and were unharmed.
3 workers from the International Committee of the Red Cross were fired upon outside of Dakwa, DRC. Their luggage, GPS, laptop, and money were stolen.

An LRA group of men, women, girls & boys ambushed 8 travelers 8 km north of Kiliwa, DRC, and looted all the goods they were carrying including paddy, cassava, flour, peanuts, clothes & other goods. The assailants spoke Acholi, Bangala and Pazande.

A fisherman setting up his net at the Mbwele river near Nangilidawke, DRC sighted 3 suspected LRA, 2 men holding firearms and 1 woman carrying goods. 1 of the men fired at the fisherman and shot him in the left hand.
LRA forces looted goods outside of Ango, DRC on February 17th, 2011.

2 hunters, accompanied by 1 Security Force soldier, went hunting in Magbanga, DRC. They were attacked by possible LRA wearing old Security Force uniforms. The suspected LRA shot at them, but all 3 were able to escape.
Around 5:00 PM, 7 suspected LRA abducted a man near Ngilima, DRC. This abduction was the second of three by the same group, in the same location and on the same day.
7 suspected LRA abducted a 23-year-old deaf man near Ngilima, DRC. This abduction was the third of three by the same group, in the same location and on the same day.
7 suspected LRA looted a home near Ngilima, DRC. They looted ground nuts, rice and 30 liters of palm oil. Earlier that day, the same group abducted 3 people.
2 women who had been abducted by LRA forces were freed by security forces on June 16th, 2011, outside of Ngilima, DRC. This is an approximate location.
Security forces discovered a suspected LRA camp that housed 60 people. It was found northeast of Niangara, DRC. This location is an estimate.
A long-time fighter with the LRA, a female, escaped into Kpanzu, DRC, near Bangadi.
LRA forces clashed with security forces east of Ango, DRC along the road.
On July 6th, a girl who had escaped from the LRA a few days earlier was found by 2 hunters near Biliki, DRC. She was originally abducted in March of 2011.
A group of LRA forces, including an armed combatant and a woman with a baby, looted 7 households in Ngilima, DRC. Security forces were informed by civilians following the attack.
4 LRA forces were captured by regional security forces at Kakilo, DRC on April 25th, 2010.

A hunter sighted 7 suspected LRA forces near Kiliwa, DRC, moving westwards. They were all armed men and wearing a combination of military uniforms and civilian clothing. Local security forces were alerted and organized a pursuit.
LRA forces were sighted in Anduala, DRC.
On January 16th, 2010, LRA and security forces clashed in the town of Anduala, DRC. 1 LRA member was killed.
LRA forces killed 2 men and abducted 1 woman on January 20th, 2010, at Anduala, DRC.
LRA members killed 2 civilians on February 10th, 2010, at Anduala, DRC.
On March 5, 2010, LRA forces abducted 12 civilians from the Anduala locality in the DRC.
At least 2 men were killed when LRA forces attacked Anduala, DRC. Security forces chased the LRA out of town.

After abducting 4 travelers near Anduala, DRC, suspected LRA forces returned to Anduala with their new captives and looted food and clothes. Security forces opened fire and the 4 captives escaped while the suspected LRA fled. 1 suspected LRA was injured.
LRA forces attacked Nambili, DRC, killing and abducting an unknown number of civilians. This is part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.
2 armed LRA forces attacked the community of Nambili, DRC and looted goods. They also attempted to abduct a family, but were repelled by local militia forces.

A 10-year-old boy was abducted by suspected LRA forces from Bangboloko, DRC. He was looking for food in a field when he was abducted. The LRA group was composed of 2 combatants and one 16-year-old girl.
On August 24th, 2012, 6 armed suspected LRA forces looted various crops from a field in Anduala, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Mangbungulu, DRC, abducting 6 people and looting the local health center.
LRA forces abducted 8 people, including a woman, from Mangbungulu, DRC. One civilian was also killed.

A group of 60 LRA attacked security forces and exchanged fire at Mangbungulu, DRC. Several houses and part of the school and hospital were destroyed. Various goods, including medicine, were looted. A 23-year-old woman and an 11-year-old boy were abducted.

An 18-year-old Congolese man going from Bangadi to Nambia-Ngbangala, DRC, was ambushed by 2 armed LRA forces accompanied by 6 children, of which 3 were girls. They looted paddy and 2 small batteries that the victim was carrying on his bike.

3 armed and suspected LRA men ambushed 2 women 5 km east of Dakwa, DRC. The women fled and the assailants pursued them, but a security force vehicle happen to drive by. The armed men then fled into the bush after looting various goods.
On January 8th, 2010, a group of suspected LRA members were sighted at Kpatamasua, DRC, 5km from Ngilima along Bayote road in Dungu, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Lemyo, DRC, north of Faradje, DRC before security forces intervened. In the attack, the LRA forces burned homes and abducted an unknown number of children.
2 suspected LRA members were sighted just north of Anduala, DRC.
During the month of May, 2009, LRA forces attacked Dakwa, DRC and killed 1 police officer.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and abducted 55 others in an attack on Dakwa, DRC that lasted from June 2nd to June 3rd, 2009.
On July 14th, 2009, 1 LRA force was reportedly killed by civilians in an attempted attack on Dakwa, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person in the forest near Dakwa, DRC, in mid-September, 2009.
LRA forces abducted 4 adults from Dakwa, DRC, on February 10th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 2 people outside of the community of Dakwa, DRC.

Between March 15th and March 20th, 2010, LRA forces attacked the villages of Sukadi, Dakwa, Digba and Banda, DRC. Overall, 20 people were killed and 15 abducted. The remaining populations fled. The numbers are split between 3 incidents.
LRA forces killed 6 people near the Api river, which is located in the Dakwa area of the DRC. These killings happened during the month of April 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 person in an attack on Madi, DRC, which is 40 km from the town of Dakwa. The precise location of Madi is unknown, and this attack occurred during the month of May in 2010.
LRA forces were carried were active near Dakwa, DRC. No further details are known.
Sometime around mid-December 2010, LRA forces abducted a boy from Dakwa, DRC.

A 17-year-old boy was confronted near Anduala, DRC, by a woman he suspected to be LRA. The woman asked him to wait, but the boy fled and alerted the community. The woman spoke poor Lingala and wore a mixture of civilian and military clothing.

Suspected LRA forces attacked 5 civilians near a river near Nambia, DRC, on June 12th, 2011. 4 of them were killed by both gunshots and machete blows. 1 pregnant woman was let go and claimed the group had 3 young girls, likely abductees, with them.

LRA forces arrived in Kapili, DRC, on May 20th, 2008, and started looting the local population.  As reported on May 27th, 2008, LRA forces overtook the locality and abducted one woman, leading to the displacement of the whole population.
LRA forces attacked Kapili, DRC, abducting an unknown number of people and looting humanitarian-distributed goods.
On December 1, 2009, LRA forces clashed with unknown armed group near the Kapili river, DRC. At least 1 LRA member was killed.
LRA combatants and security forces clashed near Kapili, DRC.
LRA members attacked Kapili, DRC, killing 1 civilian and wounding another.
A civilian, who was recently abducted with 2 children from Kapili, DRC, was able to escape on July 14th, 2010.
LRA forces abducted an adult and 2 children from Kapili, DRC.
Reported LRA forces abducted 6 people from Kapili, DRC.

At 8:00 PM on March 24th, 2011, security forces pursued the group of LRA that had abducted 5 people earlier in the day. As a result, 4 of the 5 people abducted by the LRA forces returned to Kapili, DRC. A 10-year-old child is still with the LRA.
On March 24th, 2011, LRA forces abducted 5 civilians as they were fishing near Kapili, DRC, and forced the abductees to lead them back to Kapili, which they looted.
An LRA combatant killed a 30-year-old man near Kapili, DRC. The body was found and buried the following day.
5 suspected and armed LRA forces released a man they had abducted near Baswe Biama a day earlier. He had been forced to march for a day before he was released near Kapili, DRC.
On February 25th, 2013, suspected LRA forces attacked Kapili, DRC, and looted food and non-food items from 3 households.
On March 5th, 2013, suspected  LRA forces comprised of 3 elements and 2 women reportedly looted and abducted a 17-years-old boy going from Kapili to Ngilima, DRC.
5 suspected and armed LRA forces released a couple they had abducted 6 hours earlier after they interrogated them. The couple was abducted from Kapili, DRC.

5 suspected and armed LRA forces briefly abducted an adult couple from Kapili, DRC. The assailants took the couple deep into the bush and interrogated them about the location of security forces and the local opinion on the LRA.
Civilians spotted 2 armed suspected LRA forces  crossing a road and heading east 11 km south of Kiliwa, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person at Yamba, DRC.
LRA forces killed 2 civilians in Yamba, DRC, on September 16th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 1 person in Yamba, DRC.
Security forces and the LRA clashed in Yamba, DRC resulting in the death of 3 LRA.
Suspected LRA forces released a man after abducting him, along with his son, on a bridge near Yamba, DRC. The man's son remains in captivity.
A group of 4 suspected LRA abducted a man and his 12-year-old son as they crossed a bridge near Yamba, DRC.

8 suspected and armed LRA forces ambushed 5 men 20 km north of Nambia, DRC, in the late afternoon. 1 man was abducted, but the other 4 managed to escape. Unspecified goods were looted during the attack and the assailants moved toward Mbware.
8 suspected and armed LRA forces released a man in the morning after they had abducted him the night before 20 km north of Nambia, DRC.
Reported LRA forces attacked the community of Tadu, DRC. It is unknown how many people were affected by this attack.
Around June 4th, 2011, LRA forces abducted 1 man from Tadu, DRC. 5 previously abducted people were recognized in the LRA group.

Suspected LRA forces attacked a woman and 3-year-old child in their field on June 8, 2011 in Tadu, DRC. The woman was shot, but not reported as killed, and the child abducted. That these were LRA forces is not confirmed, but there are several indicators.
Civilians spotted more than 20 suspected LRA forces consisting of armed men, women, and children in military uniforms crossing a road north of Kiliwa, DRC. They were heavily loaded with goods.
2 civilians were killed by LRA combatants in Gongolo, DRC on June 25th, 2010.
LRA members abducted a woman and her child from Gongolo, DRC, on March 24th, 2011.
LRA combatants ambushed a 32 year old man on October 25th in Gongolo, DRC. The outcome of the attack is unclear, but the man was not killed.

A lone and armed LRA man stopped a cyclist near Gongolo, DRC. The two men could not understand each other. The cyclist yelled for help and nearby security forces responded. The LRA member attempted to flee, but was shot and killed.

8 armed & suspected LRA forces, who were hidden in a house along the road near Gongolo, DRC, ambushed 2 men and a woman. The civilians fled and alerted nearby security forces who responded too late. The assailants looted various goods before fleeing east

3 armed and suspected LRA forces attacked 3 people on a motorcycle near Gongolo, DRC, including a 23-year-old woman and her 6-month-old baby. The victims fled and the assailants looted clothing, money, gas and other goods.
A group of 8 suspected LRA forces, composed of 2 armed assailants, 3 unarmed assailants, and 3 children, looted food items from 5 households in Gongolo, DRC.

Suspected LRA forces looted 7 houses 1 kilometer north of Kapili, DRC. The looting occurred while the population mourned a hunter who was killed two days earlier. Security forces shot at the looters who fled. The looters stole crops later that night.
Sister Jeanne Yengane was killed and 4 others seriously wounded when 11 LRA attacked their car on the road from Kana, DRC toward Ngilima, DRC.

4 armed LRA elements attacked 3 cyclists on their way home from Bangadi, DRC in Mbiangu, DRC. The cyclists escaped abduction by running away, but the LRA combatants looted all of their goods with the exception of the bicycles.

2 motorcyclists and 1 bicyclist were ambushed by uniformed LRA forces near Mbiangu, DRC. The bicyclist was abducted and the motorcyclists released. All goods, with the exception of the motorcycle and fuel can, were looted from the scene.
A group of 5 armed suspected LRA forces ambushed 3 people in Mbiangu, DRC, and abducted 1 of the men. The assailants also looted the travelers' goods.
Suspected LRA forces ambushed a man near Mbiangu, DRC. They burned his motorcycle and looted all of his goods.
Suspected LRA forces consisting of 7 men, 2 women and a child abducted a man and a woman while they were extracting palm oil in the bush near Mbiangu, DRC.
LRA forces attacked security forces near Ngilima, DRC.
A young woman escaped from LRA captivity  north of Ngilima, DRC, on February 24th, 2010. The mapped location is an estimate.
A 19-year-old woman escaped from the LRA and spent three days in the forest before coming out at Kumbolongo, DRC.
3 suspected LRA combatants abducted a teenaged girl as she was fishing with her parents near Nambili, DRC.
A group of suspected LRA looted unspecified goods from Kumbolongo, DRC.
2 armed LRA men attacked Kumbolongo, DRC, but were repelled by a local militia force.
LRA members abducted 2 civilians outside of Kapili, DRC, on February 10th, 2010. 1 of the civilians escaped 5 days later.
The same group of LRA forces that attacked Nganzi a day earlier abducted an old man near Nganzi, DRC, while on their way to Garamba National Park.
The old man that was abducted earlier the same day near Nganzi, DRC, was released about two hours after his abduction.
2 merchants on bicycles were ambushed by 4 armed suspected LRA forces near Ngilima, DRC. All of their goods were looted.
LRA forces reportedly carried out an attack 30 km from Ango, DRC. No further details are known.

LRA forces abducted 5 boys under the age of 10 from Dikumu Primary School in Ango territory, DRC. This abduction caused a panic in the local community so people fled south to Dingila. The location of this attack is an estimate.
A 17-year-old boy was abducted from Ango, DRC, sometime around December 5th, 2010.

During the month of May 2011, a combined total of 22 civilians were abducted by suspected LRA forces in attacks on Bamundanga, Lolo, Mulundu and Balipio, DRC. The latter is located 12 km away from Ango, DRC.

LRA forces attacked 3 communities outside Ango, DRC around 11:00 pm on May 18th, 2011. (Lolo, Mulundu, Bambang, DRC) In total, 22 civilians were abducted -- 13 were children. Large amounts of household goods and seed were also stolen.

An unknown number of armed LRA forces robbed civilians performing maintenance on a road near Ango, DRC. They stole computer parts and the battery of a motorbike between 12:00 and 4:00am on May 19th. Abductions were reported, but the details are unknown.
LRA forces attacked the village of Ngulu, DRC mutilating 2 people and wounding another in an injury of an unknown nature.
LRA forces attacked security forces near Ngulu, DRC. During the clash, a 12-year-old boy managed to escape from the LRA.
As reported on February 1st, 2013, security forces have reported that suspected LRA forces have established a camp in Ngulu, DRC.

At 10:00 in the morning, at least 10 suspected LRA forces ambushed 2 motorcyclists who were traveling from Nambili on their way to Ngilima, DRC. The assailants looted unspecified goods from the travelers.
LRA forces were spotted near the village of Badri, DRC.
Community members near Badri, DRC saw suspected LRA in their fields. Some of community member's rations were stolen.

A suspected LRA combatant killed a man and abducted the deceased man's wife after burning down a security force base in Badri, DRC. The assailant also looted 3 separate households, and fired multiple shots in the air before fleeing towards South Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a woman and her 2 young daughters, one who was 4-years-old and the other who was 11-months-old, from Badri, DRC.

4 suspected LRA forces attacked 2 brothers who were working  in a field south of Bangadi, DRC along the road to Niangara. The younger brother, aged 12, was abducted, but because he resisted his abduction the group beat his 21-year-old brother.

5 suspected and armed LRA forces ambushed 2 men at Baswe Biama, DRC, which is between Ngilima and Kapili. 1 man fled to alert security forces, but the other was abducted. The assailants also looted 2 sacks of corn flour.
18 LRA were reportedly killed by security forces as they were crossing a road near Imma, DRC. This date is an estimate give or take several days.

2 suspected LRA men attacked and looted 2 women 35 km along the road east of Ango, DRC toward Bayule. Cigarettes and money were stolen, and the men interrogated the women about their identity and the location of security forces in the area.
7 LRA abducted a man, his wife and their child earlier in the morning from a field near Ligungu, DRC.
5 LRA forces were spotted at Tekadje, which is near Faradje, DRC on Dec. 3rd, 2010.
Security forces clashed with the LRA at the border outpost of Lasso, DRC. 2 LRA forces were killed and 1 more was captured.

The 16 LRA fighters and their captives from the attack on Lolo, DR, two days earlier marched north. 1 LRA member hid supplies in the bush, and then the group split in 2 and went different directions. This was near Bayule, north of Lolo.
Security forces clashed with LRA members at Solonga, DRC, which is near Bangadi, DRC. 1 LRA member was killed.
Security forces engaged and killed 1 LRA member at the village of Solonga, DRC.
3 suspected LRA forces ambushed a man 7 km north of Kiliwa, DRC, as he was traveling on his motorcycle to the market to sell goods. The assailants looted all of his belongings.

A 27-year-old man was ambushed by 5 suspected and armed LRA forces 3 km southwest of Kana, DRC, along the road to Bangadi. The assailants looted tea and beer and other goods, and then burned the rest of the man's goods before releasing him.
4 LRA forces attacked and looted food and non-food items from a group of farmers near Bangadi, DRC. They abducted 2 children, a boy and a girl, of around 13 years old, before leaving to the south.
LRA forces reportedly killed the 3 civilians that had been abducted on May 13th, 2010, near Bangadi, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 3 civilians on May 13th, 2010, southwest of Bangadi, DRC. The 3 civilians were later killed.
Security forces attacked an LRA camp near Gangala na Bodio, DRC, killing approximately 5 LRA and rescuing 5 abducted children.
5 teenagers who had been abducted by LRA combatants were able to escape from Camp Swahili in Garamba Nation Park, DRC, on August 10th, 2009.
Suspected LRA forces attacked a civilian traveling near Ngilima, DRC and looted all of his belongings.
