Of the 2 children abducted from Ligungu, DRC on February 10th, 2010, 1 was killed by LRA members and the other was rescued.
LRA members abducted 2 children from Ligungu, DRC on February 10th, 2010. One was later killed and the other released, see related incident.
Security forces and LRA forces clashed near Lema, DRC on June 14th, 2009. 1 member of the LRA was killed.
Security forces captured 1 LRA member at Lema, DRC on July 1st, 2009.
8 LRA forces looted crops and occupied Lema, DRC for two days.
7 LRA arrived in Lema, DRC and looted crops. This information was reported on November 26th.

Security forces discovered an empty LRA camp that had been inhabited by 20-30 people. Hot food and water and other supplies were found at the camp, showing that it was recently abandoned. The camp was located roughly 5 km east of Kana, DRC.

On the morning of February 20th, 6 LRA forces attacked a group of 6 motorcyclists traveling from Dungu to Bangadi, DRC. A 30-year-old man was killed, and 3 others were injured - a man, a woman and her 9 month old baby who lost two fingers.
4 suspected LRA members chased a cyclist as he was traveling along the road near Kpatanabu, DRC. The man fled and alerted the community. The suspected LRA forces then retreated back into the forest.

On February 24th, 2013, 6 LRA forces ambushed   2 men on a motorcycle in Kpatanabu, DRC. One of the men was injured by the LRA before they both managed to escape, leaving the LRA to loot their belongings.
7 LRA forces released a man and a woman two hours after they abducted them during an ambush near Kpatanabu, DRC.

7 armed LRA forces ambushed 5 men and 1 woman near Kpatanabu, DRC. The assailants looted all the goods that were being carried including 2 boxes of soap, matches and other various goods. A woman and man were also briefly abducted.

3 armed & suspected LRA attacked 2 men, a 20-year-old woman and her baby at Kpatanadu, DRC. The woman was injured by a blow to the head and various goods were looted. A security force patrol saw the attack and exchanged fire with the assailants who fled.

A Congolese merchant on a motorcycle going from Ngilima for Bangadi, DRC, was ambushed and looted by 10 armed LRA forces, accompanied by women and children. The man managed to escape and inform security forces, who shot at the assailants.
On September 21, 2009, LRA forces killed 5 civilians in Diadupo, DRC.
On January 21st, 2010, LRA forces killed 10 civilians in the village of Diadupo, DRC.
8 LRA forces abducted 3 fishermen near Diadupo, DRC. 4 of the 8 LRA were children. This is the first of 2 abductions in this series.

5 fishermen, abducted on March 2nd, were released by the LRA near Diadupo, DRC. The fishermen were sent with a message instructing civilians to avoid confronting other LRA combatants in the forest, and to never report incidents to local security forces.
8 LRA forces abducted 2 fishermen near Diadupo, DRC. 4 of the 8 LRA were children. This is the second of 2 abductions in this series.
Suspected LRA abducted 2 fisherman, both approximately 50 years old, near Diadupo, DRC.
3 armed and suspected LRA forces abducted 4 fisherman near Diadupo, DRC.
1 of the 2 men and the girl abducted earlier in the day on their way back from Nambiapai, DRC, managed to escape. The third man is believed to still be in the bush in captivity.
On March 5th, 2013, 1 LRA member abducted a 15-year-old girl and 2 men as they were returning from the market in Nambiapai towards Ngilima, DRC. The LRA member also looted their goods.
On September 5, 2009, LRA forces killed 2 civilians and abducted 2 others in Kana, DRC.
On August 15, 2010, LRA forces killed 1 civilian 2 km from Kana, DRC.
6 LRA forces ambushed and killed a security force soldier near Kana, DRC. They looted his weapon, ammunition, and uniform.

In the early morning, 5 suspected LRA stopped 2 traders leaving Kana, DRC. They took them a few meters into the forest, off of the main road, and asked them many questions. The traders were then released.
A man, abducted by suspected LRA forces earlier in the day, escaped near Kana, DRC.
A woman abducted in an LRA attack on Kana, DRC was released on the same day of her abduction, September 4th, 2009.
LRA forces attacked Kana, DRC on September 4th, 2009. 1 woman was abducted and a local militia member was killed. The woman was later released (see related incident)
On 12 September 2009, LRA forces attacked Kana, DRC looting and burning homes.
LRA forces killed 1 civilians and abducted 1 other   civilian at Kana II, DRC, on March 26th, 2010.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces near Kana, DRC, resulting in the death of 1 LRA member.
Regional security forces rescued a woman who had been abducted by LRA forces earlier in the day from Kana, DRC.
LRA forces abducted a woman and a 13-year-old girl from Kana, DRC.
After clashing with LRA forces, security forces rescued a boy near Kana, DRC on July 5th, 2011.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 13 civilians from Badale, DRC.

Roughly 10 LRA forces looted cassava, nuts, and corn from fields at Nambili, DRC. Security forces responded and exchanged fire, and 1 assailant was reportedly injured. Security forces pursued the LRA as they fled.
4 LRA forces, 3 of which were armed, looted 16 farmers. They then kept the civilians in captivity overnight, south-east of Bangadi, DRC.
The 16 farmers kept in captivity overnight by 4 LRA forces south-east of Bangadi, DRC, managed to escape following an altercation between one of the farmers and an LRA member.
15 suspected LRA forces were spotted 20 km northwest of Samongo, DRC, near the Dakpa river.
LRA forces abducted 10 people, including a 12-year-old girl and 6 children, from near Batalagi, DRC, during the month of December in 2009.
LRA forces abducted 12 civilians and burned down homes in an attack on Batalagi, DRC, on February 11th, 2010.
LRA members killed 2 civilians on February 26th, 2010, at Batalagi, DRC.

A Congolese cyclist was ambushed by 4 armed suspected LRA forces in Yamba, DRC. The leader among the 4 assailants was reported to be a woman, and she demanded the cyclist to show them the way to Nambia, DRC. The assailants then retreated into the bush.
LRA members were threatening internally displaced persons at a river near Kpaika, DRC when security forces intervened, killing 2 LRA members. Plotted location is approximate.
LRA forces clashed with security forces on May 7th, 2010 west of Kpaika, DRC. 2 abductees were released as a result.
Security forces and suspected LRA combatants clashed near the Mbwele river, which is 35 km south of Diagbe in the DRC. No further information was provided.
7 suspected LRA forces shot at a park guard light aircraft that was performing a routine patrol near Nagero, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces clashed with security forces on May 16th, 2010 near Kpaika, DRC. 1 LRA member was killed.
5 suspected LRA forces released a 60-year-old man they had recently abducted near Kpaika, DRC.

5 armed suspected LRA men abducted a 60-year-old man from his field just west of Kpaika, DRC and then looted food, an ax, and clothes. The man also reportedly heard more assailants nearby, but did not see them.

7 armed and suspected LRA men looted multiple households during a night raid at Kpaika, DRC. They looted food and clothing before fleeing. Security forces and locals pursued the assailants and during an exchange of fire, a 28-year-old man was wounded.
15 adults and 3 boys who had been abducted by LRA forces from Kpaika, DRC, were killed because they were not walking fast enough.

LRA forces attacked Kpaika, DRC, killing an unknown number of civilians and abducting at least 41 children and 15 adults. This is part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.

On October 25th, 2008, security forces and about 30 suspected LRA forces clashed 5 km away from Kpaika, DRC. 3 security forces were killed and burned in their vehicle, 3 were injured and 3 suspected LRA forces were killed.
A boy, who had been abducted two months earlier in Kpaika, DRC, escaped from the LRA. The exact date and location of his escape are unknown.
4 to 5 suspected LRA forces were spotted in Kpaika, DRC on approximately August 15th, 2009.
A woman, who was abducted by LRA forces from Kpaika, DRC, was beat while in captivity.
2 women, who were abducted by LRA forces from Kpaika, DRC, were able to return from captivity shortly after their initial abduction.
6 LRA forces abducted 6 civilians from Kpaika, DRC, on October 31st, 2009.
LRA forces abducted a woman in Kpaika, DRC.
LRA forces attacked the community of Kpaika, DRC, killing 1 person, looting goods and setting 1 house on fire.
An LRA captain and 4 other combatants under his command turned themselves in to security forces in Kpaika, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 2 children from Kpaika, DRC, on February 25th, 2010.
Security forces clashed with reported LRA combatants, resulting in the deaths of 2 LRA members in Kpaika, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 2 children from Kpaika, DRC.
An LRA group attacked Kpaika, DRC for the third time in the same week. The result of the attack is unknown.
There was a clash between LRA forces and security forces, and in response the LRA attacked Kpaika, DRC and abducted 2 children.
LRA combatants clashed with security forces near Kpaika, DRC.  3 LRA members were killed and 1 was wounded.
3 LRA abductees escaped LRA captivity and were found by security forces near Kpaika, DRC, on June 5th, 2010.
LRA forces reportedly attacked near Kpaika, DRC. 2 men were killed and the wife and child of 1 of the men were abducted. The bodies of the 2 men were found 6 days later.
6 suspected LRA members looted food from Kpaika, DRC during the late hours of June 5th, 2010.
1 woman, abducted earlier in the day, was rescued by security forces near Kpaika, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 2 men and 1 woman near Kpaika, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted an 18-year-old man and a 17-year-old girl as they were fishing near Kpaika, DRC.
An 18-year-old man, abducted from Kpaika, DRC, on April 6th, escaped from LRA captivity.
Roughly 12 suspected LRA attacked a security checkpoint near Kpaika, DRC. The battle lasted for about 30 minutes and one of the suspected LRA forces was wounded.
Suspected LRA forces looted goods from a man traveling near Kpaika, DRC.
A group of 15 suspected LRA ambushed 6 cyclists as the traveled through Kpaika, DRC. The assailants looted all of their belongings.
3 armed LRA men attacked the community of Kpaika, DRC and looted goods before they were repelled by local militia forces.
A man was released shortly after being abducted by suspected LRA forces. He ran into his son and local security forces who were looking for the assailants.

In the morning, 4 armed and suspected LRA men, accompanied by 2 girls, ambushed a father and his son 2 km west of Kpaika, DRC. The assailants abducted the father and looted some of his goods, but the son managed to escape and alert local security forces.

10 armed LRA men raided a household near a security force base in Kpaika, DRC. They spoke Acholi and stole various food items and clothing. Security forces were afraid to fire at them for fear of hitting civilians, and decided to pursue in the morning.

A 45-year-old man was surprised by two armed LRA soldiers 2 km northwest of Kpaika, DRC. They forced the man to come with them, but when he saw their group he fled and evaded his captors. He notified the local security forces who did not respond.
Locals from in and around the Ngilima, DRC area have reported an LRA camp being located at approximately this position as of December 28, 2009.

A fisherman encountered 3 suspected LRA forces, all armed men, near Kpaika, DRC. One them spoke poor Lingala and all were wearing unidentified military uniforms. The assailants took money from the fisherman before letting him go.

3 Congolese men were travelling on the same motorcycle from Dungu to Duru, DRC, when they fell into an ambush by 4 armed LRA forces. They fired at the motorcycle and injured one of the men. The assailants looted the motorcycle battery, clothes and money.
Security forces clashed with suspected LRA forces in Manzagala, DRC on June 19th, 2011. 2 suspected LRA members were killed.
A group of 11 suspected LRA forces, composed of 4 armed men, 4 children and 3 women, forced a civilian to prepare food for them in his hut in Manyawa, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 1 man and looted goods from Kpaika, DRC on March 25th, 2010.
LRA members killed 1 civilian and abducted 42 others in an attack on Esse, DRC, on June 3rd, 2009.
4 civilians were abducted by LRA forces outside of Banda, DRC.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces near Mount Bagunda in Garamba National Park, DRC. 2 LRA members were killed.
LRA forces killed 2 men along the Sili river in DRC.
10 suspected LRA forces ambushed 3 members of an NGO along a road near Manzagala, DRC. The assailants looted their personal belongings, money, phones, bedding, clothing, and a motorcycle battery.
20 suspected LRA forces looted corn, peanuts, manioc and other types of food from 8 fields north of Kpaika, DRC.
A 16 year old boy and his 60 year old father were both killed by LRA forces near the Sili River in DRC.
A group of women were fishing south of Bangadi, DRC, when they were surprised by suspected LRA forces. All of the women managed to escape.
2 men and 1 woman who were abducted by LRA members in Gangobi, DRC, were released shortly after their abduction. They were used as porters to carry loot.

LRA forces attacked Gangobi, DRC in the early evening of March 10th, 2011. They abducted 2 men, 1 woman, and looted several households.  The 3 abductees were later released after serving as porters to the LRA.
LRA forces killed 1 person approximately 23km north of Ngilima, DRC, on August 8, 2010.
LRA forces abducted 4 civilians outside of Banda, DRC.
2 young people, ages 20 and 14, were abducted by LRA forces near the Sili river in DRC.
in a clash between LRA forces and security forces near Bagugu, DRC, 10 individuals were able to escape.
LRA forces were spotted near Tikadzi, DRC.
LRA forces killed 3 people near the Sili River in the DRC.
LRA members killed 2 civilians in June 2009 in Baloko, DRC.
LRA forces killed 2 people at Baloko, DRC, on June 3, 2009.
LRA members killed 1 civilian on June 10th, 2009, in Baloko, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 8 civilians north of Dingila, DRC, on March 3rd, 2011.
In the middle of the night on February 28th, 2008, LRA forces and security forces exchanged fire at Yei and Kore, Sudan, close to the border with Uganda.
LRA forces killed 2 civilians near Yei, South Sudan, on March 3rd, 2009.
LRA forces killed 6 civilians and abducted 6 others in an attack on Yei, South Sudan, on March 4th, 2009.
A pair of uniformed suspected LRA were spotted by a woman while she was harvesting just south of Bangadi, DRC. The two LRA reportedly tried to stop her, but she ran away leaving some items behind.
LRA forces killed 2 men in Dikpoto, DRC on January 11th, 2010.
5 suspected LRA attacked 4 men traveling near Dikpoto, DRC, and looted all of their belongings, with the exception of their bicycles.
8 suspected LRA forces ambushed 7 traders along the road near Dikpoto, DRC. Various goods were looted including phones, clothes, and batteries.

Suspected LRA forces abducted 3 men from their farms on June 9th, 2011, south of Bangadi, DRC. 2 of the men were later killed, and the whereabouts of the 3rd victim are unknown. All 3 victims were from the same family.
The bodies of  2 men abducted by suspected LRA forces were found brutally hacked to death near their farms on June 10th, 2011 near Bangadi, DRC.

Regional secuirty forces flew a helicopter over a suspected LRA camp outside of Ango, DRC, on September 19, 2013.  The LRA soliders fled the scene, but left behind several personal belongings including a satellite phone and were believed to be farming.

Regional secuirty forces flew a helicopter once again over a suspected LRA camp outside of Ango, DRC, on September 23, 2013. The LRA soldiers fled the scene, but left behind several personal belongings.
2 suspected LRA men looted goods from a settlement 3 km north of Kpaika, DRC.

2 suspected  and armed LRA forces ambushed a young man and woman traveling on 2 motorcycles 3 km northeast of Kpaika, DRC, as they were traveling to Duru. The civilians abandoned their goods which were looted by the assailants.

At approximately 3 km northeast of Kpaika, DRC, 3 suspected and armed LRA soldiers, 1 of whom was younger than the other 2, opened fire on 2 travelers causing them to crash. The assailants looted various goods from the travelers, including soap & alcohol.
4 LRA forces ambushed a man returning from his field and brought him into the bush. They asked him questions about the location of security forces before looting all his clothes and releasing him.
A civilian on a motorcycle was ambushed by 5 armed suspected LRA forces near Kpaika, DRC. All of the victim's goods were looted.
On April 28th, 2008, 1 LRA member was arrested by local civilians in Nakpudu, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 2 people and wounded 1 other in an attack on Nakpudu, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Nakpudu, DRC killing 1 civilian and looting the town.
LRA forces attacked Nakpudu, DRC killing 1 civilian and injuring 2 others.
LRA forces abducted 2 civilians in an attack on Nakpudu, DRC.
9 suspected LRA forces looted nuts and corn from 2 fields near the Nakpudu stream in the DRC. Multiple civilians spotted the group, and security forces stated that the tracks were likely LRA.

LRA forces looted a group of 7 men and 5 women. Among the assailants were 2 men armed with AK47s, 2 women and 2 boys. All the civilians were released after being questioned on the distance to Bangadi, DRC, and on the location of security forces.
2 suspected LRA forces ambushed a man near Dikpoto, DRC. The assailants beat the man and looted all of his belongings, including his clothing, a carton of cigarettes, and a bag of sugar.
3 suspected LRA forces armed with AK-47's ambushed 4 men and 1 woman were abducted at Li-Nabanda, DRC. The men were able to escape, but the woman was abducted.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a boy roughly 5 km south of Bangadi, DRC.
A boy who was abducted by suspected LRA forces on April 19th was found dead near Bangadi, DRC. He was buried on April 24th.
Roughly 4 LRA attacked 4 hunters northeast of Kpaika, DRC at 9:00 AM. The combatants shot and injured 1 of the hunters, and looted food and animals from the group.

3 suspected LRA approached a motorcyclist as he was travelling through Babele, DRC, and asked him to stop. The man escaped on foot and was unharmed, however, the combatants looted his motorcycle battery and his food.

A group of 6 suspected LRA, including 5 armed combatants and 1 young boy, ambushed 2 young men as they were traveling to the Nambiapay market near Babele, DRC. The combatants looted all of their belongings, including their clothes.

At least 4 suspected LRA forces attacked a group of 4 cyclists near Kana, DRC as they was returning from the market. The group abandoned their bicycles and fled to alert security forces who responded, but could not find the assailants.
9 LRA members (7 men and 2 girls) were seen just outside of Bangadi, DRC on September 22nd, 2011.
LRA forces attacked Yabwa, DRC. It is unknown how many people were affected by this attack.

5 armed and suspected LRA forces ambushed at least 7 individuals, including 2 members of a security force. After an exchange of fire, 1 suspected LRA was wounded and a weapon was recovered as the assailants fled. This incident occurred near Dikpoto, DRC.
4 suspected LRA forces abducted a woman and her baby near Gugu, DRC.
6 armed suspected LRA forces ambushed and looted 2 merchants on bicycles in Pilipili, DRC. 120 liters of palm oil and about 1 kg of bushmeat were looted.
Security force operations captured 6 LRA members on February 11th, 2010 outside of Ango, DRC.
Security forces discovered an abandoned LRA camp north of Kpaika, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 man and injured his wife outside of Bangadi, DRC, on September 18, 2009.
Around 10:00 AM, a group of 4 LRA attacked a man near Nasumba, DRC and looted all of his belongings, including the clothes he was wearing and his food.

5 LRA forces, 4 of which were armed, ambushed 2 men 5 km north of Kpaika, DRC. The men immediately abandoned their bikes and goods and fled to notify security forces. The assailants proceeded to loot 2 canvas sheets and clothes before moving westward.
2 suspected LRA ambushed 3 men along the Banda to Dakwa Road in the DRC. 1 man was shot and killed, and the other 2 men fled to inform security forces.
LRA forces released a 28-year-old man who was abducted earlier in the afternoon near Bangadi, DRC.
2 suspected LRA abducted a 28-year-old man 3 kilometers south of Bangadi, DRC.
Suspected LRA were sighted occupying a road. They exchanged fire with security forces near Bangadi, DRC . No victims were reported.

6 traders heard whistling in the forest while they carried their goods to a local market just south of Nambia, DRC. LRA forces soon surrounded them and looted all their goods. Each trader ran in a separate direction, but 1 of them has not yet been found.

5 LRA forces, comprised of 4 men and 1 woman, ambushed 2 cyclists 7 km north of Kpaika, DRC along the road to Duru, DRC. The assailants stole food, shoes, a transistor radio. They also stole the clothes the victims were wearing.
On December 29th, 2007 reported LRA forces abducted 3 civilians in Nakili, DRC.
On December 30th, 2007  LRA forces released the 3 civilians abducted in Nakili, DRC the day before.
5 suspected LRA abducted 2 men and 1 woman near Nasumba, DRC.
2 men who were abducted by LRA forces on December 11, 2011 from Nasumba, DRC, escaped the next day.

2 motorcyclists encountered a group of 4 suspected LRA following a 2 hunters near Nasumba, DRC. Upon seeing the motorcyclists, the men began shooting into the air. The motorcyclists continued on their way and the hunters fled toward Kpaika, DRC.
3 armed LRA forces looted 9 sacks of corn, flour, a bag of clothes, and white rice from 7 travelers near Nasumba, DRC.

On February 17th, 2013, 15 suspected LRA forces ambushed a group composed of  2 men, 1 woman and 1 baby in Nasumba, DRC. The assailants looted the men's belongings, including their two motorcycle batteries.
During an attack on Nangasue, DRC, LRA forces killed a man and abducted 8 girls, some of them students.
4 LRA members invaded a woman's home in Itaba, DRC on May 18th. The woman escaped, but the LRA were able to steal food from her field as well as other household items such as blankets.

Suspected LRA forces ambushed 2 men north of Kpaika, DRC along the road to Duru. The men immediately abandoned their bikes and fled. The men then came across a woman with a baby, who had been abducted a long time ago, and took her and the child to Nambia.
LRA forces attacked Etabe, DRC, near Bangadi, DRC, on 18 September 2009 and killed 1 civilian.
On 21 September 2009, LRA forces attacked Etabe, DRC near Bangadi, DRC. 1 woman was killed in the attack.
4 armed LRA members invaded the community of Tura, DRC around 4:00pm on May 18th. Many civilians ran, but the LRA were able to steal 4,000 Congolese Francs and a radio.
LRA forces abducted 16 adults and killed 4 adults a few kilometers east of Boeli, DRC, along the main road.

3 suspected and armed LRA forces ambushed 2 people near Dikpoto, DRC, as they were traveling to Nabiapay. The civilians fled as the assailants proceeded to loot all their belongings including white rice, beans, and the motorcycle battery.
Around 10:00 PM, a group of suspected LRA members abducted 1 young girl and looted 3 homes near Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 40 people during an attack on Diabapa, DRC.
5 civilians consisting of 3 women and 2 men, abducted by LRA earlier in the day near Diabapa, DRC, escaped unharmed.
5 LRA forces attacked the community of Diabapa, DRC and abducted 3 women and 2 men.
Security forces arrested a suspected LRA fighter just east of Bangadi, DRC.

At least 5 suspected LRA entered the community of Bazekpete, DRC, and attempted to intimidate the civilians by firing 2 warning shots. Security forces responded before much was looted, and exchanged fire with the combatants.

LRA forces released a male civilian who had been abducted earlier in the day near Banday, DRC. Security forces then pursued the combatants and exchanged fire, resulting in the injury and capture of 2 civilians who were also in LRA captivity.
A group of suspected LRA abducted 2 civilians, 1 of which is the son of a local leader. The suspected LRA forces also severely injured 1 man. These events took place in Banday, DRC.
On January 21st, 2010, LRA elements reportedly killed 2 individuals (a priest and his son) in Yabua, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person when they attacked Yabua, DRC.
The LRA attacked the village of Yabua, DRC killing 2 people. This was the second attack in three days.
LRA forces attacked the village of Yabua, DRC for the third time in four days, and killed 1 person.
4 LRA members abducted 2 young boys (10 and 12 years old) forcing them to lead the way through the community away from security force positions in Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces attacked the IDP camp near Bangadi, DRC. 9 civilians were killed, 1 injured, and at least 41 children were abducted in the attack.
On November 16th, 2008, suspected LRA forces clashed with a local self-defence group 12 km out of Bangadi, DRC. One LRA casualty was reported.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA forces attacked Bangadi, DRC. 8 people were killed and 9 people were injured.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces and captured 4 LRA captives on May 5th, 2009 near Ngilima and Bangadi, DRC. The captives were 2 women and 2 children.
Around August 10th, 2009, a 17-year-old Sudanese boy arrived in Bangadi, DRC after escaping from LRA forces a month and a half earlier.
On September 9, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in Mangiabayi which is near Bangadi, DRC.
On September 10, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in the Kisimu district, the northeast part of Bangadi, DRC.
On September 12, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in Kumbali, DRC, which is near Bangadi.
In 2 separate attacks on September 14, 2009, LRA forces killed 2 citizens in the Bangadi area of DRC. The exact location of these attacks are unknown.
On September 21, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Kumbali, DRC, which is near Bangadi.

A group of about 30 LRA fighters attacked Bangadi, DRC, in early November 2009. Civilians were mutilated by having their lips and ears cut off, and others were killed. The exact date and number of victims of this attack are unknown.
30 LRA members attacked the town of Bangadi, DRC, injuring 3 people.

Security forces intervened in an LRA attack and managed to free 2 of the 3 abducted children. Earlier roughly 40 LRA members raided the community of Bangadi, DRC, and abducted 3 children on December 10th, 2009. The remaining child was taken by the LRA.
Around 40 suspected  LRA abducted 3 children in Bangadi, DRC on December 10th, 2009. They also stole food and other goods.

LRA forces abducted and mutilated four individuals from Bangadi, DRC, including 2 men and 1 woman. 1 individual died as a result of the attack, either after release or during the attack, while the remaining 3 were released and taken to the local hospital.

LRA forces abducted and mutilated four individuals from Bangadi, DRC, including 2 men and 1 woman. 1 individual died as a result of the attack, either after release or during the attack, while the remaining 3 were released and taken to the local hospital.
During the week of January 25th, 2010, LRA forces mutilated 4 civilians in the Bangadi area of the DRC.
On March 17th, 2010 an injured civilian reported that he had been attacked by LRA forces near Bangadi, DRC.
On April 1st, 2010, LRA forces attacked 2 women in Bangadi, DRC and cut off their lips and noses.
LRA combatants attacked 3 civilians in Bangadi, DRC, leaving each severely wounded.
LRA forces attacked Bangadi, DRC, killing 1 person and wounding another.
The elderly man, who had been abducted and injured by LRA forces earlier that day, managed to escape from captivity near Mangu, DRC, which is near Bangadi, DRC.

5 LRA forces attacked Mangu, DRC which is 10 km away from Bangadi, DRC in an unknown direction. They abducted and injured 1 elderly man, and attempted to abducted a young man, but were unable to after he resisted.
LRA forces attacked 2 quarters in Bangadi, DRC, abducting 2 children and 2 women and killing 1 man.
2 women who were abducted by LRA forces from Bangadi, DRC, were able to escape later the same night as their abduction.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a civilian from Bangadi, DRC on September 6th, 2010.
4 suspected LRA forces were seen southwest of Bangadi, DRC.
7 LRA members attacked a man on the road in Bangadi, DRC. He was able to escape, but lost some of his belongings to the LRA.
A 14-year-old girl escaped near Bangadi, DRC, after spending 2 years in LRA captivity.
The 3 girls who had recently been abducted from Bangadi, DRC, by the LRA were able to escape during the night.
10 LRA members abducted 3 young girls at a water point outside of Bangadi, DRC.

A young girl escaped from suspected LRA captivity near Bangadi, DRC. She was unable to speak, but acted out that other victims had been killed  and that she was with an LRA group consisting of 10 people.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 1 young girl from Bangadi, DRC on June 4th, 2011.
A group of LRA attacked and looted homes outside of Bangadi, DRC on June 24th, 2011.

On the night of July 8th, 3 LRA intimidated a family by firing shots into the air. They were able to loot the home and abduct an 8-year-old boy and 60-year-old man from the community. The man was later released. This attack took place in Bangadi, DRC.
A 60-year-old man who had been abducted the day before by suspected LRA forces was released unharmed on July 9, 2011.
An LRA member, likely Ugandan, surrendered to security forces at the Bangadi bridge near Bangadi, DRC, on July 9, 2011.
On July 20, 2011, regional security forces clashed with between 15 and 25 suspected LRA forces.  A 13-year-old girl was rescued during the attack. She claims to have been abducted in July 2010.

2 children escaped LRA forces and entered Mbwele, DRC, a community outside of Bangadi during the week of July 25th. They were in custody of regional security forces for 1 week and are now with a volunteer host family.

A  total of 7 people escaped from LRA forces and entered the community of Bangadi, DRC. At 9:00 AM, 1 Ugandan woman came out with 3 children. At around 12:00 PM, another woman came out with 2 children. One of the women had been in captivity since 1993.
Suspected LRA elements reportedly abducted 2 men and 1 woman from Bangadi, DRC.
1 man, who was abducted on October 3rd from Mbiangu, DRC, was released the next day. He is now in Bangadi, DRC.
One fifteen year old boy escaped from the LRA after spending nine months in captivity. He is now in Bangadi, DRC.
The 2 young boys who were abducted earlier in the day were released 3 hours later after showing 4 LRA members a shortcut away from security force positions in Bangadi, DRC.

13 people (6 women and 7 children) were reportedly released by the LRA near Bangadi, DRC on 2 November 2011. Several of these women had  been abducted from Uganda and had been in captivity for over 10 years.
A group of armed LRA combatants abducted 6 civilians from Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces released 6 civilians, the day after they were abducted on February 7th from Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces released 3 men, abducted earlier in the day near Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces were spotted around Bangadi, DRC. They were well-armed with firearms, ammunition, and uniforms. A commander was with these groups.
A group of 12 LRA combatants, including 5 armed Ugandan men, 5 Congolese women and 2 children, abducted 5 people and looted their belongings near Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces released 4 people abducted on April 5th near Bangadi, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces looted all goods from 2 cyclists as they traveled from Bangadi, DRC to Diagbe, DRC.
1 LRA  member reportedly surrendered to security forces in Bangadi, DRC near a water spring.
LRA forces released a man after they had abducted him 3 hours earlier near Bangadi, DRC. Before they released him, the LRA forces stole the clothes he was wearing and his watch.
A group of 6 suspected LRA forces, comprised of 5 armed men and a 13-year-old boy, abducted a man from Bangadi, DRC and questioned him on the whereabouts of security forces.
A group of 8 LRA forces, armed with machetes and guns, ambushed a teacher as he was traveling near Bangadi, DRC. The combatants looted all of his goods, stripped him of his clothing, and tied him up.

14 suspected LRA forces, consisting of 8 men and 6 women looted 3 households in Kisimu, which is a northeast district of Bangadi, DRC. Food, cooking gear, clothes, and a mattress cover were taken. A recently abducted couples escaped during the looting.
14 suspected LRA forces, consisting of 8 men and 6 women, abducted a couple from their fields in the Kisimu district, which is the northeast part of Bangadi, DRC.

A 34-year-old Ugandan LRA combatant peacefully surrendered in Bangadi, DRC, after reportedly spending 17 years in captivity. He reported that he was authorized to speak on FM radio to encourage the surrender of other LRA forces.
A man escaped from LRA forces to Bangadi, DRC. He cited defection fliers and radio messages as reasons for escaping.
On November, 25, 2013, a 13-year-old boy was abducted by a group of 8 LRA forces from Bangadi, DRC.  The boy managed to escape 5 days later.
A woman escaped from her 3 LRA captors east of Bangadi, DRC, 5 days after her abduction near Lindimbia, DRC.
On September 9, 2009, LRA forces killed 3 civilians in Bilisi, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Bilisi, DRC, and killed 1 civilian.
LRA forces killed 3 civilians during an attack on Bilisi, DRC.
Suspected LRA attacked 7 civilians west of Bangadi, DRC, along a river. The combatants killed 1 person, wounded 3, and abducted 3. The exact date of the attack is unclear.
3 LRA members were sighted in Bangadi, DRC, on August 4th. 1 of the LRA combatants was captured and is currently in security force custody, while the other 2 LRA members managed to escape.
A large group of suspected LRA attacked Bangadi, DRC. 1 man was shot and killed, another man was abducted, and 7 houses were looted. Food, clothing, and other household items were stolen.

On March 10th, 2013, 3 suspected LRA forces - 2 armed men and 1 child carrying a machete and a stick - ambushed 4 civilians on a motorbike 7 km southeast from Banda, DRC, on the road to Mangbungulu, DRC. They looted various electronics and other goods.

A 13-year-old boy, who was abducted by LRA forces on October 29th near Madudu, DRC, was able to escape from his captors as they slept. He immediately returned to Bangadi, DRC and reported details and the whereabouts of the group.
LRA forces attacked Malingbundu, DRC and killed 2 people.

While making palm oil in their field in Malingbundu, DRC, 2 men were attacked by 3 suspected LRA reportedly wearing dirty uniforms. While running away, the LRA fired at them and shot both men -- one in the arm, one in the pelvis.
LRA forces ambushed 8 people working in their fields in Malingbundu, DRC near Bangadi. All 8 people managed to escape. No further details were provided.
5 suspected LRA members abducted a 20-year-old man in Bangadi, DRC early in the morning.
The 20-year-old man who was abducted the previous day by the LRA was able to escape from captivity in the middle of the night.
Security forces ambushed a group of LRA forces and killed 1 LRA fighter near Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces killed 4 and abducted 6 in an attack on Nabande, DRC.

After the September 17th attacks, LRA forces attacked Bayote, DRC. Part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors. At least 3 girls were abducted, 1 woman was injured, and food and valuables were looted.
3 people were killed in an LRA attack on Tongotongo, DRC on January 4th, 2010.
LRA forces attacked civilians in Tongotongo, DRC on January 4th, 2010. 2 civilians were killed and 7 others were abducted.
The LRA attacked Tongotongo, DRC on January 6th, 2010 and killed 2 civilians.
A group of LRA members previously sighted in Kpatamasua, DRC reportedly advanced to Tongotongo, DRC on January 8th, 2010 where 20 civilians were killed and numerous others were wounded in an attack.
Reported LRA forces killed 1 individual and abducted another from Tongotongo, DRC.
A man was killed and his wife abducted when LRA forces attacked Tongotongo, DRC, on February 10, 2011.
A 6-year-old girl was abducted by LRA forces from Tongotongo, DRC on June 1st, 2011.
Suspected LRA forces looted crops in Tongotongo, DRC on June 28th, 2011.

While traveling through Tongotongo, DRC, 3 boys were abducted and forced to carry looted goods. LRA forces involved were 2 men and 2 young boys. LRA combatants were armed with guns, wore uniforms, and spoke Luo, a northern Ugandan language.
3 boys who were abducted from Tongotongo, DRC, on Sept 17th were released after carrying looted goods for LRA forces.
On September 9, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in Bafuka, DRC.
On September 27, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Bafuka, DRC.
A male Ugandan LRA member was arrested by security forces near Seku, DRC. He had been with the LRA for 16 years.
Security forces and LRA combatants clashed for 3 days, near Kpanzu, DRC
16 LRA forces, comprised of both men and women, looted a few households near Bangadi, DRC stealing food, clothing, and a mattress.
6 suspected LRA forces abducted 1 woman from her fields and reportedly killed 2 others outside of Bangadi, DRC, on June 7th, 2011.

2 suspected LRA men, armed with AK-47's, attacked 3 girls who are between the ages of 15 and 17 near a small stream called Nangbimo west of Bangadi, DRC. The girls returned without their clothes and refused to speak about what happened.
5 people (4 men and 1 woman) returning to Bangadi from the Napopo market were ambushed 2 km from Napopo, DRC, at the Manzagala stream. LRA forces abducted the travelers and looted their goods.
4 men escaped from LRA forces within 24 hours of their abduction near Napopo, DRC, at the Manzagala stream. Currently, the woman they traveled with is still being held captive.
LRA forces killed 2 young children, aged 3 and 5-years-old along with their father in Boeli, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 5 people from Boeli, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 4 people and killed 1 other when they attacked Boeli, DRC.

Security forces ambushed the LRA group that had attacked Lolo 2 weeks earlier. The ambush occurred east of Boeli, DRC. An estimated 4 LRA were killed and 4 abductees escaped, including a girl who had been abducted on October 17, 2008.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a  38-year-old woman and forced her to show them how to get to Boeli, DRC, which is near Banda, DRC.

A group of 8 suspected LRA led by a woman they had abducted the day before attacked Boeli, DRC. The group abducted a young girl, beat a young woman who was carrying her infant, and looted food and clothing from the village.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians on August 29th, 2011 just south of Napopo, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Limakusa, DRC, which is very close to Bangadi, DRC. 1 civilian was killed.
Suspected LRA forces looted civilians in Limakusa, DRC, which is very close to Bangadi, DRC.
On May 4th, 2010, LRA forces abducted 10 young men near Bangadi, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person at Bili, DRC, during the month of June in 2009.
LRA combatants killed 2 people and abducted 3 children in a string of attacks on February 27, 2010, across the communities of Monga, Baye, and Bili, DRC.
LRA forces released a pastor near the town of Bili on July 9th, 2011.  He had been abducted from Lumu, DRC on the same day.
LRA forces attacked Bili, DRC. The result of this attack is unknown.
4 suspected LRA soldiers attacked 2  men who were fishing along the Nabanda river, just northeast of Bangadi, DRC. 1 young man was shot in the arm as they escaped, but the wound was not serious.

A civilian came across 2 suspected LRA soldiers along the road between Bangadi and Napopo, DRC. The 2 suspected LRA soldiers attempted to give their weapons to the civilian, but the civilian ran away.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces on May 5th, 2010 between Bangadi and Dika, DRC. The clash resulted in the deaths of 2 civilians.
A group of 4 suspected LRA forces attacked the community of Zimlingi, DRC, abducting an unknown number of civilians and looting goods.
LRA forces released an unknown number of civilians, abducted on April 4th near Zimlingi, DRC.
On January 5, 2010, LRA forces and security forces clashed near Badolo, DRC. 4 civilians were also killed and 1 civilian abducted.

4 suspected LRA forces stopped a boy 10 km southeast of Duru as he was traveling from Dungu to Duru, DRC. They took his sugarcane but told him not to be afraid and that they would only shoot him if he ran. They then released the boy who continued to Duru.
Of the original 46 people abducted by the LRA on March 11, 2010, 40 were released back to Dikuma, DRC. 6 remain captive.
During the month of March, LRA combatants attacked the market at Dikuma, DRC, killing 2 men and 1 child. LRA combatants also abducted 46 people. 40 of the people were later released.
LRA forces released a boy, who was 1 of the 6 children recently abducted by the LRA from a protestant church in Dikuma, DRC.
LRA combatants attacked a protestant church abducting 2 girls and 4 boys in Dikuma, DRC. 1 of the boys was later released, but the other 5 children were taken to the bush with the LRA.

LRA forces abducted an 11-year-old girl from Dikuma, DRC. She managed to escape 8 months later when security forces attacked the group of LRA she was with. She spent those 8 months as a "wife" of one of the commanders.
At some point in the month of December, 2010, LRA forces attacked Dikuma, DRC. They abducted 1 child, killed another, and then burned the house of the father of the slain child.

Security forces gathered in Dikuma, DRC in preparation for an LRA attack after locals warned of abductions earlier that day. The LRA attacked from 2 directions at 7:00 PM. 5 LRA were killed, 1 captured, and 21 abductees were rescued. Looting occurred.

Security forces quickly retaliated against the LRA in Dikuma, DRC. The LRA forces were able to escape with 6 children and 2 women, but security forces claim to have rescued 17 abducted people. One of the 2 abducted women was killed.
During the month of April, LRA forces clashed with security forces at Dikuma, DRC. 2 civilians were killed and roughly 20 abducted, more than half of which were children.
2 girls were abducted and 2 adults (including 1 mother) were killed by the LRA when they attacked Dikuma, DRC.

4 LRA members invaded Dikuma, DRC, on May 18, 2011. 1 man was taken out of the community where 6 more LRA forces were waiting. He was stabbed to death, and his son was shot in the head and killed. LRA forces also killed 1 other child in the attack.
1 girl and 2 boys who were abducted by LRA forces several months earlier in March, were returned along with 2 other children to Dikuma, DRC by security forces.
A group of 10 suspected LRA looted 7 civilians near Dikuma, DRC.
A group of 10 suspected LRA looted salt fish from 4 civilians, and abducted 2 of them near Dikuma, DRC. This took place about 15 km from Dikuma, in an unknown direction.

Suspected LRA forces attacked a community on the Bili-Bondo road, DRC. The assailants abducted 5 civilians, reportedly setting 1 on fire. 2 additional civilians, including 1 female, are also reportedly missing.
8 civilians recently suspected to have been abducted by LRA were found in the bush near Bili-Bondo Road, DRC, by a local person, who then notified local security forces to liberate them.
LRA forces attacked a security force camp northwest of Bangadi, DRC. 2 civilians who were traveling through the area were injured during the battle.
Suspected LRA forces killed a farmer and his son south of Duru, DRC.
On September 12, 2009, LRA forces killed 5 civilians in Zangaime, DRC.
10 LRA forces killed 4 civilians and injured 2 others in an attack on Zangaime, DRC.

A woman who had been abducted earlier in the day by 6 suspected LRA forces, was released at an unspecified date close to her initial abduction. She claims to have been drugged by her attackers and forced to carry looted goods for the group.
About 5 armed LRA stole goods from a woman and her 3 children near Bangadi, DRC on July 4th.
On July 9, 2011, 14-year-old boy was abducted by suspected LRA forces from Zangaime, DRC.
Security forces encountered and took in a 17-year-old boy at Zangaime, DRC. He escaped from LRA forces on August 5, 2011.

7 LRA members looted food and household goods from Zangaime, DRC. Security forces fled from the scene. As a result, over 300 people reportedly spent the night in nearby Bangadi because they feared further LRA activity.
3 civilians on motorcycles were ambushed by 10 suspected LRA forces near Nambili, DRC. The assailants fled when they sighted a local security force.

2 armed and suspected LRA men were hiding in the bush near the road  15 km north of Kpaika, DRC, when 2 cyclists passed by. The cyclists were afraid, but the armed men did not speak or gesture to them and they were able to pass without harassment.

4 suspected LRA reportedly attacked 5 households in Zangaime, DRC. Security forces intervened and exchanged fire with the suspected LRA forces. 1 member of the LRA was injured. Security forces pursued the assailants.
1 LRA member was captured by security forces in the Garamba National Park in the DRC on April 21st, 2011.

A woman, who was abducted by suspected LRA forces earlier in the day from Nangbangala, DRC, escaped later that night. However, around the same time, the same suspected LRA forces abducted a young girl, a man, a woman, and looted unspecified goods.
LRA forces released a man and woman after abducting them along with a young girl earlier in the day, near Nangbangala, DRC. The young girl remains in captivity.
4 suspected LRA forces attacked Nangbangala, DRC and abducted 1 woman.

3 LRA forces attempted to speak to a man who was fishing at the Mbwele river northwest of Bangadi, DRC. The man, fearing for his life, fled without responding and was reportedly injured in the arm during the encounter.
1 man, who was abducted and used as a guide by LRA members earlier in the day was released just outside the town of Bangadi, DRC.
9 LRA members (7 armed men and 2 unarmed girls) abducted a man just outside the town of Bangadi, DRC.
6 suspected armed LRA forces surprised 4 civilians near Bangadi, DRC. The assailants reportedly abducted the 4 civilians and fled back into the bush.
The 4 civilians abducted by 6 suspected LRA forces near Bangadi on February 22, 2014 were reportedly released.
1 person was abducted by LRA forces just outside of Bangadi, DRC, on June 9th, 2011.

As reported on August 8, 2010, LRA forces attacked a group of civilians being escorted by security forces near Pengule, DRC. 1 female civilian was killed and 3 other civilians were wounded in the firefight.

2 children escaped captivity during an exchange of fire between regional security forces and an armed group. The 12-year-old boy and 10-year-old girl claimed their group was led by LRA commander Kidega.
LRA combatants  killed 2 adults while they were out hunting near Napopo, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces were spotted near Makpesala, DRC.
On September 23, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Madudu, DRC.
LRA forces attacked the community of Madudu, DRC and killed 3 civilians.
7 LRA forces ambushed a man near Madudu, DRC and looted all of his belongings.

Near Madudu, DRC, 3 armed LRA forces, disguised as security forces, abducted the youngest boy from a group of 3 boys. The assailants looted various goods from the boys and then used the youngest boy to find the way to the nearby town of Napopo.
Approximately 30 LRA attacked a World Food Programme convoy carrying 240 tons of food near Banda, DRC. Food and other supplies were stolen.

1 fisherman spotted a group of suspected LRA, comprised of men, women and children, near the Mbwele River in the DRC. Upon seeing the group, the man hid in the forest to avoid confrontation. Security forces were informed by the local community.
LRA forces abducted 6 people from Nagugu, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Zigbi, DRC, killing 7 civilians in late March, 2010.
LRA forces were spotted around Zigbi, DRC on April 12th, 2010.

6 individuals were able to escape from suspected LRA forces near Zigbi, DRC. The escapees included a 20-year-old woman who was reportedly abducted in 1996 and married David Lakwo, a commander in Corporal Kidega's group. The other 5 escapees were children.

8 LRA forces attacked Zigbi, DRC, and looted food and non-food items from the town including shotgun ammunition and radios. They abducted 9 people to help carry the goods, but released a woman and her baby immediately. The 7 men were used as porters.

A day after they were abducted by LRA forces from Zigbi, DRC, to transport looted goods, 7 men were released with a message saying that the LRA would not harm the civilian population. The men reported seeing over 300 LRA forces in the bush.
3 suspected LRA abducted a man and his 8-year-old son just east of Nambia, DRC.
Later that evening, after 3 suspected LRA men abducted a man and his son, the group looted food from fields near Nambia, DRC.

In the days after the series of September 17th LRA attacks on several communities, LRA forces attacked other communities including Nambia, DRC. This is part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. In Nambia, one woman was stabbed with a machete, killing her and her baby on her back.
LRA forces attacked Nambia, DRC, on August 13th, 2009. 1 person was abducted.
4 civilians were abducted from Nambia, DRC, by the LRA. The report was unsure of the specific date, but estimated it as between Sept. 7 and Sept.  12th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 2 people in an attack on Nambia, DRC, near Duru.
Of the five people abducted by the LRA earlier this same day (3/13/2010) along the Duru river in the DRC, two were able to escape, but three were killed.
Locals sighted suspected LRA elements near Nambia, DRC on August 11th, 2011. The suspected LRA group also looted food from a a nearby farm.

A group of LRA combatants invaded a household in Nambia, DRC. When family members saw the LRA, they ran, but 1 man was shot in the shoulder. LRA combatants managed to loot the entire household. The wounded man was transferred to a hospital.
Security forces near Nambia, DRC sighted alleged LRA on September 13th.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 4 people and looted food from the market in Nambia, DRC.

A man and his son, who had been abducted 2 days earlier, were able to escape from LRA captivity and return to Nambia, DRC after being questioned by their captors about the location of security forces, and being forced to hunt for food for the group.

13 suspected LRA combatants attacked Nambia, DRC and shot a 43-year-old man multiple times, hitting and injuring him in the shoulder and chest.  Security forces reportedly returned fire. The assailants also looted food and other items.

9 suspected LRA forces conducted lootings between Duru and Kpaika, DRC. They first ambushed 9 people, including 3 men, and abducted a 15-year-old boy. 2 more people also fell into the same ambush.  The leader of the assailants was reportedly limping.
2 suspected LRA combatants abducted a 22-year-old man traveling by bicycle along the Banda-Doruma road in the DRC. The assailants also looted the paddy, peanuts, and money he was carrying with him.
A 22-year-old man, who was abducted two days earlier, was able to escape his 2 suspected LRA captors when they stopped to prepare food near the Banda-Doruma road in the DRC.
LRA forces abducted 2 children at Nambili, DRC, on February 21st, 2010.
LRA forces attacked outside of Nambili, DRC. 3 men were killed and 3 children abducted.
Security forces and suspected LRA forces clashed in the community of Nambili, DRC. 1 woman was abducted.
5 suspected LRA forces abducted a 16-year-old girl from Nambili, DRC on June 3rd, 2011.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a 12-year-old boy from Nambili, DRC, on June 6th, 2011, around 1:00 PM.

On August 15th, 2 men met armed LRA elements in Dukpa, DRC on the road home from a local market. The men ran away, leaving their bicycles, and hid in the forest for 2 days. They returned to their home community of Ngilima, DRC on August 17th.

An unknown number of suspected LRA attacked Nambili, DRC. 2 civilians were injured, the 1st man was shot in the right leg and the 2nd man in the back. Multiple shots were fired and the population fled.
A 12-year-old girl and another person were abducted by LRA forces from Boeli, DRC. When the father of the girl shouted, the LRA member shot and killed him.
LRA members killed 5 people and abducted 80 civilians in an attack on Banda, DRC, on March 15th, 2009. Some of the abducted and killed were young students.
LRA forces ambushed and killed 2 security forces and 5 Congolese civilians who were leading the security forces to the LRA camp near Banda, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 9 people and injured 1 other when they attacked Banda, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 26 people and burned down at least 12 houses in Banda, DRC.
LRA forces abducted a 10-year-old girl from Banda, DRC.
Security forces rescued 1 girl from LRA captivity during a clash on October 28th, 2009, near Banda, DRC.
LRA forces killed 3 and abducted 5 in an attack on Banda, DRC.
Security forces captured 2 LRA fighters in Banda, DRC, near the Haut Uele border on December 24th, 2009.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 3 adults and 2 children on January 8th, 2011, in Banda, DRC. Local militia forces pursued the suspected LRA with no success.

2 days after an earlier abduction in Banda, DRC, an unknown number of LRA surrendered to the local government and were later taken into custody by local security forces after being held by the local militia on January 10th, 2010.
Security forces captured 6 LRA  members on February 8th, 2010, in Banda, DRC.
Security forces captured 2 LRA members at Banda, DRC, on February 26th, 2010.

Between March 15 and March 20, 2010, LRA forces attacked the villages of Sukadi, Dakwa, Digba and Banda, DRC. Overall, 20 people were killed and 15 abducted. The remaining populations fled. The numbers are split between three incidents.
5 LRA members, 4 children and 1 woman,  were captured by security forces near Banda, DRC, on March 27th, 2010.
On June 2nd, 2010, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Namotirra, DRC, which is near Banda, DRC.
A teenage boy was abducted by LRA forces from Banda, DRC, and then tortured while in captivity.
Hours after Invisible Children staff left Banda, DRC, LRA forces moved into the village and abducted a 12-year-old boy.

A large number of LRA elements looted Mageda, DRC, just northwest of Banda, DRC, resulting in 2 men being abducted.  Many of the combatants were reportedly wearing military uniforms and carrying guns.
A large group of LRA elements attacked Banda, DRC, and shot 1 man in the leg. They also abducted 7 community members. 2 suspected LRA were wounded by security forces who responded to the incident.
LRA forces abducted a 17-year-old boy from Banda, DRC.
A 17-year-old Congolese boy held in captivity for 14 months, escaped from the LRA on November 25th, 2011. He spent 1 month in Banda, DRC, before arriving in Doruma, DRC, on January 5th, 2012.
A Congolese girl was abducted by LRA forces from Banda, DRC.
3 armed and suspected LRA men were spotted assessing the strength of the security forces in Banda, DRC.
On May 27th, 2009, LRA forces and security forces reportedly clashed 7 km east of Banda, DRC.
LRA forces released 2 women that had been abducted the earlier the same day from Bangadi, DRC. The women showed signs of trauma and refused to speak.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 2 women from the road between Bangadi and Napopo, DRC on June 4th, 2011.
2 women who had been abducted by LRA forces earlier in the day on October 18th, 2010, managed to escape back into Nmama, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Nmama, DRC, killing 1 man and abducting 2 women.
4 suspected LRA forces abducted a young girl from Kataluma, DRC.
A few hours after their abduction and interrogation, 2 abducted girls were released by 2 LRA soldiers near Nandike, DRC.
2 LRA forces abducted 2 girls near Nandike, DRC. They interrogated the girls about the position of security forces in the region and expressed a willingness to surrender.
A large, but unknown number abductees who had been abducted from Dakwa, DRC, were able to escape when security forces engaged LRA forces at Buye, DRC, on June 9th, 2009.
As reported on April 6th, 2008, LRA forces were sighted in Garamba National Park, DRC.  The presence of LRA forces led to the displacement of civilians in the region.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces in Garamba National Park in December 2008. The specific date and location of this battle unknown.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces at Nakare, near the Garamba National Park in the DRC on March 8th, 2009. A total of 6 LRA members were killed, and 4 abducted persons were freed.
On May 5th, security forces at the Garamba National Park in the DRC clashed with suspected LRA members. 1 LRA member was injured. Also, 1 abducted child was rescued.
Security forces reportedly carried out an offensive operation against LRA camps between June 26th and July 6th, 2011, near Garamba National Park, DRC.
Security forces reportedly captured 5 LRA in the Garamba National Park in the DRC.

LRA forces released a 16-year-old girl in Garamba National Park, DRC, after holding her captive for 2 weeks. Regional security forces sent her to an NGO specializing in psychosocial services and care.

During an operation led by regional security forces in Garamba National Park, DRC, 4 civilians were rescued from LRA captivity.  Security forces also destroyed suspected LRA camps along the Nangume River.

Local  hunters exchanged fire  with an LRA group and killed 2 LRA forces. 2 women and 2 children were rescued .The escapees and the local hunters identified one of the dead as Major Odano, leader of LRA groups in the Garamba National Park.

4 civilians were traveling together when they were attacked by 7 LRA members near Napopo, DRC. 3 were able to escape, but 1 25-year-old man was shot and beaten with a motorcycle pump which resulted in his death.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians from Nande, DRC, on December 30th, 2007.
LRA forces attacked Mandoro, DRC, killing and abducting an unknown number of civilians. This is part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.
LRA forces released an injured 15-year-old boy near Mandoro, DRC. The boy had been in captivity for 3 years, and is currently with security forces in Dungu, DRC.
5 suspected and armed LRA forces ambushed travelers along the road from from Banda to Doruma, DRC. The assailants looted all the clothes and money the travelers had with them.
On June 17th, 2012, a LRA supplies cache was reported to be located 8 km east of Badolo and 6 km north of Bangadi, DRC. This store would contain food, clothes, batteries, solar panels and radios.
On September 8, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Napopo, DRC.
LRA forces killed one person in Napopo, DRC.

Suspected LRA forces attacked Napopo, DRC, on 18 September 2009. They burned houses and reportedly threw children into the burning homes. This is unconfirmed. The number of people hurt or killed in this attack not specified.
LRA forces clashed with security forces and were repelled at Napopo, DRC.
LRA forces released a young boy at the village of Napopo, DRC.
The civilian who had been abducted by LRA forces two days earlier near Bangadi, DRC, was able to escape to Napopo, DRC, on September 8th, 2010.
The LRA attacked Napopo, DRC, injuring an 11 year old girl and stealing goods from the town.
LRA forces killed a man in the village of Napopo, DRC.
An 18-year-old girl escaped LRA captivity during a clash with regional security forces and came out at Napopo, south of Bangadi, DRC, during the week of July 25, 2011.
2 LRA members were killed and 1 wounded in a clash with security forces in Napopo, DRC. 3 young boys managed to escape from the LRA  forces during the clash.

3 travelers who were abducted on August 29th later escaped while their LRA captors rested in the jungle near Napopo, DRC. They also managed to help 2 others escape for a total of 5 returnees. They were able to report the incident to security forces.
Security forces and suspected LRA forces clashed near the community of Napopo, DRC in the morning of October 14. As a result, 1 suspected LRA was killed and 1 security force injured.

Approximately 30 LRA were seen crossing a road near the town of Napopo, 14km SE of Bangadi, DRC. They were reportedly moving in the direction of the Mbuele River. Most were women and children, but some combatants carrying weapons were seen, as well.
One man traveling by bicycle was approached by three suspected, uniformed LRA near Napopo, DRC. The man was able to run away, but was shot and wounded. LRA stole all of his goods except the bicycle.
Suspected LRA forces shot and injured a man in the hand near Napopo, DRC.
LRA forces ambushed a hunter in Napopo, DRC on November 3rd. They chased him for 6 kilometers and fired at him 9 times, but he escaped uninjured.

In Napopo, DRC two suspected LRA signaled a 25 year old man to approach them. They reportedly laid down their weapons, but as the civilian walked towards them a third individual jumped out of the bush with a machete. The man ran away and escaped.
2 suspected LRA forces were spotted at Napopo, DRC. They confirmed to locals that they were hearing defection messages being broadcast over the radio, but said the messages were not clear.
Security forces clashed with a group of suspected LRA along the Banda to Dikuma Road in the DRC.
4 LRA members were sighted near Napopo, DRC. They also reportedly looted a home in the same area.
LRA forces attacked civilians in Badolo, DRC on August 15th, 2009. They tortured the civilians leaving one person dead and four people with broken legs.
On September 5, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in Badolo, DRC.
On September 27, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Badolo, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Badolo, DRC, killing 2 people.
LRA forces attacked Badolo, DRC, and killed 3 civilians. Security forces fought back as the LRA attempted to loot the village.
LRA forces clashed with security forces and killed 1 woman at Bodolo, DRC on March 14th, 2010.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 2 hunters near Badolo, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces attacked and looted the community of Badolo, DRC causing civilians to flee to Bangadi, DRC.

Security forces ambushed a group of 10 suspected LRA forces at Badolo, DRC. 1 abducted man was able to escape during the clash. This was the same group of LRA that attacked Bangadi, DRC the previous night.

On March 11th, 2013, 5 suspected LRA forces stopped a man near Banda, DRC, to interrogate him about the location of security forces in the region. After letting him go, they looted food and other goods from 5 households in the same area.
4  suspected LRA attacked 6 men and looted their belongings near Nangenze, DRC. The travelers escaped, but left their bicycles behind.
LRA forces killed 2 people and abducted 20 others from Nandike, DRC, between August 3rd and 4th, 2009.
LRA forces reportedly attacked Nandike, DRC, on September 18th, 2009. However, there are no details on the reported attack.
On December 12th, 2009, LRA forces abducted 9 people in Nandike, DRC.
LRA forces raided the community of Nandike, DRC, abducting 9 adults.
On January 6, 2010, 1 civilian was abducted from Nandike, DRC.
LRA forces clashed with security force at Nandike, DRC on March 5th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 elderly woman in Nandike, DRC.

A 12-year-old boy managed to escape from LRA captivity and reported at a security force checkpoint in Nandike, DRC. His group was reportedly composed of 10 armed LRA forces and was heading towards Makusa, DRC.
As reported on November 25th, 2011, a man escaped LRA captivity near Nandike, DRC.
LRA forces released a woman who was abducted earlier in the day from Nandike, DRC. Her husband, who was abducted at the same time, remains in LRA captivity.
At around 11:00 AM, LRA forces abducted a woman and 2 men (including the deputy village chief) from Nandike, DRC. Witnesses reported seeing armed LRA forces accompanied by children.

LRA released a 45-year-old man near Nendike, DRC, after abducting him earlier in the day. Once he was released, 2 other males, ages 12 and 18, escaped. The 12-year-old boy had been in captivity for over 1 year.
Around 9:00 AM, 6 LRA members ambushed a group of travelers near Nandike, DRC, and abducted 2 men, ages 18 and 45.
The body of a deputy village chief, abducted on March 5, was found roughly 1 km west of Nandike, DRC. He had been flayed and decapitated.
Mbororo herders sighted 8 suspected LRA forces approximately 10 km from Banda, DRC. 5 of the 8 people were armed. Security forces were informed of the sighting.
LRA forces killed 1 person at the village of Namatundu, DRC.
LRA members looted Kalawa, DRC. No other details were given.
Security forces and the LRA clashed in an area northeast of Ango, DRC. 1 LRA fighter was killed. This location is an estimate.
LRA combatants attacked Lolo, DRC on May 25th, 2010. They looted homes until a security forces responded.  2 LRA were wounded, and 2 civilians were abducted.
LRA members abducted 11 civilians at Lolo, DRC, on May 27th, 2010.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a combined total of 22 civilians during attacks on Bamundanga, Lolo, Balipio and Mulundu, DRC, in the month of May 2011.
On September 16th, 2009, LRA forces reportedly killed 5 civilians and abducted 20 others in Babitimo, DRC.
As many as all 6 of the recently abducted civilians were able to escape from LRA forces near Linamama, DRC, after they were recently abducted. The precise number of escapees is unclear.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 6 people from Linamama, DRC. An unknown number were able to quickly escape.
7 LRA forces abducted a man near Bangadi, DRC.
The man who was abducted  a day earlier by 7 LRA members in Bangadi, DRC, was able to escape the next morning around 6:30 AM.

2 suspected LRA forces conducted lootings between Duru and Kpaika, DRC. They first ambushed  3 men travelling on a motorcycle and then a man on a bike. All their goods were taken except the bicycle and motorcycle. The victims are all Congolese.
LRA forces abducted 5 civilians near Nambia, DRC, along the Duru River.
At least 6 suspected LRA members ambushed, beaten, and stabbed a man 26 km north of Anduala, DRC. The man survived .

Near Balama, DRC, 3 armed and suspected LRA men attacked 4 hunters who were organizing the animals they had killed that night. The assailants took the animals and the guns and told the hunters they did not want to kill them, but they needed the food.
On October 1st, 4 armed and uniformed LRA were sighted near Napopo, DRC. These suspected LRA burnt two houses and looted a large amount of goods from the homes.
A young boy with a baby was found at the village of Payote, DRC by the UPDF, having been released by the LRA.
A woman escaped from LRA captivity during a clash with security forces in Peyote, DRC. She had been abducted since December of 2009. She was injured in the escape.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in an attack on Kapilo, DRC.
LRA members killed 6 civilians during an attack on Kapilo, DRC.
On December 4th, 2009, security forces clashed with LRA forces near the village of Kapilo, DRC and were able to rescue 22 children who had been abducted.

5 suspected LRA combatants attacked a group of merchants returning from the Nabiapay market in Nambia, DRC. Security forces prevented the LRA from looting any goods. The clash lasted for 30 minutes and no security forces nor civilians were injured.
LRA forces and security forces fought for several days starting on 08 January in Nango, DRC. There are no details surrounding the outcome of the clash.
A teenage boy was abducted by LRA forces near Nango, DRC.
Civilians encountered 3 LRA members on a road near Nango, DRC.
Reported LRA forces attacked the village of Nango, DRC and killed 1 resident.

Related to the July 7th, 2009 attack on Bayule, DRC, another 2 people were reportedly abducted on the path from Bayule to Disolo, DRC. The mapped location represents an estimate between the two communities.

2 LRA members, 1 male and 1 female, were arrested by security forces near Pandani, South Sudan. They had escaped from LRA captivity 7 days prior, and were arrested after they were found walking through the forest.
Security forces pursued the reported LRA forces who had just attacked Gbere, DRC, and managed to rescue 1 of the 6 abducted children.
6 LRA forces raided Gbere, DRC, and abducted 6 children.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 2 people and stole goods from Gbere, DRC.
Suspected LRA shot and killed 2 civilians (both men) and reportedly abducted an unknown number of people in Gbere, DRC. Further detail to come.
LRA forces killed 4 civilians and injured 1 in an attack on a community south of Duru, DRC on May 10th, 2010.
As reported on April 1st, 2008, a large group of LRA forces looted Nangume, DRC and abducted a 15-year-old girl.
1 woman escaped from LRA captivity on May 8th, 2011 near Nangume, DRC.
4 armed LRA combatants looted sugarcane from civilians in Nangume, DRC. Security forces chased them down, but were unable to apprehend them.
9 fishermen were abducted east of Banda near Nagoda, DRC on April 2nd. 7 out of the 9 fishermen, including the community leader, were killed immediately.  2 others later escaped.
2 fishermen were released after being abducted east of Banda near Nagoda, DRC earlier that day. They were able to warn the nearby community of the attack.

LRA invaded in and around Nagoda, DRC on April 3rd. The community residents had been warned the day before, so many of them were able to escape with their belongings before the LRA invaded. Despite this, LRA burned homes and looted some items.

3 hunters had their meat, clothes and other goods stolen by 9 armed LRA forces near Madoro, DRC. The assailants spoke Acholi and Bangala. After the looting, the hunters returned to Duru to report what had happened.

9 suspected LRA forces, including 5 armed men, 2 boys and 2 girls, ambushed and looted 3 Congolese men 15 km east of Duru, DRC. The next day  the victims were forced to lead the assailants to their fields, where the assailants looted cassava and paddy.
The 3 Congolese hunters who had been ambushed two days earlier by 9 suspected LRA forces were released on November 7th, 2013 around 05:00. They walked for about two hours before reaching Duru, DRC.

Approximately 34 LRA forces claiming to be from Kony's group blocked all entries to a hospital in Duru, DRC on December 15th, 2007 before looting the place on three instances that same day. They stole money, medications, cloths, mattresses, and food.
LRA forces attacked and looted 3 religious establishments in Duru, DRC, between December 15th and 16th, 2007.
As reported on December 19th, 2008,  LRA forces looted Duru, DRC, and abducted 2 religious leaders for ransom.
As reported on April 26th, 2008, LRA forces and another unidentified armed group are operating in the area of Duru, DRC.
As reported on April 21st, 2008, LRA forces were sighted 16 km away from Duru, DRC.
As reported on April 23rd, 2008, a large group of LRA forces coming from CAR looted Duru, DRC, causing the population to flee to the forest.
On August 14th, 2008, 6 suspected LRA forces looted Duru, DRC.

LRA forces attacked Duru, DRC, killing an unknown number of civilians and abducting 65 students. They looted homes, the Catholic parish, and a health center, and burned schools. Part of a series of attacks targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.
A 14-year-old boy who was abducted in September, 2008, from Duru, DRC, escaped after three months in captivity. The exact date and location of his escape is unknown.
During the Christmas Massacres, LRA forces killed a total of 44 civilians in the Duru area of DRC, including Duru, Bitima, Nambia.

Between late Dec. 2008-mid Jan. 2009, the LRA killed more than 865 civilians & abducted at least 184 civilians in a series of coordinated attacks known as the Christmas Massacres through DRC & South Sudan.
Kony was reportedly seen fleeing from security forces in Duru, DRC. Following this encounter his group was reportedly moving towards Yambio, southern Sudan.
This incident is part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA forces attacked Duru, DRC, killing 4 people.
During the month of March in 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person at a farm near Duru, DRC.
Approximately 5 suspected LRA forces were spotted trying to obtain food from a local woman near Duru, DRC on August 19th, 2009.
As reported on September 2nd, 5 Congolese girls and 4 Congolese boys arrived in Duru, DRC, after being rescued by security forces from LRA forces around the Duru and Bitima areas.
A clash occurred between LRA forces and security forces on 27 September 2009 in Duru, DRC.
1 girl who had been abducted by LRA forces in February 2010 was able to escape to Duru, DRC, around March 24th, 2010.
5 LRA forces were spotted as they carried out a raid near Duru, DRC. The outcome of this raid is unknown.
LRA forces attacked Duru, DRC, on April 13, 2010, killing 3 civilians and abducting 5 others.
Between April 17th and 18th, security forces arrested 2 suspected LRA scouts in the Duru area of the DRC.
LRA groups were seen in the Duru, DRC area.
LRA combatants attacked a group of civilians near Duru, DRC. They shot 1 civilian who died from his wounds before reaching the hospital.
As reported on June 24th, 2010, 7 children escaped from LRA captivity near Duru, DRC, on June 24th, 2010.
Security forces clashed with LRA elements near Duru, DRC. 4 LRA were killed and 1 civilian was rescued.
In the Duru, DRC area, an LRA soldier surrendered to regional security forces.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces at Duru, DRC. 3 LRA fighters were killed.

LRA forces abducted 8 civilians from Duru, DRC. The abductions happened near a security force base. Security forces were informed, but no action was taken. The LRA forces sent a note saying " We are nearby, and will return soon."

LRA forces brutally stabbed to death 3 young men who had been abducted earlier that day from Duru, DRC with 5 others. The abductions happened near a security force base. Security forces were informed, but no action was taken.
LRA forces released a woman and a 16-year old girl who abducted the day before in Duru, DRC. They were released with the following message that said: "We are nearby, and will return soon."
A small group of LRA killed a young man in his home at night in Duru, DRC. He was 22-years-old.
In the area of Duru, DRC, 2 teenage boys who had been abducted by the LRA were found by security forces.
13 suspected LRA forces attempted to loot a household on the night of November 23rd but were stopped by local villagers in Duru, DRC.
A 14-year-old girl who had been in LRA captivity for an extended period of time returned to Duru, DRC, where security forces are trying to locate her parents.
As a resident of Duru, DRC was moving from a local market to his home he was stopped by suspected LRA forces and his goods were taken.
LRA forces and security forces clashed near Duru, DRC, causing the LRA  forces to flee the town's periphery. In the LRA's retreat, a 22-year-old Sudanese woman and 2-year-old child escaped.
1 LRA captive escaped to Duru, DRC,  after being abucted in May of 2010. He reported he was in a group of 21 LRA commanded by Lt. Col. Binany Okumu.
A 12-year-old child who was abducted in May 2010, was taken to Duru, DRC, by security forces after the child escaped LRA captivity. The child escaped in Garamba National Park at an unknown date.
Security forces captured an LRA member near Duru, DRC, who confirmed that an LRA group was active in the area.
LRA forces attacked Duru, DRC, killing 1 person and abducting 2 children.
2 adults with a baby defected from the LRA and escaped to Duru, DRC, between February 14, 2011, and February 16, 2011. They peacefully surrendered to security forces.
After her initial abduction by LRA forces on December 11th, 1 woman escaped on December 13th. She walked for two days before reaching security forces near Duru, DRC on December 15, 2011.
An 18-year-old woman who was abducted from Kurukwata, DRC managed to escape from LRA captivity near Duru, DRC.
A group of 4 suspected LRA forces were sighted by a civilian 3km from Duru, DRC.
A male of unknown age escaped from LRA forces near Duru, DRC. He had been in captivity for roughly 1 year.

A 15-year-old boy escaped from the LRA and fled to Duru, DRC. He was abducted 5 months ago from Aba, DRC, where his parents still live. He reported that he was with the group of 9 LRA that had looted the 3 hunters near Madoro earlier the same day.
3 LRA shot and wounded a civilian 6 kilometers west of Duru, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces looted corn from a field and abducted 2 brothers, aged 20 and 25, who were hunting. This incident occurred 1.5 km east of Duru, DRC.
The day after suspected LRA forces abducted 2 brothers near Duru, DRC, 1 of the brothers managed to escape. He immediately informed the population of what happened.

The day after the 1st brother managed to escape, a group of armed civilians and security forces pursued, found, and attacked the LRA force who held the 2nd brother near Duru, DRC. He was able to escape during the clash.

On March 15th, 2011, LRA forces ambushed a group of 6 civilians returning from fishing just east of Duru, DRC. 1 civilian was abducted, but was released later that evening. The civilian returned with an injury.
Security forces captured LRA Colonel Thomas Kwoyelo at Ukwa, DRC, near Garamba National Park on March 3rd, 2009. 3 abducted persons were also rescued.
Security forces and LRA had contact  with no reported violence near Ukwa, DRC. About 20 forces were observed.
Security forces attacked the LRA at a cave system near Ukwa, DRC resulting in the death of 3 LRA and the release of 3 women and 1 baby.
3 abducted civilians  were rescued at Ukwa, DRC, east of the Garamba National Park on  April 22nd, 2011. It is unknown who rescued them.

A 14-year-old girl spent 4 days in the forest after escaping from LRA captivity while gathering dried wood.  She came out on April 19th at Ayamba, DRC; she had been abducted from Bangadi, DRC on March 4th by a group of LRA under the command of Major Obol.
Suspected LRA attacked 2 civilians near Duru, DRC, and looted all of their food. The civilians fled, and no injuries were reported.

As reported on April 21st, 2008, a group of suspected LRA forces was sighted on the road between Tongotongo and Bitima, in the region of Naguga, DRC. 2 of them reportedly raped a school teacher's wife and looted a school.
4 LRA forces abducted and looted goods from 3 men and 1 woman near Bangadi, DRC.
A group of approximately 20 LRA, led by Dominic Ongwen, clashed with security forces near Ukwa, DRC.
LRA forces attacked the village of Nangwa, DRC and killed 1 person.
