9 LRA abducted 6 civilians outside of Banda, DRC. Among those 6 civilians, 2 were a mother and her daughter, 3 were teenage boys and 1 was a 3-year-old boy.
Suspected LRA forces shot and wounded a civilian on the road near Bangbi, DRC.
At least 8 suspected LRA forces were spotted moving west just north of Duru, DRC.

2 men and 2 girls, who were recently abducted northeast of Banda, DRC, were released by suspected and armed LRA forces hours after their initial abductions. The assailants took the clothes of the victims before releasing them.
Suspected and armed LRA forces abducted 2 men and 2 girls as they were traveling 12 km northeast of Banda, DRC. While in captivity, the assailants looted the victim's clothing.
On February 23rd, 2013, 2 men who had been abducted earlier during the day by LRA forces near Bangadi, DRC, were released.
On February 23rd, 2013, 7 armed LRA forces abducted 2 men on motorcycles near Bangadi, DRC, and looted their money and motorcycle batteries.
A group of 29 suspected LRA forces were spotted near Napopo and Mbamu, DRC. They were reportedly moving from South Sudan into a forest in the area.

The local population of Duru, DRC is afraid of an LRA presence northeast of the town because they have spotted tracks of a large group of people. Security forces have also reported that a group of 24 LRA, including dependents, have been seen in the area.
LRA forces attacked security forces in Manguruti village near Bamangana, DRC.
On August 15th, 2009, approximately 4 LRA forces faced resistance from a young boy as they tried to abduct him on the Duru road 3 km east of Bitima, DRC. Instead, they stole all of his belongings.
Of the 6 civilians abducted earlier in the day, 3 escaped when their LRA captors clashed with local security forces. Those that escaped were a woman, her teenage daughter, and a 3-year-old boy.

A 10-year-old boy, who had been abducted two weeks earlier, escaped from LRA forces between Kpaika and Kiliwa, DRC. Hiding by the side of the road, he stopped a driver who then took him to local security forces. The boy has been reunited with his parents.

A 56-year-old man and his 28-year-old son were in a field 5km northeast of Duru, DRC, looking for food when an armed man, suspected to be LRA, appeared and began to walk silently toward them. The father & son immediately fled and alerted the military.
A 24-year-old woman was released from LRA captivity after being abducted in February of 2012. She was reportedly 24 weeks pregnant, and was transferred to a medical facility in Duru, DRC.
A group of 10 LRA forces, including 5 combatants, 1 woman and 4 boys, attacked a household in Sili, DRC. They injured a 50-year-old man and looted all of his belongings.
A large number of armed LRA members were seen 18 km northeast of Banda, DRC.
9 civilians were killed by the LRA in an attack on Bansogoda, DRC.
A cyclist spotted a group of suspected LRA while he was traveling from Banda, DRC, to Naparka, DRC. This location is an estimate.
Shortly after being abducted at 1:00 AM on April 5th, a young man escaped from LRA captivity after fighting against 1 of the combatants near Diagbe, DRC.
LRA forces killed 4 at Babile, DRC.
5 suspected LRA forces released a man they had recently abducted from Babile, DRC. The 2 women and the 12-year-old boy who he was abducted with remain in captivity.
5 suspected and armed  LRA forces, 4 men and 1 woman, attacked the community of Babile, DRC, and abducted 2 women, a man and a 12-year-old boy. They also looted various food and non-food items.
5 suspected LRA abducted 3 boys near Bili, DRC, and looted their belongings, including 500,000 Congolese Francs. The combatants also severely injured a person in the attack.
LRA members looted crops in Nakale, DRC on February 21st, 2010.
LRA forces abducted 2 men who were returning from farming their fields at 8:00 PM near Duru, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces killed a woman as she went to fetch water early in the evening on March 16th, 2011 at Nakale, DRC.
LRA forces ambushed a security force member near Nakale, DRC. The security force member escaped after exchanging fire with at least 2 LRA members.
Suspected LRA forces shot and killed a man in his own home in Nakale, DRC. Security forces pursued the suspected LRA forces, but were unable to track them.

A civilian encountered a friend of his, who had been abducted by the LRA in 2009, near Duru, DRC. The LRA combatant reportedly inquired about his family members, and informed the civilian that another combatant had been sent to the market.

A 20-year-old woman was traveling along the road to Nakale 7 km northeast of Duru, DRC, when she saw 2 armed men, suspected to be LRA, in tattered military uniforms silently motioning for her to approach. She instead fled in fear.

A group of Congolese men on bicycles, coming back from a market in South Sudan, fell into an ambush of suspected LRA forces north of Kana, DRC. Some of the civilians escaped and others were looted of their possessions.

2 members of the LRA, 1 man and 1 woman, approached 2 fishermen near Nakale, DRC, and asked for food. They also expressed interest to surrender, and were directed to a nearby security post and given a defection flier.
Security forces engaged LRA forces at in the community of Nakpongo, DRC. 3 LRA were killed.
A confrontation took place between security forces and LRA members near Gurba, DRC, with further details unknown.

LRA forces reportedly released 4 women and 13 children in Nagbangili, DRC, just north of Duru. 3 of the returned are pregnant. The youngest child in the group is 7 months old and the oldest is 5 years old.
As reported on April 8th, civilians reported spotting 2 suspected LRA camps along the Diandolo river 18 km northeast of Sukadi, DRC, in the bush.

Security forces rescued a 13 year old girl in Nakale, DRC, after she had been sent to find food from nearby abandoned farms with 2 Sudanese girls and 5 LRA guards. She had been in captivity since September of the same year.
Security forces clashed with suspected LRA forces northwest of Duru, DRC. 3 LRA soldiers were killed, and 1 LRA soldier was wounded and captured.
LRA forces reportedly attacked Zikilingi, DRC, on September 24th, 2010. Several houses were looted and 4 men were abducted. 3 of the men were later able to escape, but one was killed.
3 of the 4 men who were abducted from Zikilingi, DRC on 9/25/2010 were able to escape on 9/25/2010. The 4th man was killed.
Around 1:00 AM, a group of LRA forces, armed with guns, machetes and sticks, abducted a young man and looted food and clothing from 4 households in Zikilingi, DRC.
The man of about 65 years who was tortured by 3 armed  LRA forces  was released after being temporarily abducted from Zikilingi, DRC.
3 armed LRA forces attacked one household at Zikilingi, DRC, looting clothes and food items. A man of about 65 years was tortured and temporarily abducted.
Security forces clashed with 15 LRA fighters along the road from Duru to Bitima, DRC.
4 LRA forces, including 3 armed men and 1 girl, abducted a woman and her daughter from 8 kilometers northeast of Duru, DRC.
As reported on November 17th, 2008, an unknown number of LRA forces were sighted in Lindimbia, DRC.
On September 10, 2009, LRA forces killed 3 civilians in Lindimbia, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Lindimbia, DRC, killing 30 civilians and abducting 20 others.
LRA forces clashed with security forces in Lindimbia, DRC.

A man, his wife, and child were traveling through Lindimbia, DRC, on their way to Doruma when they were attacked by the LRA. The wife and child fled north to Doruma, however, the husband is missing and is presumed abducted.
A 30-year-old woman escaped from LRA combatants. She was abducted earlier in the day from Lindimbia, DRC.
LRA combatants attacked Lindimbia, DRC, killing 2 people, including the local chief, and abducting a 30-year-old woman.

An escaped LRA combatant, who had been in captivity since 1999, surrendered to a civilian near Lindimbia, DRC. The civilian escorted him to local security forces. The combatant was repatriated to Uganda on December 8th, 2011.

3 LRA forces ambushed a soldier and 4 civilians near Lindimbia, DRC. The soldier was injured and 1 woman was abducted. The LRA forces then looted food, cigarettes, and soap. Nearby security forces responded, but were too late.
LRA forces clashed with security forces at the village of Yabinzo, DRC on July 17th, 2010.
Suspected LRA were sighted crossing the road near Bitima, DRC.
18 suspected LRA encountered 2 fishermen near the Gurba river in the DRC, and inquired where Mbororo people were located in the region.
3 abductees and 1 LRA officer were captured by security forces while moving east of Duru, DRC towards the Garamba National Park.
A group of LRA attacked a small group of civilians who were being escorted by a security force near Manguruti, DRC on February 19th, 2011.
On December 22nd, 2008, 15 suspected LRA forces attacked Lokurubanga, South Sudan, destroying 6 houses, and abducting 12 civilians.
12 LRA members surrendered to security forces near Doko, DRC on November 21st and 22nd.
LRA forces attacked a village between Bitima and Duru, DRC on July 11th, 2009. A local protection force stopped them and 1 LRA member was killed.
LRA forces attacked a Catholic Mission, looting the church and holding civilians hostages on the night between February 14th and 15th, 2008. They also raped an unknown number of women and girls.
As reported on April 1st, 2008 LRA forces looted the house of a local leader in Solo, DRC. They then retreated in the direction of Garamba National Park,
Suspected LRA forces looted a group of traders near Solo, DRC.
Security forces responded to a group of marketers who had been looted by suspected LRA. They engaged the 7 suspected LRA in the border town of Solo, DRC.
7 suspected LRA fighters looted goods from a group of marketers in the town of Solo, DRC. The marketers managed to escape and ran to the nearest security force checkpoint for help.

About 7 suspected LRA combatants attacked 5 people near Solo, DRC, returning from the market. They shot a young boy in the shoulder. A security force member heard and fired at the LRA fighters, preventing looting. A man was reported missing afterwards.
LRA combatants attacked security forces outside of Duru, DRC.
A group of suspected LRA attacked 3 motorcyclists near Zikilingi, DRC, and looted all their goods.
LRA forces released a woman and child who were abducted in Dorenzi, DRC.
7 men from the LRA attacked and looted Dorenzi, DRC. They abducted 1 woman and 1 child.

1 civilian, who was abducted by suspected LRA forces in November 2010, escaped in Dorenzi, DRC. This individual reported that the 5 others who were abducted at the same time were killed while in captivity.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian when they ambushed civilians and security forces on a road to Duru, DRC on March 12th, 2010.

2 boys escaped from LRA forces into a community near Naparka, DRC, after walking through the forest for 2 weeks trying to find their way out. 1 boy had been with the LRA for 1 year while the other was captive for 2 months.

A group of 6 suspected and armed LRA soldiers, including 3 adults and 3 boys, and 1 woman, attacked a farm near Bitima on May 27, 2011. There were 7 victims involved. Of these, 6 escaped and 1 woman was abducted.

5 suspected & armed LRA forces were spotted crossing a road from east to west near Ndoranzi, DRC. The man who spotted them fled and informed local security forces who went to investigate. The armed group were armed with AK-47's and had rasta-style hair.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA forces killed 23 people in Diagbe, DRC.
During the month of February in 2009, LRA forces killed 15 civilians in the forest near Diagbe, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Diagbe, DRC, on August 16th, 2009. 2 children were abducted in the attack.
On September 12, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in Diagbe, DRC.
LRA forces abducted 60 civilians and killed 1 in an attack on Diagbe, DRC, on September 16th, 2009.
On September 18, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 person in Diagbe, DRC.
On September 27, 2009, LRA forces killed 14 civilians in Diagbe, DRC.
On November 8, 2009, 1 civilian was killed by LRA fighters at  Diagbe, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Diagbe, DRC, killing 1 civilian .
LRA forces attacked a group of civilians and security forces on a road near Diagbe, DRC, on March 5th, 2010. 4 civilians were killed.
LRA forces attacked Diagbe, DRC, severely injuring 2 civilians.
In Diagbe, DRC, a 16-year-old boy escaped from the LRA and surrendered to security forces. He was originally abducted in 1998 when he was approximately 4 years old.
LRA forces killed a member of a security forces in the presence of his wife and child in Diagbe,DRC.
As LRA forces slept after a successful raid on Diagbe, DRC, a boy who had been abducted 6 months earlier escaped. This happened approximately on December 22nd, 2010.
7 LRA forces attacked Diagbe, DRC on approximately December 22nd, 2010, and looted goods from the town.
As reported on April 3rd, 2011, 5 children escaped from LRA captivity and surrendered to security forces at Diagbe, DRC.
A group of suspected LRA forces attacked travelers in Diagbe, DRC on June 3rd, 2011.
A boy reportedly escaped from LRA forces near Diagbe, DRC.
LRA forces were reportedly near Diagbe, DRC, sometime during the month of April 2012.
The LRA abducted 2 men, 2 women and 1 boy, as well as looted food from Bamunga, DRC.  They were released a week later.
The 2 men, 2 women and 1 boy who were abducted from Bamunga, DRC on April 5th, 2011, were released a week later by the LRA.
Suspected LRA forces released a civilian shortly after their initial abduction along the road between Nambiapai and Duru, DRC.

3 armed suspected LRA men ambushed and looted various goods from a group of motorcyclists on the road from Nambiapai to Duru, DRC. 1 civilian was abducted. Unspecified goods and money were among the items taken from the victims.
LRA combatants killed 1 person and injured 2 in an attack on Bitima, DRC.
After clashing with the security forces earlier in the day, LRA forces exchanged gunfire with additional security forces near Bitima, DRC.
LRA forces killed 2 men near Bitima, DRC..
3 of the 4 people who were abducted earlier in the day by the LRA were released. This event happened near Bitima, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Bitima, DRC, abducting 4 people and killing 1.  3 were later released.

5 LRA members, including 2 Ugandan men, 1 Congolese man, 1 Congolese woman, and 1 South Sudanese woman, escaped to local security forces near Bitima, DRC. One of the Ugandan men had been with the LRA for 17 years.
Around 8:00 AM, 3 LRA combatants were seen crossing the road near Bitima, DRC, on March 21st, 2011
A young man was attacked by suspected LRA forces in Bitima, DRC on June 1st, 2011; however, security forces were able to respond and the young man was able to escape unharmed.
An unknown number of suspected LRA coming from South Sudan attacked and looted a community near Bitima, DRC before returning to South Sudan.
Sometime between February 13th and 16th, 2008 LRA forces blocked a road at the border town of Mbamu, DRC, preventing the movement of civilians across the Sudan/DRC border.
LRA forces looted the community of Mbamu, DRC, on September 18th, 2009. There are no other details surrounding the event.
A teenage girl, who had been abducted from Masombo, DRC, managed to escape to Mbamu, DRC, 2 days after her abduction.
LRA forces attacked Mbamu, DRC and clashed with security forces. 1 civilian was injured and local businessmen were also looted.

3 suspected LRA forces, all armed and wearing tattered military uniforms, attempted to stop a motorcyclist going from Doruma to Dungu, DRC.  The motorcyclist accelerated sharply to pass the attackers and went to inform security forces in Lindimbia, DRC.
A group of 5 suspected and armed LRA soldiers was spotted by a civilian crossing the Duru-Nabiapai road, 1 km from a security force camp in Bitima, DRC.
Suspected LRA attempted to stop the son of a community leader from Bitima, DRC.  He was able to escape.
A group of suspected LRA crossed into the DRC from CAR near Bangbi, DRC, and Sakure, CAR. This event occurred between August 22 and August 26, 2012.

5 suspected LRA tied up and beat a 22-year-old hunter 13 km west of Bitima, DRC. The assailants told him that nobody should enter the forest, because it belongs to them and that they cannot stand the hunger in the bush. The hunter was then freed.
LRA forces attacked the community of Makusa, DRC, killing 2 people, abducting 3 people, and mutilating 1 other person.
LRA forces killed 3 people at Makusa, DRC on March 14th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian at Makusa, DRC on March 16th, 2010.
LRA forces looted Makusa, DRC. No further details were given.
Suspected LRA forces attacked 3 civilians at a river near Makusa, DRC on June 13th, 2011. The suspected LRA forces killed 2 of the civilians.
Suspected LRA forces attacked 2 civilians on a road near Bitima, DRC on July 13th, 2009. 1 civilian was killed and the other fled to alert the community who attempted to pursue the LRA forces.
As reported on April 1st, 2008, LRA forces looted a governmental office in Yakuluku, DRC.

This is a part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA force attacked Yakuluku, DRC, which is just west of Garamba National Park. They killed at least 40 civilians. Many remaining local civilians fled to southern Sudan.
Around May 31st, 2009, security forces rescued a young girl from LRA captivity near Bitima, DRC. It is unknown whether or not security forces clashed with LRA forces in the process.
On March 22nd, 2008, a large number of LRA forces looted a market in Bitima, DRC, before moving southeast.
As reported on March 29th, 2008, two different groups of LRA forces were sighted southwest of Bitima, DRC .
In the week preceeding August 15th, 2008, between 100 and 200 LRA forces reportedly attacked Bitima, DRC. This LRA group was reportedly on its way to Nabunga, DRC.

In the days after the September 17th LRA attacks on several communities, LRA forces attacked other communities including Bitima, DRC. This is part of a series of attacks thought to be targeting communities that assist LRA defectors.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces at Bitima, DRC. 7 LRA forces were killed, and 1 was captured.
On May 20th, 2009, Security forces reported that suspected LRA forces were spotted in the Bitima, DRC, area.
Security forces and members of the LRA clashed near Bitima, DRC, on June 27th, 2009. 5 children were rescued from captivity during the clash.
LRA forces killed 2 women in Bitima, DRC, on July 11th, 2009.
The LRA attempted to loot a village near Bitima, DRC, but were unsuccessful. 1 civilian was wounded.
LRA forces reportedly attacked the town of Bitima, DRC, killing and abducting an unknown number of people.
A farmer in Bitima, DRC, was attacked and injured by 5 LRA combatants wielding machetes.

A 37-year-old woman was who abducted by suspected LRA forces near Bitima, DRC, on May 28, 2011, was released the following day at an unknown location. The woman stated that she was forced to transport goods and cook food during her night in the bush.
All LRA groups reportedly met near Bitima, DRC, sometime during the month of June 2011.
Reportedly, a senior LRA commander occupieda former security force house in the region between Duru, DRC, and the S. Sudan border.
As reported on January 23rd, 2008 LRA forces have been living in Maida, DRC since the beginning of 2008.
LRA forces abducted 5 students from the fields near Nambagu, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a 10-year-old child near Makusa, DRC. As a result of this and other LRA attacks in the area, the  entire population has fled to Bangadi, DRC for safety.
Security forces clashed with the LRA forces northeast of the town of Duru, DRC. 5 LRA were wounded,  2 were killed, and 9 captured and evacuated to a hospital.
Around 4:00 AM, security forces clashed with LRA forces near Nangume, DRC. No injuries or deaths were reported.
A group of 10 LRA forces, comprised of 1 woman, 4 boys and 5 combatants, looted belongings from a man and his son in Nangume, DRC.
3 LRA members attacked a group of civilians near Duru, DRC, but were chased away by regional security forces. No one was injured in the attack but goods were looted.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 2 women near Bakaikpo, DRC and were spotted moving south of the town of Nambiapai, DRC.
As reported on March 23rd, 2008, LRA forces abducted 6 civilians and killed 4 others in Lorumba, Sudan, causing the population to flee to nearby towns.
A security force offensive operation confronted LRA forces near Bagbele, DRC and captured 3 combatants.

LRA forces attacked Sakure, a border town in southern Sudan. After exchanging fire with security forces, they killed a young boy and abducted 12 children. The assailants were apparently searching for medicine, weapons, and supplies.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. Suspected LRA forces killed a civilian who crossed into DRC from the border town of Sakure, southern Sudan.
A 45-year-old medical assistant from CAR who was abducted in 2008 escaped from LRA forces near Sakure, South Sudan. While with the LRA, he served as Joseph Kony's doctor.
LRA members abducted 6 civilians in Sakure, South Sudan, on May 2nd, 2009.  The number of casualties is unknown.
A group of suspected LRA attacked Sakure town in S. Sudan on July 21st, 2009. 2 people were abducted.
LRA attacked Sakure, South Sudan, on August 12th, 2009. 1 civilian was killed, 1 was wounded and 1 person was abducted.
On August 15th, 2009, security forces reported capturing an alleged LRA member in Sakure, S Sudan.
3 LRA combatants looted food from Sakure, S. Sudan on April 14th, 2011.
A clash between LRA and regional security forces occurred near Sakure, S Sudan, on July 26th, 2009.

9 armed LRA combatants clashed with security forces 30 miles south of Ibba County in South Sudan, near the border with DRC, on January 29th, 2011. The LRA fighters retreated towards DRC. 1 LRA member was killed. Location is approximate.
As reported on February 24th, 2008 LRA forces heavily looted a market at Nambiapai, a town located on the border between CAR and DRC.
On March 21st, 2008 following negotiations LRA forces released the local chief abducted at the market of Nambiapai, southern Sudan and Bangalu, DRC.
As reported on March 21st, 2008 LRA forces temporarily abducted a local chief at the market of Nambiapai, southern Sudan and Bangalu, DRC.
It was reported on March 22nd, 2008 that LRA forces looted Nabiapai, southern Sudan.

On December 26th, 2008, LRA forces attacked the market at Nabiapai, S. Sudan, and burned 3 motorcycles. On the same day and place, LRA forces burned 72 homes, killed 3 people and looted various goods.
LRA forces attacked the market town of Nabiapai, southern Sudan, killing one person and injuring another.
LRA forces abducted 2 adults and then clashed with security forces on February 1st, 2010, near Nabiapai, southern Sudan.
LRA forces killed two women near the market town of Nabiapai, southern Sudan on January 27th, 2011.
4 suspected LRA members were seen moving north from Nabiapai, southern Sudan.
LRA forces scared off women who were fishing near Nabiapai, southern Sudan, on March 16th, 2011. No injuries were reported.
Suspected LRA members stole goods from local civilians and traders at a southern Sudan/DRC border market in Nabiapai, southern Sudan, on March 25th, 2011.
On March 25th, 2011, LRA members attacked 3 civilians who were looking for termites at night near Nabiapai, southern Sudan. The local population returned fire with shotguns and injured 1 LRA member.
1 woman was abducted by suspected LRA forces from Nabiapai, southern Sudan, on June 1st, 2011.
Suspected LRA forces looted several houses in Nabiapai, South Sudan. The leader of the community has asked security forces for protection.

A 12-year-old boy, who had been abandoned by the LRA due to sickness 2 months earlier, was found at Nabiapai, South Sudan. He was transported to Duru the next day. The boy was originally abducted on May 30th near Kpegba, DRC.
5 LRA forces surrendered to security forces northwest of Duru, DRC. There are also reports of security forces clashing with LRA forces sometime throughout the month.
The 3 civilians who had been abducted by 9 LRA forces on Christmas Day in a community 35 km northwest of Bili, DRC, managed to escape. The exact time and place of escape is unknown at this time.

At around 10 am, 35 km northwest of Bili, DRC, 9 LRA forces looted food and non-food items from an unknown number of households. The assailants then abducted 3 civilians, including a woman, and burned a house.
As reported on April 6th, 2008, LRA forces were sighted in Limolo, DRC.  The presence of LRA forces led to the displacement of civilians in the region.
The LRA attacked and clashed with security forces in the village of Limolo, DRC.
LRA forces ambushed civilians and security forces along the road of Ndorenzi, DRC resulting in the death of 1 civilian.
LRA forces attempted to loot donated food from the village of Ndorenzi, DRC but were fought off by security forces.
LRA members killed 2 civilians and abducted 16 others in Digba, DRC, on September 26th, 2009.
LRA forces released 12 abductees on September 27th, 2009 at Digba, DRC. Before they were released they were forced to work all night shelling peanuts and were then whipped with branches and machetes.
LRA forces attacked Digba ,DRC, killing 2 civilians and abducting 20 others. During the attack, they reportedly burned 18 houses. This attack caused the population to flee towards CAR.

Between March 15 and March 20, 2010, LRA forces attacked the villages of Sukadi, Dakwa, Digba and Banda, DRC. Overall, twenty people were killed and fifteen abducted. The remaining populations fled. The numbers are split between three incidents.
The LRA attacked Digba, DRC on January 12th killing 1 civilian. After the killing the youth of Digba resisted the LRA and forced the LRA out of the town.
After being abducted from Bangadi, DRC, two years ago, a 19-year-old man escaped from LRA captivity and fled to the community of Digba, far west of Bangadi. The young man's family lives in Bangadi.

4 LRA forces escorted 28 captives to Digba, DRC, in order to release them. The group consisted of 7 boys, 13 girls, and 8 women. After reaching Digba, the group traveled to Ango. En route, 1 woman drowned, but the remaining 27 arrived safely in Ango.

2 suspected LRA forces were escorting 4 captive civilians carrying goods when they came across a woman drying meat near Ngbulunga, DRC. The assailants proceeded to steal her food and clothes and left her in her underwear before they continued eastward.
On January 3rd, 2010, LRA forces attacked Suka, DRC, killing 3 people, injuring 2 others and abducting 13 people.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and injured 2 others in an attack on Suka, DRC on January 4th, 2010.

A group of LRA forces composed of men, women and children, looted 2 fishermen in Malido, DRC, before killing one and injuring the other in the stomach. The wounded man was able to escape and is with security forces in Ango, DRC.
11 LRA forces ambushed a group of 8 travellers, and abducted a 20-year-old man near Mbamu, DRC. The combatants also looted white rice, peanuts and flour from the group.
From February 27 to March 3, 2009, LRA forces carried out attacks on Nakorda, DRC, that resulted in 43 people being abducted.
A large number of LRA members were spotted in Nakorda, DRC, around April 13th, 2010.
The LRA abducted 15 people fishing in a river near the town of Nakorda, DRC. 5 people have since escaped, however, 10 are still presumed to remain in captivity.
LRA forces abducted 15 people fishing in a river near the town of Nakorda, DRC, on March 24th, 2011. 5 of the abducted civilians were later able to escape.
The body of a man who was abducted on April 18th by 11 LRA forces was found and buried along the road between Mbamu and Limolo, DRC.

About 40 km northwest of Bili, DRC, 9 LRA forces killed 1 civilian on a bike, 2 security forces, and wounded another. They burned the bike, took  the guns of the security forces and abducted at least 13 civilians. 3 of them managed to escape the same day.
2 days after their abduction by 9 LRA forces from a location 40 km northwest of Bili, DRC, 10 civilians returned to their community around midday after having walked for 7 hours.
LRA forces attacked a group of civilians at Dalundue, DRC on April 9th, 2010. 1 baby and 1 other civilian were killed. 1 other civilian was wounded.
Suspected LRA forces attacked security forces who were accompanying 5 civilians in Dalundue, DRC. 2 civilians were killed and 2 others wounded.
6 suspected LRA forces, including 3 armed men and 3 unarmed women, ambushed 2 children and 2 men near Makusa, DRC. 1 man sustained head injuries during the attack.

As reported on March 25th, 2008, a civilian was captured by LRA forces after encountering a large LRA settlement in the area of Birisi, Sudan. He was released with the message that the LRA is not targeting civilians.
A group of LRA combatants were seen moving towards Birisi, South Sudan, on June 25th, 2009. The group was large and included women and children. The combatants reportedly killed 1 person near Birisi.
At least 1 LRA was wounded and captured in a clash between security forces and 8 LRA soldiers near the border town of Berisi, S. Sudan.
LRA forces reportedly killed 2 civilians in Moboloko, DRC.
Security forces clashed with a group of LRA near Moboloko, DRC. 7 LRA forces were reportedly killed.
LRA forces killed 7 civilians north of Duru, DRC, near the southern Sudan border.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces on September 4th, 2009 at Bangbuya, DRC. 1 LRA combatant was captured.
LRA forces killed 4 near Hoko, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 and abducted 9 in an attack on Hoko, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person and abducted 9 from Hoko, DRC.
The bodies of 3 civilians were found in Gangura, S. Sudan on May 13th, 2009. The civilians were killed by suspected LRA forces.
Suspected LRA attacked Gangura, S Sudan, on July 31st, 2009. 2 civilians were killed in the attack.
LRA forces attacked and killed 2 civilians near Gangura, S. Sudan.
Local security forces and LRA forces clashed at Masumbo Boma, Gangura Payam, S. Sudan.  The LRA members retreated towards Barimanga Boma afterwards, and security forces pursued them.
5 suspected LRA members abducted 2 women from Nambiri, S. Sudan on February 19, 2011. The women were forced to carry looted goods.
A group of 5 suspected LRA members released 2 women in Dimo, S. Sudan. The combatants had abducted these women 2 days earlier from Nambiri, S. Sudan. Local militia found the 2 women.
A group of 5 suspected LRA combatants abducted 2 children from Naibimo, S. Sudan. It is reported that this group had abducted 2 women in Nambiri 2 days earlier.  Location is approximate.

LRA forces attacked 7 hunters near Gangura, S. Sudan on April 9th, 2011. 4 of the civilians were killed and 2 are still missing. It is unknown whether or not the missing 2 were abducted. Security forces found 4 of the victims' bodies the next day.
During the month of February in 2009, LRA forces killed 4 civilians in or near Kpasi, DRC.
Security forces clashed with LRA members near Kpasi, DRC on June 25th, 2010, resulting in 4 LRA members being killed, 1 LRA member was captured, and 9 abductees being freed.
6 suspected LRA released 5 men and 5 women near Bambangana, DRC, after abducting them earlier in the day.
A group of 6 suspected LRA abducted 5 men and 5 women near Bambangana, DRC.
Security forces encountered LRA combatants east of Gangura, DRC on May 7th, 2011. 1 abducted civilian was rescued.
LRA forces attack Bambangana, DRC, on March 4th, 2009 and killed 4 civilians.
20 LRA forces abducted 30 civilians and injured 3 others in an attack on Bambangana, DRC, on May 24th, 2009. Banda may also have been attacked by the same group.
2,500 people have fled attacks by LRA forces in the Mopoyi Chiefdom in the DRC.
A 12-year-old girl was abducted by suspected LRA forces in July 2010 from Bambangana, DRC.
LRA forces ambushed members of a security forces near Bambagana, DRC, on their way to Manguruti, DRC.

LRA forces attacked Bambangana, DRC, on the morning of February 24th, killing 2 civilians and abducting 30 others. 2 girls escaped during the attack. The LRA announced their intention to attack Naparka next, and said that Kony was in the DRC.
On June 1st, 2011,19 LRA forces reportedly attacked Bambangana, DRC where 1 civilian was injured by three gunshots to the stomach. All 19 LRA were carrying automatic weapons.

1 LRA combatant entered a man's home in Bambangana, DRC. He asked about distances to large cities in northeastern DRC. After he looted clothes and machetes from the home, the LRA member left a letter for the FARDC asking to join together against the UPDF.
Suspected LRA attempted to attack the community of Bambangana, DRC. No further details of the incident were provided.
2 men and 4 women and 1 other person were able to escape from the LRA during a clash with local security forces in Uze, South Sudan.
2 men, 4 women, and 1 other person were abducted by LRA forces in Uze, South Sudan.
LRA forces killed 1 person and abducted 2 others from Nango, DRC, in late April 2009.
LRA forces ambushed 2 men on the road between Banda and Doruma, DRC, on December 3rd, 2009. 1 man was abducted and 1 was killed.
Suspected LRA forces looted peanuts from a community near the road between Naparka and Bambagana, DRC, on October 3, 2013.
LRA forces were spotted near Mount Mese in Garamba National Park, DRC.
A 23-year-old man escaped shortly after his abduction by LRA forces just south of Naparka, DRC. The 10-year-old boy who was abducted with him remains in LRA captivity.

36 LRA forces abducted a 10-year-old boy and 23-year-old man 3 km south of Naparka, DRC. The LRA forces proceeded to burn 3 houses and loot 25 others. Security forces responded to the attack and injured 1 LRA member in the exchange of fire.

32 armed LRA forces attacked the Kpindi roundabout 3 km southeast of Naparka, DRC, and briefly abducted a man and a woman with a baby. The same group also looted 2 households in the area stealing food, pots, a machete, clothes and money among other items.

A 52-year-old man and a 40-year-old woman with a baby who were abducted near Naparka, DRC, by 32 LRA forces returned from captivity shortly after their initial abduction. The woman escaped with her baby, while the man was voluntarily released.
LRA forces attacked Bayule, DRC, on July 7th, 2009. The reported number of people abducted varies. Approximately 68 people were abducted, including 3 clergymen.
Security forces and the LRA clashed near Bayule, DRC on May 7th, 2010, resulting the capture of 1 LRA member and 3 abductees being released.

During an encounter between security forces and LRA, 3 girls between the ages of 12 and 15 escaped after being held by the LRA for various lengths of time. This escape happened on the road between Doruma and Banda, DRC, near Naparka.
On January 2nd, 2009, suspected LRA forces ambushed a security force vehicle in Tore, southern Sudan.
On January 15th, 2009, LRA forces attacked a security forces' vehicle at a bridge right before Tore, southern Sudan. The outcome of this attack is unknown.

After roughly a month in captivity, a 23-year-old mother escaped from LRA forces with her two children sometime between June 3rd and 6th. The family was taken in by a local in Tore, South Sudan before being taken by authorities to Dungu, DRC.
LRA combatants killed a man and his son along the Uze stream in Gangura, South Sudan. Security forces pursued the attackers.
LRA forces attacked Namoongbiti, South Sudan, and abducted 3 people.
8 armed LRA members were sighted outside of Kidi, S. Sudan on April 21st, 2011.

On 17June 2011, in response to the attack on Kidi, South Sudan, local security forces staged a counter attack in which the 2 abducted youth were recovered and 2 LRA fighters were killed--local security forces brought back an arm as proof.
8 LRA forces attacked Kidi, near Gangura, South Sudan on June 17th, 2011 and abducted 2 children and injured 1 other civilian.
9 LRA combatants abducted an 18-year-old woman and injured a young man in Bamani, South Sudan.
LRA forces have been active in the Bureangburu, South Sudan area. As reported on May 5th, 2009, LRA forces looted and attacked nearby communities causing the residents to flee to Yambio.
LRA forces attacked the village of Bureangburu, S Sudan on August 13th, 2009. They looted the health center but the local population was able to react and forced them to retreat.
Suspected LRA forces were spotted in the forest between Sukadi and Digba, DRC.
2 people earlier abducted (1 older man and 1 woman) by the LRA from Dimbiro, S. Sudan were reported as killed on the same day of their abduction, July 3rd, 2009.
LRA attacked Dimbiro, S. Sudan on July 3rd, 2009. 1 man was injured, and 2 older people were abducted and later killed. The LRA also looted some goods from the town.
During the month of February in 2009, LRA forces killed 11 civilians and abducted 40 more in or near Naparka, DRC.
During the month of April in 2009, LRA forces killed 2 people at Naparka, DRC.
Security forces found 2 LRA abductees at Naparka, DRC, on April 22nd, 2010.
11 LRA members defected from the LRA and surrendered to security forces on April 28th, 2010.
LRA clashed with security forces in Naparka, DRC. 4 LRA forces were captured in the clash.
LRA forces and security forces clashed at the village of Naparka, DRC on June 17th, 2010. 2 LRA combatants were killed.
LRA forces abducted 2 children from Naparka, DRC.
LRA forces attacked a member of a security forces in Naparka, DRC.

At 4:00 AM a group composed of Mbororo and LRA forces attacked Naparka, DRC, killing 3 civilians. During the attack, they sent a young boy with a note telling security forces to stop pursuing the LRA.
LRA members ambushed 2 truck drivers contracted by an NGO in Naparka, DRC around 1:00 PM on April 12th, 2011. They were killed and mutilated.
An 18-year-old woman was abducted by suspected LRA forces in May 2011 from Naparka, DRC.
Three boys, age 12, 15 and 17, escaped during a clash between the LRA and security forces near Naparka, DRC, on July 11, 2011. They hid in the forest for five days before coming out on July 16, 2011.
After being forced to carry loot for a group of LRA members, a young man managed to escape captivity on July 31st, 2011. His brother was reportedly released, but has not yet been found.

LRA forces released 3 fishermen who were abducted on March 21st near the Gurba River, DRC. The fishermen reached Naparka, DRC around 2:00 AM on March 22nd and informed local security forces of their abduction.
LRA forces abducted 3 girls, aged 8, 11 and 13, and looted goods from 2 separate households in Naparka, DRC. Security forces pursued the LRA after they had left Naparka.
On March 22nd, 2013, a group of 8 armed LRA forces ambushed a motorcyclist around Naparka, DRC. The victim was held captive for 4 hours while all of his possession were looted. He was then released.
LRA forces killed one civilian just south of Yambio, S. Sudan on 27 January 2011.
3 girls, abducted earlier in the day to transport looted goods, escaped near Naparka, DRC after security forces clashed with LRA combatants.
LRA forces attacked Agbagada, South Sudan, on May 7th, 2009. They killed 1 civilian and wounded another.
The LRA attacked and burned 3 people at the village of Agbagada, S. Sudan. 2 of them died during the attack, and the other was in critical condition.
As reported on April 8th, civilians reported spotting a suspected LRA camp along the Gwane river 45 km south of Zapai, DRC, in the bush.
Suspected LRA forces released 2 women, abducted earlier in the day 25km south of Doruma, DRC. The man they were abducted with remains in captivity.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 2 women and 1 man 25km south of Doruma, DRC.
LRA forces attacked south of Yambio, S. Sudan at Uze Boma on January 27th, 2011, and abducted 4 people and displacing over 700. Local militia forces pursued the LRA forces as they left the area.

Of the 5 people abducted  by suspected LRA forces on January 27th, 2011, in Uze Boma, near Yambio town, South Sudan, at least 2 people managed to escape shortly after their abduction, although the total number is unconfirmed.

7 suspected LRA forces, all men, ambushed a young man 12 km northeast of Naparka, DRC, as he was cycling from Doruma to Naparka.  They tried to take his clothing, but when they didn't fit they took all of his money instead before letting him go.
LRA forces were reportedly spotted southeast of Yambio, S. Sudan.

A young man was ambushed by 2 armed & suspected LRA men while going from Gangala to Naparka, DRC. He was tied to a tree, whipped and asked questions about the presence of security forces in nearby locations. The young man was released around 18:00.
A group of civilians sighted a group of suspected LRA combatants, including 5 armed combatants, near Naparka, DRC.
LRA fighters abducted a boy along the Uze stream in Gangura, South Sudan.
LRA forces killed 1 person and abducted 4 more during an attack on Diebio, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces killed an estimated 2 civilians and possibly abducted others at Diebie-Adala, DRC on September 10th, 2009.
LRA forces attacked Diebie-Adala, DRC, killing 10 civilians.
Suspected LRA forces reportedly surprised 6 civilians in a field near Diebio-Adala, DRC.  3 of the civilians were abducted.
LRA forces attacked Yambio, South Sudan and looted good and supplies from the town.
During the Christmas Massacres, LRA forces killed more than 50 civilians and abducted 60 civilians in South Sudan in the Yambio, Maridi, and Mundri counties.
LRA forces clashed with a local militia in Yambio, South Sudan and the surrounding villages.
Suspected LRA forces were sighted at Baguga which is near Yambio, South Sudan.

Sometime around September 6th, 2009, a male abductee escaped from LRA forces  during a clash with security forces.  After a day and night of walking, he reached a town and was transferred to Yambio, South Sudan.
LRA forces abducted 8 civilians from a community near Yambio, South Sudan.
LRA forces killed 1 man and 1 woman in Yambio, SS on September 6th, 2010.
A group of LRA combatants looted medicine from a clinic in Bodo Boma in Yambio, South Sudan. Plotted location is approximate.
Boda Boma Primary Health Unit, a clinic in Yambio county, S. Sudan was looted and burned to the ground. The exact location of the clinic is unknown.

LRA forces attacked 2 men traveling by motorcycle along the road from Bodo Boma to Bazungua Boma in Yambio county, South Sudan. 1 managed to escape and inform the authorities. Security forces later found the body of his 20-year-old companion. GPS approx.

5 Sudanese children (2 boys, 2 girls and a baby) escaped from suspected LRA in November in the DRC. They were repatriated to Yambio, South Sudan on January 20th 2012. The exact date of their escape is unknown.
On October 26th, 2009, LRA forces reportedly abducted 22 civilians in Asa, DRC.
LRA forces clashed with a local militia defense force from Digba, DRC at Asa, DRC. No casualties were reported on either side.
LRA forces abducted 1 woman and 2 children in Asa, DRC, on January 2nd, 2010.

A large group of 30 suspected LRA forces were spotted near the northern edge of the Garamba National Park in the DRC. The group was armed and consisted of men, women, and children. The group had reportedly attempted to loot South Sudanese villages.

On June 5th, 2008, LRA forces retaliated against the previous day's attack on one of their camps by attacking security forces at the outpost of  Nabanga, Sudan. This attack led to the death of 7 civilians.
Security forces and LRA forces clashed at Nabanga, S. Sudan on June 14th, 2009. 2 abducted persons were reported as rescued during the clash.
LRA forces attacked a truck moving security forces from Doruma to Banda, DRC on April 10th, 2011. Goods were looted.
On January 7th, 2009, security forces on patrol and approximately 7 LRA forces clashed near Zangua, southern Sudan. 1 LRA member was killed and 6 were arrested.
A group of LRA fighters attacked the community of Zangua, South Sudan, killing 4 people and abducting 4 others.  Security forces pursued the attackers.
LRA forces attacked Zangua, South Sudan killing 4 people and abducting 4 others.

Civilians saw a group of armed LRA members at Zangua, South Sudan, and fled east to Nzara, South Sudan as a result.  They reported the sighting to security forces, who pursued the suspected LRA members.
A group of LRA combatants attacked Zangua, South Sudan, abducting 1 woman and stealing food. Some villagers fled as a result.
The wife of a village chief abducted earlier that day from Zangua, South Sudan, was able to escape from LRA activity.

About 14 armed LRA combatants attacked a village near Zangua, South Sudan, abducting the chief's wife and stealing food. Local security forces were unable to respond due to insufficient strength, numbers, and ammunition, but informed other security forces
1 LRA combatant, abducted in 2008, escaped during a clash with security forces in DRC on January 13th, 2011 and surrendered to local security forces at Zangua. S. Sudan 4 days later.
The man who was abducted by the LRA earlier from Bazungua, S. Sudan, was released on February 15th, 2011, but his son was kept captive.
A man and his teenage son were abducted by the LRA from the community of Bazungua, S. Sudan near Yambio.
A girl abducted by LRA forces earlier on September 4th, 2010 near Yambio, South Sudan, was able to escape.

6 LRA forces attacked the communitiesof Bodo and Nahua outside of Yambio, South Sudan. They killed 7 civilians and abducted 2 children, a boy and a girl. A 28-year-old former LRA abductee managed to escape during the attack. The exact location is unknown.
3 men were abducted by LRA forces in between Nzara and Yambio, S. Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 7 civilians and heavily looted most houses in Rasolo, Sudan, on March 28th, 2008.

3 suspected and armed LRA men attacked a nurse and her driver who were traveling by motorcycle 3 km south of Sukadi, DRC. The driver was killed and the nurse is presumed abducted. 2 traveling men reported the incident.
On the road to Bangadi from Doruma, DRC security forces clashed with 10 LRA fighters on January 13th. A Sudanese abductee managed to escape from the LRA after the battle.
40 LRA forces were spotted crossing the border from South Sudan into the Democratic Republic of Congo near Diebie-Adala, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person in early March, 2009, along the path from Banda to Pasi, DRC.
On July 17, 2010, LRA forces attacked the Navolo Catholic Chapel, which is 12km from Doruma, DRC, along the road to Bangadi. They killed 1 civilian and abducted 5 others.

4 women encountered 8 members of a suspected LRA group 1 km SE of Sukadi, DRC by the Api river. The assailants made the women write down a message for Sukadi's residents claiming that no one should interfere with their work and that they were not the LRA.

5 suspected & armed LRA forces, including a woman, attacked Api, DRC, during the night from November 8th to 9th, 2013.  They  abducted a 12-year-old boy and a woman, both Congolese, and looted goods. Local security forces were absent during that time.
On January 9th, 2009, suspected LRA forces killed 5 civilians and abducted 3 in Wowo, southern Sudan.
Sometime during the month of June 2009, 2 of the 5 civilians abducted by LRA forces in Sukadi, DRC, were released.
Sometime during the month of June 2009, LRA forces reportedly killed 4 civilians, inured 1 and abducted 5 in Sukadi, DRC. This attack caused a displacement of the population to Ango, DRC.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 4 civilians from Sukadi, DRC, and took them to Gwane, which is north of Sukadi. They also killed the driver of a motorbike who was carrying a local chief.
LRA combatants attacked Sukadi, DRC. According to a single source, 4 civilians were killed.
LRA forces abducted 1 woman and 2 children from Sukadi, DRC on December 25th, 2009, and killed 1 other person from the same area during the month.
On January 7th, 2010, LRA forces reportedly killed 1 civilian, abducted 2 others and injured 5 women  in Makorombo, which is 25 km from Sukadi, DRC.

Between March 15 and March 20, 2010, LRA forces attacked the villages of Sukadi, Dakwa, Digba and Banda, DRC. Overall, twenty people were killed and fifteen abducted. The remaining populations fled. The numbers are split between three incidents.
3 people were killed by LRA combatants at Sukadi, DRC.
Security forces and LRA forces clashed near Sukadi, DRC on March 28th, 2010. 3 civilians were killed.

The LRA have been occupying the Sukadi, DRC, area from Oct 2010 - Jan 2011 and are forcing villagers from the Sukadi and Digba areas to flee toward CAR. The LRA are cultivating fields and have been in conflict with the nomadic Mbororo people in the area.
6 suspected LRA forces attacked Sukadi, DRC, and abducted 5 children. They also looted medicine, a camera, portable radios, silver, clothes, shoes, and other items.

After suspected LRA forces abducted 5 children from Sukadi, DRC, they moved southeast toward Banda. After 2 days, the assailants released 2 children and told them to return to Sukadi with a note that said the group wished to speak with local leaders.

Sometime between February 13th and 15th, 2008, LRA forces blocked a road at Milagbe, DRC, stopping the movement of people to Dabio, Sudan. 
They then spent the night of the 15th in Naisa, DRC and left the Doruma area on the 16th.
A young student was abducted by LRA forces in Milagbe, DRC.
On July 5, 2010, LRA forces attacked Milagbe, DRC, killing 1 civilian and kidnapping 7 others.
On August 24, 2010, LRA forces abducted 1 civilian in Milagbe, DRC.
35 LRA combatants attacked the community of Milagbe, DRC. They abducted 2 boys and 2 girls.
3  of the 7 children who had recently been abducted from Milagbe, DRC, by LRA forces were released and able to return home.
LRA forces abducted 7 children from Milagbe, DRC, to transport loot. The youngest among the abducted was 10 years old.
Reportedly 50 LRA attack the community of Milagbe, DRC, killing 3 and abducting 7.
LRA forces attacked the village of Milagbe, DRC, for a fourth time in January 2011, seriously injuring 1 woman. Food was also looted.
A group of 8 LRA, composed of 1 fighter and 7 children, abducted a man traveling near Milagbe, DRC on his bicycle. The man was questioned about the location of security forces and other communities.
LRA forces released a man who was abducted 2 days earlier near Milagbe, DRC.
LRA forces killed a man in the community of Namama, S. Sudan.
5 people were reported abducted by the LRA from Namama, S. Sudan.
A group of 7 armed suspected LRA, comprising of 5 men and 2 women, abducted 1 man near Doruma, DRC.
10 LRA forces abducted 2 brothers from Babuya, DRC.
As reported on May 15th, 2009, 6 youth were rescued from captivity in the LRA at Nzara, S. Sudan. The date of their actual rescue is not known.
Reported on February 1st, 2010, security forces rescued 5 children and an 18 year-old woman from LRA captivity near Nzara, S. Sudan. 1 of the children was born in LRA captivity.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 8 adults from Nzara, South Sudan, on March 29th, 2010.
A local militia group captured 1 suspected LRA member near Nzara, South Sudan.
A small group of LRA forces was seen near Nzara, South Sudan. Security forces immediately pursued the LRA.
1 person, who was abducted earlier that day in in Nzara County, South Sudan, escaped from LRA forces.  The other 2 abducted villagers remained captive. This location is an estimate.
7 LRA combatants abducted 3 people in Nzara County, South Sudan. This location is an estimate.

A 17 year old girl who had been abducted by the LRA was able to escape in DRC and alert security forces in Nzara, South Sudan, to the presence and movements of LRA forces in the region. Some villagers fled, and security forces responded, deploying troops.
2 women, who been abducted by LRA forces in Uganda 15 years ago in 1996, were found by security forces in Nzara, S. Sudan, on June 6th, 2011. They were returned to their families in Uganda.
A 22-year-old Congolese woman now in Nzara, DRC escaped from LRA captivity on February 6th 2012. It is unclear where she escaped from.
1 girl escaped from LRA captivity on May 12th and was transferred to Nzara, South Sudan.
An Azande male defected in Nzara, South Sudan, after several years in LRA captivity.
LRA forces killed 1 person in Buye, DRC, during the month of May in 2009.
7 armed LRA combatants abducted 3 men and 2 women near Buye, DRC, and looted fish, weapons and clothing from them.

LRA forces released 3 men and 2 women, who were abducted on March 16th, near Buye, DRC. The combatants released them with a message instructing other civilians to remain calm and quiet upon seeing LRA forces in the region.

3 men fishing south of Zangabai, DRC, were surprised by 5 LRA forces. The assailants looted food and clothes from the fishermen. They then forced them to leave the place immediately, saying their group leader was camping in the area.

Local militia saw 2 armed LRA members 14 kilometers west of Nzara, South Sudan. They pursued the fighters, then reported the incident to security forces in Nzara and then another security force deployed to track the LRA fighters.
After a clash between the LRA and security forces north of Banda, DRC 3 abductees were released near Mabwodi, DRC.
Security forces and LRA forces clashed in Mabwodi, DRC, which resulted in 1 abducted civilian being able to escape.
LRA forces attacked Bakpara, S. Sudan, killing 1 person and abducting 3 others and looting homes in the area.
LRa forces abducted a man near Naisa, DRC.
1 suspected LRA member was killed by security forces when a group of LRA attempted to attack Barungburu, South Sudan.
LRA forces captured 3 businessmen from Mali, Ghana, and Togo. After their capture, 2 of the men were killed when they fell during the march. The 3rd man, from Togo, was abducted.

6 LRA forces abducted 3 fishermen near the Gurba River, 25km northeast of Naparka, DRC. The combatants looted the fishermen's clothing and freshly caught fish, and forced them to act as porters of other goods.
LRA forces abducted a woman in Nawangu, DRC.
As reported on January 20th, 2009, LRA forces were seen crossing the road between Eidi and Rasolo, southern Sudan.
More than 22 LRA looted Kpokpo, DRC, and abducted 14 people including 2 men, 4 women and a baby. The commander of this LRA group is reportedly a man named "Ali".
LRA forces released 13 of the 14 people they had abducted a day earlier from Kpokpo, DRC, to use as porters. 1 woman, who is approximately 30-years-old, remains in captivity.
Security forces captured 1 suspected LRA member near Lirya, S. Sudan.
LRA forces reportedly clashed with local security forces at Basukambi, South Sudan.  Other security forces pursued the attackers.
A female civilian abducted earlier that day at Basukambi, South Sudan, managed to escape LRA captivity and informed local security forces of the attack.
At Basukambi, South Sudan, 3 LRA soldiers abducted 2 female civilians and stole food.
A Member of Parliament in S. Sudan, was travelling home with his son when they encountered LRA forces. The LRA forces killed the son and the father was able to escape.

This is part of the Christmas Massacres. Suspected LRA forces attacked Mboroko Boma,  S. Sudan, which includes Dam?za, Nyadua, Mboroko Mbrookenyi and Mboroko. They killed 18 civilians, injured 8 and abducted 6 others. About 200 civilians left the area.
Suspected LRA forces attacked a group of villages called Mboroko Boma, South Sudan, on February 18th, 2009.

At 7:00 PM the LRA attacked the village of Mboroko, S. Sudan, killing 2 male adults and wounding a young mother. The young woman was transported to a local hospital for medical assistance by security forces.

Overnight, 6 LRA, comprised of 4 armed individuals and a boy & girl, aged 10, looted food and non-food items from 9 houses in Alingbutu, DRC. Among the looted items were machetes and hoes. They also abducted 3 men to use as porters for the stolen goods.

3 men, who were abducted the night before to carry looted goods, were released by LRA forces. The men returned to Alingbutu, DRC, and reported that the LRA group was settled along the Zangazi river and were armed with AK-47's.
LRA forces attacked security force members on the road to Kana, near Doruma, DRC on June 25th, 2010. This location is an estimate.
LRA  forces burned down a church in Kasia, S. Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces ambushed a security force vehicle near Ringazi, in Nzara County, South Sudan, killing the driver and wounding 4 others. The plotted location for this incident is an estimate.
Around 2:00 PM, 6 LRA forces attacked a group of 13 people fishing near the Gurba River, about 30km northeast of Naparka, DRC and looted all of their fish. No one was injured during the attack.
LRA forces intended to attack a small community outside Doruma, DRC on July 25th, but were intercepted by security forces. 1 LRA member was captured.
LRA members killed 6 civilians and abducted 9 others in an attack on Sukadi and Gwane, DRC, on October 4th, 2009.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces at Gwane, DRC. 3 LRA forces were killed, 1 was captured, and 3 civilians were freed from captivity.
4 LRA abducted a man near Gwane, DRC, and the Mbomou river.

8 nomadic Mbororo breeders, including 2 women, were ambushed and killed by LRA forces east of Gwane, DRC. 2 others survived and fled in different directions. 1 survivor reached Dakwa and reported the incident. Livestock were also killed in the attack.
On February 12th, 2008, LRA forces reportedly killed 3 civilians in Dabio, DRC, while on their way towards CAR.
LRA forces abducted 2 women in Dabio, DRC, on approximately  February 13th. 2008. This incident is linked to a series of human rights violations perpetrated by the LRA on their move towards CAR.
A missing 15-year-old boy was suspected abducted by LRA forces near Doruma, DRC.

On March 18th, 2008 LRA forces were reported at 64 km away from Doruma, DRC causing the local population to hide in the bush. This is reportedly the same group that abducted 70 civilians in Ezo, Sudan a day earlier.

Between March 22nd and 23rd, 2008,  a large group of LRA forces looted several villages and a health center in Doruma area, DRC. In addition, 8 civilians, of which a teacher, 1 male student, 3 female students and 3 other girls were abducted.

During the Christmas Massacres, LRA forces killed 300 people in the Doruma area. After several large attacks, they attacked and killed civilians in Douane, Natalubu, Bama, Naulu, Katinga, Bakulagba, Masombo,Gadi, and Mogoroko.
During the month of March in 2009, LRA forces killed 2 civilians and abducted 8 more at Diagbwo in the greater Doruma area in the DRC.
During the month of March in 2009, LRA forces killed 5 civilians between Bilikwa and Sanango in the greater Doruma area in the DRC.
5 suspected LRA forces armed with various weaponry were spotted near Doruma, DRC, as reported on May 21st, 2009.
A large group LRA forces and abductees were spotted near Doruma, DRC around November 7th and 8th, 2009.
3 LRA fighters surrendered on November 11, 2009 at Doruma, DRC.
An LRA member peacefully surrendered to security forces on November 23rd, 2009 near Doruma, DRC.
An LRA member defected and surrendered to security forces near Doruma, DRC, on November 27, 2009.
5 LRA members surrendered to security forces near Doruma, DRC, on December 8th, 2009.
On December 20th, 2009, 6 LRA soldiers were captured by security forces in Doruma, DRC as they were traveling south.
Security forces and the LRA clashed near Doruma, DRC resulting in the death of 1 civilian.
On April 12, 2010, LRA forces clashed with security forces in the Doruma area of the DRC resulting in the death of 1 civilian and the abductions of 5 others.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces in Doruma, DRC, resulting in the death of 6 LRA members and the injury of at least 1 other member.
On June 12, 2010, LRA forces attacked a farm near Doruma , DRC, and abducted 2 civilians.
LRA forces attacked security forces near Doruma, DRC.
20 LRA forces captured a 16-year-old boy outside Doruma, DRC on April 18th, 2011. They used him in other attacks on Doruma over the next few days. They stole various goods from the boy as well.

20 LRA members attacked Doruma, DRC. They fought throughout the night with security forces. Several homes were looted and LRA forces killed 1 man who was trying to stop his son from being abducted. The young boy was abducted.

LRA forces attacked Doruma, DRC, on April 20th, 2011. They were able to abduct 2 children before being chased out of town by security forces. 1 civilian tried to stop the LRA from looting his home and was killed.
LRA forces released 2 abducted boys in Doruma, DRC. 1 of the boys was abducted with his 11-year-old younger brother, who was not released. He was kept to be trained as a child soldier.
4 civilians who had been abducted from Doruma, DRC, were able to escape shortly after being abducted on April 30th, 2011.

LRA members abducted 4 civilians and looted homes the night of April 30th, 2011 at Doruma, DRC. This was the same night that UN forces left the community. The 4 abducted civilians were able to escape (see related incident).
Around July 4th 2011, 2 women were abducted from a community near Doruma, DRC. Security forces pursued them.

A 17-year-old boy abducted in Banda, DRC on October 10th 2011 escaped LRA captivity on February 7th 2012. He had been sent to collect information around Ezo, South Sudan; he surrendered to security forces when he realized he was no longer being monitored.
Presumed LRA looted food and livestock from a group of Mbororo, a nomadic group present in northeastern DRC. This incident took place near Gbondi, DRC.
Security forces reportedly "threw bombs" at the location of presumed LRA combatants, near Gbondi, DRC. The result of the attack is unknown.
3 adults were abducted by 5 LRA near Doruma, DRC on the night of July 2nd. The LRA also stole various goods and food.

When security forces intervened in an LRA attack on July 3rd, 2 adults, who were abducted from Nambasa, DRC, were able to escape. A 12 year-old girl who had reportedly been with the LRA for 2 years was also able to escape.

4 suspected LRA combatants ambushed 2 travellers on motorcycles near Bulumasi, DRC and looted all of their belongings, including their civilian clothing. There were reportedly more LRA nearby in the bush.
Suspected LRA attacked a group of students traveling to school through Bulumasi, DRC. The students fled from the scene of the attack.
12 LRA invaded Makpelenga, DRC, on July 3rd, 2011. They looted food and other goods from many homes and  abducted a woman forcing her to carry the looted goods.

After 2 days of carrying loot, a woman in her 40's was released from LRA custody. She explained that after her abduction, the group of 12 LRA met up with at least 50 more people before letting her go. She is now in the custody of regional security forces
Suspected LRA members attacked Embe, S. Sudan and clashed with security forces on July 6th, 2009. 2 civilians and 1 LRA member were killed, 1 LRA member was injured, and 6 civilians were abducted.

4 LRA forces attacked security forces in Diabaka, DRC. 1 LRA member was wounded, 1 child was abducted, and 2 previously abducted children were able to escape, including a 13-year-old boy and an 11-year-old girl who was a "wife" of one of the commanders.
A local chief at Gangala, DRC,  was released on March 16th, 2008 after spending 7 hours in captivity.
On March 16th, 2008 LRA forces looted Gangala, DRC, and temporarily abducted the local chief.
LRA forces attacked a group of traders near Gangala, DRC on March 16th, 2010. LRA forces killed 3 civilians, wounded 1, and 3 others were able to escape unharmed.
A 25-year-old woman escaped from the LRA and fled to Gangala, DRC, after being held for three weeks.
LRA forces attempted to abduct two traders in Gangala, DRC, who were on their way home from the market on March 17th, 2011. One of them was able to escape, but 1 trader was abducted.
A teenage girl escaped LRA forces on September 11th in Gangala, DRC. She was originally abducted from Bangadi 3 years ago.

On February 19th, 2010, security forces attacked 2 LRA camps, 1 near Gurba and 1 near Nambia, DRC (near Niangara) freeing a total of 113 people. The total number has been split between the two camps as the individual numbers are unclear.
A young boy and girl escaped from LRA forces near Gurba, DRC, and informed security forces that a group of 80 heavily armed LRA were near Naparka, DRC.
LRA forces released 3 people, including one teenage girl, near Bangassou, CAR. They had originally been abducted from Madabazouma, CAR on July 4th, 2010.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA forces attacked Eidi, southern Sudan, and abducted 4 civilians.
A man abducted several months earlier in the DRC escaped into the border town of Eidi, in South Sudan.

2 Central African hunters were abducted overnight by 9 LRA forces, all men, near Sukadi, DRC. 8 of them were armed and spoke Acholi. They asked for the directions towards Mboki and Maboussou and told the hunters that they do not want to harm civilians.
The 2 Central African hunters who had been abducted overnight by 9 LRA forces near Sukadi, DRC, were released the next day.
During the Christmas Massacres, LRA forces killed 3 people they had abducted the day before in Batanda, DRC. According to the report, the civilians were possibly used as guides to other towns.

This is part of the Christmas Massacres. In Batanda,  DRC, LRA forces killed 82 civilians, abducted 3 (who were killed the next day), &  raped many women. Many victims' heads were smashed in by clubs.  The youngest killed was an 8-month-old boy.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA forces killed 50 civilians in Mabando, DRC, after using the radio songs to lure people into the center of town.
2 women who were abducted near Doruma, DRC were released shortly after they were captured on July 4th, 2011 as a result of a security force pursuing the LRA.
LRA and security forces clashed near the town of Ibba, South Sudan.
As reported on April 8th, civilians reported spotting a suspected LRA camp along the Naango river northeast of Gwane, DRC.
2 farmers were attacked by suspected LRA forces on their way back to Banda, DRC from getting food in Mboki, CAR. They were beaten and all their food was taken.

A woman encountered 5 suspected LRA combatants while she was fetching water from a river near Doruma, DRC. The combatants advised her not to return to the river, because of the presence of other LRA in the area.
According to the 12-year-old girl who escaped LRA captivity on July 3rd, 2 young boys were killed in Banzey, DRC by LRA combatants because they could not walk any further.

This is part of Christmas Massacres. In Nagengwa, DRC, LRA forces killed 30 people, including many children. They looted homes. 2 babies were killed and 2 children injured when LRA forces twisted off their heads.
A hunter encountered 7 presumed and armed LRA near the Gurba River in the DRC. He shot and injured one of the combatants, and fled to inform security forces.
12 LRA combatants abducted a pastor from Lumu, DRC, on July 9th, 2011.
3 people who were abducted in late February 2010 along the Gwane-Mboki path in the DRC, came out of the bush the following day.
LRA forces abducted 6 people and killed 1 along the Gwane-Mboki path in the DRC. These attacks took place in late February 2010.
LRA forces abducted 2 children from Bengenga, DRC during a period of 3 attacks between January 10th and January 15th. They also looted goods from the town.
This is part of the Christmas Massacres. LRA forces killed 3 civilians, wounded 1 more and abducted 9 others during an attack on Bangolo, southern Sudan.
LRA forces killed 1 person between Duma and Gangala, DRC, during the month of August in 2009.
29 civilians, who had been recently abducted by LRA forces, were released about halfway to the LRA base in Mabanga in the DRC. These coordinates are an estimate.
LRA forces killed 2 people and abducted 7 at Zangabai, DRC, during the month of March in 2010.
LRA forces burned 9 homes during an attack on Zangabai, DRC.

About 22 armed LRA forces abducted 5 Congolese men and looted food and non-food items from most of the households in a community east of Zangabai, DRC. They also destroyed a motorcycle. This attack led to a displacement of the population.
Security forces on the ground confirmed an LRA sighting in the forest north of Gwane, DRC. LRA were reportedly setting up a camp and preparing for others to join the group.
Security forces fought with the LRA for several hours resulting 9 LRA deaths, 2 LRA captured, and 7 LRA wounded. This clash happened near Buani, DRC.
Security forces clashed with LRA forces near the South Sudan border at Buani, DRC.
LRA forces killed 3 people and injured 2 more at Mapusa, DRC on March 16th, 2010.
Suspected LRA forces killed 1 man near Manikakara, South Sudan, on the morning of February 27th, 2009, and looted the village.
A small group of LRA fighters abducted 3 boys along the Doruma Road near Bengengai, South Sudan, near the border with Congo. The location of this incident is an estimate.
A suspected LRA spy was arrested by security forces in Bagugu, DRC, on November 13, 2013.  The woman, a Congolese native, claimed that several LRA forces were located near Doruma.
As reported on September 11, 2009, a Congolese boy, who escaped from LRA captivity is being treated in Juba, southern Sudan.
Attacks by the LRA near the community of Lafaye, CAR near DRC/CAR border forced 420 people to flee their homes toward Bondo.
On March 22nd, 2009, LRA forces attacked Zamoi, DRC. No further details are known.
The community of Bana, CAR, was reportedly looted by suspected LRA members during the weekend of April 27-28, 2013.

This is part of the Christmas Massacres. A group of 50 suspected LRA forces attacked Luru, southern Sudan, killing 3 civilians and abducting 4 girls as well as looting the community. Some of the civilians left to take refuge in Malakia, southern Sudan.
LRA forces killed 5 people along the road from Rafai, CAR to Bangassou, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Madabazouma, CAR, and killed 4 people, including 2 women. Additionally, 8 people were abducted including a young man and a girl.
LRA forces attacked both Agoumar and Madabazouma, CAR on the same night, January 14, 2011, abducting a total of 12 civilians, mostly women, from the two towns.
A suspected LRA spy was captured at the village of Madabazouma, DRC near Bangassou, DRC.
LRA forces killed 1 person at Mogoloko, DRC, during the month of August in 2009.
LRA forces killed 2 civilians and abducted 2 others in an attack along the Mboumou river on the border of CAR and DRC on February 27th, 2010.
On February 22nd, 2013, LRA forces abducted 2 civilians, including 1 woman, and looted food from several households in Ulima, DRC.
At least 17 LRA forces released 3 men and 3 women at Ulima, DRC, a day after their abduction. They were used as porters during their time in captivity.

This is part of the Christmas Massacres. Suspected LRA forces set fire to a park guard vehicle, looted food and livestock and burnt to death the daughter of a local chief in Maridi  County, S. Sudan. 3 individuals were also killed by the suspected LRA.
One civilian was raped by suspected LRA forces near Maridi, Southern Sudan.
LRA forces reportedly killed 7 civilians and abducted 6 others in Maridi County, southern Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces killed 1 man when passing through Tigi, South Sudan, on February 18th, 2009. Security forces intervened and pushed back the assailants.
One day after killing a man in Tigi. South Sudan, suspected LRA forces came back and shot 1 civilian in the knee early in the morning of February 19th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 9 people along the road to Duma, DRC, in the month of September in 2009.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Napere, DRC killing 1 civilian and wounding another.

At least 17 armed LRA, comprised of 13 men, 2 boys and 2 women, looted & abducted people from multiple communities along the road between Gwane, DRC, & Zemio, CAR. In total, 36 people were abducted and food, clothing and other goods were looted.

9 LRA forces released a man and woman along the road that leads toward Doruma, DRC, a few hours after their abduction from Pasi, DRC. The 12-year-old girl that they had been abducted with remains in captivity.
LRA forces killed 1 person at Masombo, DRC, in the month of July in 2009.
LRA forces killed 1 person at Mosombo, DRC, during the month of August in 2009.
LRA forces abducted a young teenage girl from Masombo, DRC. She was later raped in captivity but then managed to escape.
On March 8th, 2010, LRA forces raped a teenage girl they had recently abducted from Masombo, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Masombo, DRC, on May 18, 2010, killing 3 civilians and abducting 2 others.
35 suspected LRA forces were spotted at Masombo, DRC.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Masombo, DRC, and looted paddy, groundnuts and fresh cassava from an unknown number of households.
LRA members killed 3 civilians and burned at least 1 vehicle in an attack at Lingasi, S Sudan on July 30th, 2010.
LRA forces abducted 7 civilians from Pasi, DRC, over the month of May, 2009.
On October 31st, 2009, LRA forces reportedly abducted 2 civilians in Pasi, DRC.
LRA forces killed 4 people at Pasi, DRC, during the month of March in 2010.
LRA forces abducted 5 people from Longodo, DRC, which is in the Pasi area. These abductions took place during the month of April in 2010.
LRA forces abducted a local trader near Pasi, DRC. His goods were stolen and he was released the next day.
LRA forces released a trader a day after the abduction on November 29th. The trader was released near Pasi, DRC.

9 LRA forces abducted a man, woman and 12-year-old girl, shot a catechist in the leg, and looted food, money, clothing, and other goods from Pasi, DRC. Security forces pursued the assailants with no success.
A 17-year-old girl escaped shortly after she was abducted by suspected LRA forces from Pasi, DRC.
LRA forces abducted a 42-year-old pastor near Pasi, DRC. He was used as a guide for the assailants throughout the night.

14+ LRA forces attacked Pasi, DRC. They burned 14 homes, abducted a 17-year-old girl, injured 2 people, looted goods including some radio equipment, medicine, food, and a motorcycle battery. 1 man escaped during the attack, and 1 LRA member was killed.

On March 1, 2013, 5 suspected LRA forces injured 1 woman & 1 man 45km W of Rafa, CAR, and looted food & non-food items before going north. The assailants were reportedly wearing "SS" badges on their shoulders.
A woman abducted earlier that day in an LRA attack on Jumara village, South Sudan, was rescued. Her baby however, who was abducted with her, was not. The details around her return are unclear.
LRA forces attacked Jumara, South Sudan, abducting a woman and her baby, killing 2 people, and injuring 2 more.

Suspected and armed LRA forces attacked Gadi, DRC, and abducted 5 men and 1 boy, all Congolese, as well as looted unspecified food and non-food items from 12 households. The assailants spoke several languages and wore military uniforms.
Security forces clashed with members of the LRA near Duma, DRC on June 30th, 2009. 2 LRA were killed in the clash.
Over 50 people fled south to the DRC to avoid LRA forces near Selim, CAR.
LRA forces attacked border town of Selim, CAR forcing 68 people to flee south across the border into DRC.
The suspected LRA spy captured earlier on February 14th, 2011 was killed at the village of Selim, DRC.
Suspected LRA attacked the village of Selim, CAR.  No further details are currently available.
LRA forces attacked Darsoubar, CAR, and abducted 3 people.
LRA forces released 4 of the 6 people they had recently abducted from Gangakoulou, CAR.
LRA forces attacked the town of Gangakoulou, CAR, and abducted 6 people.
On March 20th, 2008, it was reported that a large group of LRA looted towns in the area between Naandi and Ezo,  southern Sudan, as they were moving westwards.
6 LRA fighters clashed with security forces in Diabio, South Sudan on May 24th, 2010. 1 LRA soldier was killed, and 2 women were rescued.  Security forces pursued the attackers.
An Azande male defected in Diabio, South Sudan, after several years in LRA captivity.
LRA forces abducted a man on the morning of February 10th, 2013 near Gadia, CAR.
LRA forces released 4 of the 8 people they  had abducted from Louete, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Louete, CAR, killing 1 person and abducting 8 others. Of the 8 abducted, 4 were released that same day.
5 civilians, who were abducted from Katambour, CAR, earlier in the day were released, and another managed to escape.
LRA forces attacked Katambour, CAR, killing 1 person and abducting 15 others.

After being abducted by 5 LRA forces, the 8 captives were forced to carry goods 5 km to an LRA camp manned by 4 LRA forces. Along the way, 1 of the girls was raped and 1 man was hit in the face with the butt of an AK-47 before they were released.

5 armed LRA forces attacked a truck belonging to an NGO at Katambour, CAR. The assailants looted various goods. 8 people were abducted and forced to carry goods approximately 5 km back to the assailants' camp.
An unknown number of LRA were sighted crossing a road near Rafai, CAR. The group consisted of women, children, and fighters, and was reportedly inspecting a nearby river.
LRA forces released 3 people shortly after they were abducted from Mangoupa, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Mangoupa, CAR and abducted 3 people for a short period of time before releasing them.
LRA forces attacked Baruka, S. Sudan on July 16th, 2009.  4 people were abducted and 1 person was injured.
LRA forces attacked Baruka, S. Sudan and abducted 2 people on July 18th, 2009. The same group then moved north towards Andari.
A group of  LRA combatants abducted 10 civilians near Pangu, DRC. 2 members of the group of LRA forces also escaped during the incident.
Security forces and approximately 6 LRA forces clashed near Duma, DRC. At least 3 LRA elements were killed and 1 LRA officer was captured.

On February 24th, 2013, a man sighted 8 suspected LRA forces in Agoumar, CAR. On his way to alert security forces, he and another man were attacked by 2 suspected LRA forces near Rafai, CAR.  The men escaped on foot and the LRA looted their motorcycle.

Following an attack by 3 LRA forces, a group of civilians reportedly retaliated against the combatants and killed 2 LRA forces and injured 1 other LRA member. This event occurred outside of Detia, CAR.

3 LRA combatants looted 3 households in Detia, CAR. They attempted to abduct an elderly woman, but left her behind after she was unable to keep up with their pace. A group of young men followed the combatants, but no further information was reported.
3 armed LRA combatants abducted 2 men as they traveled from Bangassou, CAR and looted all of their belongings, including food, clothing and cellphones.

LRA forces abducted 6 civilians and looted goods from Agoumar, CAR. The combatants also shot at a man just outside the community, and looted the battery of his motorbike. The population of nearby Rafai, CAR fled their community because of this attack.
