In a massive attack on the town of Agoumar, CAR, LRA forces abducted an estimated 50-60 people, killed 10, severely injured 5, and proceeded to loot and burn property. 1 LRA fighter was killed by the local population.

This is the 6th time the LRA has attacked Agoumar, CAR in 16 months. The LRA attacked both Agoumar and Madabazouma, CAR, abducting a total of 12 people, mostly women, from the two towns. It is unknown how many people were killed.
A girl, abducted by LRA forces earlier in the day in Agoumar, CAR, escaped.
3 LRA members abducted 2 women, their brother, and their nephew from Agoumar, CAR.

LRA forces released 2 women who had been abducted 3 days earlier from Agoumar, CAR, because one of them became seriously ill. Their brother and nephew, abducted at the same time, have not been released.
2 women and 3 men, abducted on February 27th from Agoumar, CAR, were released by LRA and reunited with their families on March 2nd.
LRA combatants attacked and wounded a man near his farm in Agoumar, CAR.

A 19-year-old woman arrived in Agoumar, CAR after escaping LRA captivity on March 14th. She reported that she had escaped after she went to fetch water, and walked for 6 days until she reached Agoumar, CAR. She had been in LRA captivity since 2010.
Shortly after LRA forces abducted 38 people from Agoumar, CAR, 4 of the abductees escaped and 25 were released. Those who remain in captivity are 5 boys, 3 girls, and an 18-year-old woman.
After LRA forces abducted 38 civilians from Agoumar, CAR, on November 23rd, 2012, they raped 2 of the abducted women.
LRA forces attacked Agoumar, CAR, and abducted 38 people. Some of the abducted were forced to carry goods for the group. 1 man, who refused to be abducted, was beaten to death with a gun.
An LRA combatant and a "wife" of an LRA member still in the bush, defected at Agoumar, CAR, when they came across a local pastor. The "wife" was originally abducted from Faradje, DRC.
LRA members injured 5 civilians and killed 2 others east of Rafai, CAR on May 7th, 2010.

Roughly 17 suspected LRA forces, comprised of 10 men and 7 women, attacked the community of Kpete, CAR which is along the road 7 km west of Rafai, CAR. They killed 1 elderly man, abducted a young girl and 3 boys, and looted multiple households.
On the evening of February 7th, 2013, LRA forces released 3 individuals who had been abducted earlier in the day to carry looted goods.

A large group of armed LRA, comprised of men, women, and children, attacked people at their farms 15 km SW of Zemio, CAR, between the road near Tabane and the Mbomou river. They killed 3 men, looted various goods, and abducted 3 people to carry the goods.
LRA forces killed 1 person along the Gwane-Mboki road in the DRC. This attack took place in January 2010.
A 7-year-old girl and 3 boys, who were abducted 4 days earlier by suspected LRA forces, were able to escape and fled back to near Kpete, CAR.
LRA forces released 2 men and 1 woman, all abducted earlier in the day along the Rafai-Bangassou Road in CAR.
LRA forces abducted 1 woman as she worked in her field near Lougba, CAR.
Of the initial 29 people abducted from Rafai, CAR by the LRA, 4 were released the same day, including the 2 foreign missionaries who had been abducted.

Roughly 20 LRA attacked the town of Rafai, CAR. 29 people were abducted (including two foreign missionaries),  2 civilians were killed, 1 civilian was injured, 3 LRA were killed, and food, clothes, and satellite phones were looted during the attack.
LRA forces killed 1 person in the forest near Rafai, CAR, in late February 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 person in the forest near Rafai, CAR, in early March 2010.
LRA forces abducted 27 people along the road to Rafai, CAR, between May 4th and 6th, 2010.

LRA members attacked a truck at Ngoli, CAR, which is near Rafai, CAR. 1 civilian was killed and 1 other injured. The exact location of Ngoli is unknown, so this incident is being mapped at Rafai pending further information.
LRA forces killed 2 people and displaced many more when they attacked a truck near Rafai, CAR. The given date is an estimate.
LRA forces killed 2 people in late May of 2010 in the forest near Rafai, CAR.
LRA forces abducted 16 civilians from June 12th-13th in attacks on farms outside of Rafai, CAR.
Of the 8 people abducted by the LRA from  Rafai, CAR, 1 person escaped or was released the same day.
On June 13th, 2010, LRA members abducts 8 civilians from Rafai, CAR.
LRA forces killed 2 civilians in a forest near Rafai, CAR, on June 15th, 2010.
A young man was able to escape LRA captivity near the town of Rafai, CAR, on August 2nd, 2010.
Security forces and LRA forces clashed near Rafai, CAR. During the clash, an 11-year-old boy escaped from the LRA. Exact location details are not clear.
LRA forces released 2 men they had recently abducted after they were attacked by the local population near Rafai, CAR.
4 suspected LRA members abducted 2 men returning from hunting in Rafai, CAR. 1 LRA member was killed during the attack. The combatants also looted a number of households.
On March 21st, 2013, a young girl was abducted by LRA forces in Rafai, CAR.

A girl reportedly escaped from LRA forces and arrived in the community of Rafai, CAR. She was abducted from Yangoumangou in Bria, CAR. After escaping from LRA forces she was rescued by fishermen who brought her to Rafai.
LRA forces shot at a pick up truck traveling through Poumboula, CAR. There were 4 passengers in the vehicle, including a city official, but no one was harmed during the attack.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in a forest near Rafai, CAR, on May 8th, 2010.
Suspected LRA forces traveling with cattle and rifles were sighted in Bangalu, DRC near the border with CAR . They were coming from Zangi, DRC where they had spent the previous night.
On March 19th, 2008 LRA forces clashed with security forces in Bangalu, DRC, leading to the destruction of offices and causing the population to flee.

As reported on March 24th, 2008, LRA forces increased their activity in Bangalu, DRC, looting offices and terrorizing the local population. These LRA forces are reportedly fleeing from security forces in Ezo, Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces ambushed a group of Mbororo near Bangalu, DRC. The Mbororo were traveling to Niangara, DRC, from the Central African Republic. The assailants abducted 2 people and 10 cows.
15 suspected and armed LRA men attacked Bangalu, DRC, and looted rice seeds, beans and corn. The LRA forces have reportedly been living in an abandoned Catholic chapel for 3 weeks.
6 suspected LRA who had abducted a hunter at 3:00 AM at Bangalu, DRC, was freed later in the morning with the following message: "We will come to Bangalu market on Saturday".
2 hunters were ambushed by 6 suspected LRA forces at Bangalu, DRC. They said they were looking for food. One of the hunters was killed and the other was abducted.

The 5 Congolese men abducted 4 days earlier east of Zangabai, DRC, were released between the Mbomou and Bangalu rivers, DRC. They  reportedly sighted an LRA camp with 41 people, the majority reported to be male combatants.
Near Zemio, CAR, and the DRC border, LRA forces abducted 2 women, burned a man and looted unspecified goods.
LRA forces attacked Kpiamou, CAR, killing 7 people and wounding 4 more.
LRA forces ambushed a convoy and the security forces escorting the convoy at Kpiamou, CAR.
6 LRA members, consisting of 3 Ugandan men, 2 Congolese women, and a 13-year-old Central African girl, defected at Kpiamou, CAR. All 6 are being repatriated to their respective home countries.
The LRA forces who had  abducted 13 people,  released 9 civilians the same day at Daou, CAR, which is near Zemio.
Between February 28th and March 1st, 2009, seven LRA forces dressed as local security forces attacked Andari, Sudan. They killed 5 civilians and abducted a 17-year-old girl.
After an LRA group attacked the town Baruka, they attacked regional security forces at Andari, South Sudan on July 18th, 2009. The security forces were able to fend off the LRA.
8 civilians, including 1 woman, who had been abducted by LRA forces arrived in Zemio, CAR. It is unclear whether they were all abducted at the same time.
2 unarmed LRA were spotted in Zemio, CAR, which caused the local population to panic.
LRA forces reportedly attacked Zemio and Mboki, CAR, on March 20th- 21st, 2010. 1 civilian was killed, 2 were wounded, and 6 others were abducted.
5 days after their initial abduction by the LRA, 3 children were recovered by security forces near Zemio, CAR. 1 adult remains in LRA captivity from the original 13 abducted.
There were unconfirmed reports of the LRA being spotted around Zemio, CAR on June 29th, 2011.
In the town of Oulima, CAR, which is near Zemio, LRA forces released 1 of the 2 people they had recently abducted.
In the town of Oulima, CAR, which is near Zemio, LRA forces abducted 2 people.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Daou, CAR, which is near Zemio and burned multiple houses and barns. An unspecified number of people were also abducted and injured during the attack.
A day after suspected LRA forces abducted people from Daou, CAR, which is near Zemio, they released at least 1 person who returned home and was taken to the hospital.
2 men, who were abducted by LRA forces, escaped and arrived in Zemio, CAR, on February 18th, 2013. The LRA group they were with consisted of 4 armed men, 3 armed boys, women, and other children.
Approximately 2 weeks after they were abducted by LRA forces and taken to the Democratic Republic of Congo, 2 hunters managed to escape and return to Zemio, CAR.

5 days after their abduction by at least 17 LRA forces, 7 people were released after being used as porters. The 7 returned to Zemio, CAR, with a message from the LRA: "Tell the military, if they want to follow us, we are waiting."

This is part of the Christmas Massacres. 20 LRA forces attacked Garia, southern Sudan. Local civilians shot one LRA dead, and LRA forces killed 3 civilians, burned a tractor and abducted another 7 civilians.
Security forces ambushed a group of 30 LRA  west of Ezo, S. Sudan. 6 LRA were killed in the attack.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Litoua, CAR near Zemio. The result of this attack is unknown.
Suspected LRA abducted 3 men near Zemio, CAR.

Between January 16th and 17th, 2013,  LRA forces conducted a series of attack over a large area near the border between DRC and CAR. These attacks resulted in looting, the abduction of 2 women, and 1 man burned alive.
1 person was killed and 1 injured by LRA forces in the village of Napier outside Ezo, South Sudan.
LRA attacked a village near Ezo, S. Sudan. They abducted 12 children and killed 3 others.
On March 3rd, 2008 LRA forces clashed with local security forces in Ezo, South Sudan. It was reported that 35 LRA elements died in this encounter.
On March 17th, 2008 LRA forces attacked Ezo, Sudan and reportedly abducted 70 civilians.
After the LRA attacked a village near Ezo, S. Sudan and abducted 12 children, 10 of the 12 were released.
The LRA attacked and looted civilians outside of Ezo, S. Sudan on July 11th, 2009.  3 people were injured and 1 was abducted. Security forces and local militia forces were able to respond.

After an LRA attack on a World Food Programme base outside of Ezo, South Sudan, the community itself was attacked by the LRA. Homes were looted for goods that had been distributed by NGOs and 8 girls were abducted.

On December 15th, 2009, a teenage boy that was abducted from Kaka, DRC in May, 2009 escaped from the LRA when he and the other child soldiers present turned on their LRA captors, killing them and then fleeing.
An LRA man, who had been in the LRA for 14 years, defected near Ezo, S. Sudan.
1 woman was killed and 3 other civilians abducted by 4-5 LRA members on the outskirts of Ezo, South Sudan.
3 civilians escaped from LRA captivity after having been abducted from Ezo, South Sudan, the previous day.
LRA forces were reportedly sighted near Ezo, South Sudan.
Just outside of Ezo, S. Sudan, LRA combatants killed 3 people and abducted 2.
LRA forces were spotted outside of Ezo, South Sudan.
Security forces captured at least 4 LRA forces, including LRA commander Okello "Mission" on March 31st, 2010 from Ezo, S Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces killed 1 civilian and injured 1 civilian at Ezo, S. Sudan.

A group of LRA members looted food near a market in Yangiri Payam, Ezo County, South Sudan.  Security forces pursued the attackers, who fled north. The plotted location for this incident is an estimate.
3 groups of LRA forces were sighted travelling towards Ezo, SS.
The teenage boy who was abducted on November 10th from Banda, DRC, escaped near Ezo, S. Sudan.

4 Congolese girls were reportedly released by the LRA on November 1st 2011 near Ezo, S. Sudan. They were then cared for by a civil society organization in Yambio, S. Sudan and then repatriated to Dungu, DRC in late January 2012.
4 Congolese boys escaped from LRA captivity and reached Ezo, South Sudan on February 1st.
1 Congolese boy escaped from suspected LRA forces near Ezo, South Sudan. He arrived in Ezo on February 2nd.
1 Congolese boy escaped from suspected LRA forces. He arrived in Ezo, South Sudan on February 3rd.

2 girls, aged 13 and 17 originating from Ngilma, DRC and Faradje, DRC respectively, escaped from LRA captivity 5 months ago. After they escaped, they wandered through the forest until security forces found them near Ezo, South Sudan on February 9th 2012.
After LRA forces attacked, Ezo, South Sudan, they released 2 people that they had just abducted. The third person, however, was taken into the forest and killed.

LRA forces attacked Ezo, South Sudan, and abducted at least 3 people. The assailants also set fire to multiple houses and looted various unspecified goods from the town. 1 man of unknown age was seriously injured and was taken to a hospital.
On roughly February 16th, an LRA force consisting of 4 armed men, 3 armed boys, women, and other children were along the Rumu river in the DRC.
3 of the original 4 people who the LRA had abducted from Guerekindo, CAR, escaped that same day.
LRA forces attacked the town of Guerekindo, CAR, killing 1 person and abducting 4 others.
LRA forces attacked Guerekindo, CAR, killing 2 people and abducting 9 others.
LRA forces attacked Guerekindo, CAR, abducting 14 people and stealing goods.

LRA forces abducted at least 10 civilians in Guerekindo, CAR. 1 was a father and 5 were his young children. The mother of the family watched the attackers tie her family into a human chain and load up looted goods from her home before leaving.
LRA combatants released 4 people in Guerekindo, CAR.
LRA combatants attacked Guerekindo, CAR, abducting 4 people and killing 1 other. The LRA also set fire to a number of houses.
LRA forces ambushed security forces at Guerekindo, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Guerekindo, CAR, and killed 1 civilian.
LRA forces killed 10 civilians 7 km outside of Guerekindo, CAR.
LRA forces attacked the town of Guerekindo, CAR. The result of this attack is unknown.

A large number of LRA forces attacked Guerekindo, CAR, abducting at least 6 people. 1 LRA was killed and an unknown additional number of LRA were wounded. Reportedly over 100 LRA were involved in this attack, but that number remains unverified.
LRA forces abducted 13 people, including 3 children from near Zemio, CAR on June 15th, 2011.
LRA forces looted items in Tabane, CAR, which is close to Zemio.

19 LRA forces including Lt. Col. Okello Okuti and 8 other men, 4 women, and 6 children surrendered peacefully to a fisherman along a river near Tabane, CAR. The fisherman notified the IC EWN who notified security forces who escorted the group to Obo.

9 armed and suspected LRA men attacked Bilikwa, DRC, and looted various goods from at least 5 households. They also abducted 3 men and 1 woman to be used as porters to carry the looted goods. Security forces pursued the assailants the next day.

9 armed and suspected LRA men who had recently attacked Bilikwa, DRC, and abducted 3 men and a woman, released the woman and 2 of the men. 1 man remains in captivity. The released individuals claimed a white helicopter carried off the looted goods.
3 persons were abducted during an attack by LRA forces on December 15th, 2009 in Kpanangbana, DRC.
LRA forces ambushed security forces in Kpanangbana, DRC.
LRA combatants reportedly abducted 18 civilians from Kpanangbana, DRC.

Suspected LRA forces ambushed the chief and only medical Dr. in the region and his driver near Dembia, CAR on June 6th, 2011. Both men were killed. The entire supply of polio vaccines for the region were in the burned car. 3 others in the vehicle escaped.
LRA forces released 2 women and 1 man after abducting them earlier in the day from Kpagbu, CAR.
LRA forces abducted 2 women and 1 man from Kpagbu, CAR.

7 LRA members attacked a security force camp at a WFP base, while 7 others attacked an official's office and looted goods. The attacks occurred outside of Ezo, S Sudan. 1 civilian was killed by the LRA and 1 LRA was killed by security forces.
LRA forces clashed with security forces on the DRC/CAR border on February 20th, 2009. The outcome of this incident is unknown.

Suspected LRA forces attacked a camp of hunters 55km west of Zemio in CAR. They fired warning shots and tied up the people in the camp. One camp guard was abducted and various good looted.  Security forces went to investigate after the attack.

At dawn, between 20-30 LRA forces attacked the communities & connecting road of Zobembari & Balifondo, CAR.  They reportedly abducted 49 civilians, including 14 children. The assailants also beat about 15 men, looted goods, and killed 2 abducted persons.
LRA members abducted 5 civilians south of Tamboura, CAR on May 2nd, 2011. They were released later that day, see related incident.
The 6 people who had just been abducted by the LRA were released near Bandangbaro, CAR on April 28th, 2010.
Around 40 LRA  forces were seen abducting 6 people near Bandangbaro, CAR. They also looted the village.
LRA forces killed 5 civilians and abducted 4 others in an attack on Gouyanga, CAR, over both April 17th and 18th.
Civilians in Gbangomboro, CAR, which is near Dembia, were warned that the LRA were coming and fled prior to their arrival.
LRA combatants abducted 1 person from Demia, CAR on  February 19th, 2010.
LRA combatants abducted 2 civilians from Dembia, CAR, on February 20th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and abducted 1 civilian in an attack on Dembia, CAR, on March 17th, 2010.
2 civilians were shot in the leg when LRA forces attacked Dembia, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Dembia, DRC killing 1 civilian and injuring 1 civilian on March 27th, 2010. 5 LRA members were killed and 1 LRA member was captured during the attack.
4 groups of LRA were seen crossing a road near Dembia, DRC.
Security forces attacked LRA forces near Dembia, CAR. 7 LRA forces were killed in the attack.
The 3 people abducted by LRA forces a few hours earlier were able to escape near Dembia, CAR.
5 people, including 2 brothers, were attacked by LRA forces near Dembia, CAR. The 2 brothers were killed and the 3 others were abducted and used as porters.

During a clash between members of the LRA and security forces, a 20-year-old woman escaped, near Dembia, CAR. She had originally been abducted by Dominic Ongwen's group near Rafai, CAR. She cited hearing helicopter loudspeaker messages and seeing fliers.
An 18-year-old Congolese woman and a 19-year-old Ugandan man escaped from the LRA and fled to Dembia, CAR. They defected because they heard helicopter loudspeaker messages.
A large group of suspected LRA forces, consisting of men, women, and children, were seen near Dembia, CAR, traveling south toward the Democratic Republic of Congo.

4 hunters found a suspected LRA camp near Dembia, CAR. On their way back they clashed with suspected LRA forces but they managed to escape and alert security forces. By the time the security forces arrived at the camp, the assailants had left.
LRA members attacked Rafa, South Sudan. They looted goods from the civilian population. The incident occurred on June 25th, 2009.

LRA forces captured 2 men who were returning from a hunt 10 km north of Zemio, CAR. The assailant then looted the men's guns and meat, before marching south into the DRC. Once there, the LRA proceeded to steal cattle from Mbororo herders they came across.
On March 7th, 2013, suspected LRA forces fired shots at and hit an NGO vehicle 31 km away from Zemio, CAR, as it was on its way to Rafai, CAR. No injuries were recorded.
LRA forces attacked a truck along the road near Guerekindo, CAR. 5 people were killed, 4 wounded, the truck burned, and the goods stolen.
LRA members attacked and looted 2 men as they were traveling about 7 km east of Dembia, CAR.
LRA forces ambushed a truck at Miskine, CAR. 1 person was killed, 2 people were injured, and 1 person was abducted.

A man who had been abducted by LRA combatants was killed in captivity on May 6th because he fell and was unable to get up. The article cites that the man was killed when an LRA combatant crushed his skull with a club. This occurred near Miskine, CAR.
LRA forces killed 2 people in Miskine, CAR.
A group of LRA soldiers attacked a truck transporting goods at Miakioro, South Sudan on July 26th, 2009. The LRA forces looted the truck and then burned it.
On January 13th, 2009, security forces, local civilians and park rangers surrounded a group of LRA forces between Kotobi and Garia, southern Sudan. The result of this confrontation is unknown.

Of the 49 people abducted on Sept. 1st from the Zobembari and Balifondo, CAR areas, all 49 began escaping LRA captivity as early as Sept. 3rd, and by Sept. 14th every abductee had been released or escaped. The locations of the escapes are unknown.

A hunter saw 4 suspected LRA elements approximately 15 km south of Mboki, CAR, which is near the border with the DRC. The group comprised of 1 woman and 3 men, all armed. The man returned to his community and informed them of the situation.
5 LRA combatants were spotted on the road near Tamboura, CAR.
The mayor of Haut Mbomou encountered 2 LRA elements in Tambourah, CAR. This caused the residents of the nearby town of Zemio to flee and hide in the bush.
The 5 civilians abducted near Tamboura, CAR on May 2nd, 2011 were released the same day.

LRA members abducted 15 civilians near Tamboura, CAR, on May 7th, 2011. A local man shot at the LRA forces who then returned fire and hit the man's wife. 14 of the 15 abducted civilians were released later that night.
On May 8th, 2011, LRA forces released the 14 of the15 abducted civilians they had taken from Tamboura, CAR the day before .

5 LRA forces killed 2 male hunters near Bangasou, CAR, which is a small community northeast of Zemio, CAR. A third hunter escaped unharmed and alerted the community residents. Local security and police forces then went to investigate.
Shortly after LRA forces abducted 3 people from their gardens in Bangassou-Nzakara, CAR, they were released.

LRA forces, comprised of men, women, and children, attacked people in their gardens at Bangassou-Nzakara, CAR. 6 members of the group seemed to lead the group. 3 people were abducted, but then quickly released.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Bougoua, CAR.
LRA forces reportedly attacked Ligoua, CAR, sometime during the month of January 2009.
LRA forces destroyed property when they attacked Ligoua, CAR. 1 person was killed and another injured during the attack.
LRA combatants abducted 13 civilians in Ligoua, CAR, on July 21st, 2009, including 1 woman with her 2 young sons.

On approximately July 24th, 2009, suspected LRA forces attacked a group of civilians going to their fields in Ligoua, CAR. 2 civilians were killed immediately, 3 more were abducted. The bodies of the 3 abducted were later found 30 km away.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians from Ligoua, CAR, on August 9th, 2009. They were killed 10 days later in captivity.
LRA combatants abducted 1 civilian in Ligoua, CAR.
LRA combatants killed 3 civilians in an attack on Ligoua, CAR.
LRA forces killed 2 civilians at Ligoua, CAR, on September 15th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and injured 3 others in an attack on Ligoua, CAR that lasted from January 22nd to the 23rd.
Suspected LRA members attacked 2 people east of Obo, CAR.  The result of the attack is unknown.
LRA forces attacked Nangongo, CAR. It is unknown how many people were affected by this attack.
LRA forces attacked Ngouber, CAR, looting the town and abducting 3 people.

LRA forces arrested 3 cyclists. Shortly after, a security forces' vehicle arrived on the road. The assailants exchanged fire with the security forces, injuring the driver. The LRA forces escaped after a second security forces vehicle appeared.

An ambulance going from Obo to Mboki, CAR, was attacked by LRA forces. The assailants and the 2 armed security forces who were on board exchanged fire. The vehicle was later found completely burned. The 5 passengers are all back in Obo, CAR.
During the month of July in 2009, suspected LRA forces attacked Hele, CAR, killing 1 man and abducting his wife and 1 other man.
LRA members killed 1 civilian and abducted another in an attack on Hele, CAR.
LRA members abducted 1 civilian on a road near Hele, CAR.

On September 30, 2009, suspected LRA forces carried out attacks on  Ngouli and Hele, CAR. A total 6 civilians were killed and 3 civilians were abducted, including the former mayor of Obo. The victim numbers have been divided between the reports.
1 man was reportedly abducted by LRA forces between Dembia, CAR, and Karmadar, CAR, as he returned home from his field.
As reported on March 25th, 2008, a large group of LRA forces set up camp between Bassigbiri, CAR, and the Mbomou River.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and injured 1 civilian at Kadjemah, CAR on September 27th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in an attack on Kadjemah, CAR, on October 4th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 1 person and abducted 6 others in an attack on Kadjemah, CAR, on December 23, 2010.
As reported on May 10th, about 50 LRA forces with captives were seen near Kadjemah, CAR crossing the Mbomou river into the Congo.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian on September 9th, 2009 at Gesimbala, CAR.

On approximately May 14, along the road from Mboki to Bambouti, CAR, a security force vehicle carrying soldiers and traders from South Sudan was fired upon by suspected LRA. There was an unknown number of injuries, but no deaths.

2 Central African men going from Obo to Mboki, CAR, on the same motorcycle were ambushed by 5 armed LRA forces. The 5 assailants, dressed in tattered military uniforms, abducted the 2 men and looted everything they were carrying on the motorcycle.

The 2 central African men abducted by 5 armed LRA forces near Mboki, CAR, the day prior were released this morning with the following message: "Let the vehicles going on this section of the road not carry military forces, otherwise they will be burned."
LRA forces killed 7 civilians 20 km east of Obo, CAR on the road to Mboki, CAR on September 9th, 2009.
Suspected LRA forces attacked at least 3 civilians along the road southeast of Obo, CAR. It is unclear whether or not they were harmed or if there were more people with them when they were attacked.
On August 7th, 2009, LRA forces killed 4 Congolese refugees in Mbokou, CAR. The 4 victims were displaced from Doruma, DRC.
2 suspected LRA members, armed with automatic rifles, were spotted by hunters 5 km northwest of Kadjemah, CAR. The date of this sighting is an estimate.
An LRA sergeant was taken into custody by security forces near Kamango, CAR.

An unknown number of LRA forces looted a community 13 km east of Mboki, CAR. The assailants abducted 7 civilians to carry the loot. These civilians reportedly returned the next morning, after having spent the night shelling peanuts.

Security forces attacked a group of LRA near Karmadar, CAR, in the Vovodo region. 1 LRA member was killed and 7 people were rescued from captivity. The nationalities of the 7 rescued were Ugandan, South Sudanese, and Central African women and children.
2 Ugandan male LRA combatants peacefully surrendered to security forces along the road just outside of Mboki, CAR. They cited the capture of Caesar Achellam as their reason for turning themselves in.

LRA forces attacked 5 men who were hunting 10 km east of Mboki, CAR. 2 men were shot. 1 man, a 30-year-old, died instantly and the other was wounded and abducted by the rebel group. The hunting group's game was also stolen by the assailants.
On January 20th, 2009, LRA forces attacked Luzo which is near Liaba, southern Sudan. The outcome of this attack is unknown.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Ngilingili, CAR, on March 4th, 2008, and abducted civilians. It is unclear how many civilians were abducted.
Sometime during the month of June 2009, LRA forces reportedly attacked Ngilingili, CAR, killing an unknown number of civilians. This attack led to a displacement of the population to Obo, CAR.
On approximately July 24th, 2009, suspected LRA forces attacked Ngilingili, CAR. 1 woman and 1 child were killed, and another civilian was wounded at the leg, leading to an amputation.
LRA forces attacked and burned homes in Ngilingili, CAR, on August 5th, 2009. Several villagers were killed.
On August 28th, 2009, LRA forces attacked Ngilingili, CAR. No one was killed in the attack and the population fled to Obo, CAR.
Suspected LRA forces killed 1 civilian in an attack on a farm at Ngilingili, CAR, on September 1st, 2009.

On September 30, 2009, suspected LRA forces carried out attacks on Ngilingili and Hele, CAR. A total of 6 civilians were killed and 3 civilians were abducted, including the former mayor of Obo. The victim numbers have been divided between the reports.

The mother who was abducted in Ngilingili, CAR, in October 2009, escaped the following day. She found her son who had also been abducted in that attack. He was shot in the leg for refusing to be a porter, leading to the loss of half his leg.

40 to 50 LRA forces attacked Ngilingili, CAR. 3 civilians, including 1 boy and his mother, were abducted, and 1 woman and 1 man were killed.  Another boy was severely beaten. The assailants looted clothes and food.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in an attack on Ngilingili, CAR.
Sometime during the month of December 2009, suspected LRA forces killed 1 woman during an attack on Ngilingili, CAR.
In January 2010, LRA forces killed 6 civilians in Ngouli, CAR. The precise date of this attack is unknown.
While in the captivity of the LRA, the girl who had been abducted from Ngilingili, CAR, was tortured.
On February 9th, 2011, LRA forces attacked Ngilingili, CAR, and abducted 2 men and 1 girl. They also stabbed 2 women during the attack, both of whom survived.
LRA forces clashed with security forces near Ngilingili, CAR. 1 civilian was injured during the clash.

As reported on November 30th, the inhabitants of Ngilingili, CAR, fled to the nearby town of Obo to seek safety from LRA attacks. During the journey, the group was reportedly fired upon by a dozen LRA members, but no one was injured.
Suspected LRA members killed a hunter south of Mboki, CAR.
7-9 LRA fighters killed 1 villager near Source Yubu, South Sudan. Security forces pursued the attackers.
7-9 LRA fighters injured 3 villagers during an attack near Source Yubu, South Sudan. Security forces pursued the attackers.

A 51-year-old man encountered 4 LRA forces along the river Kibugo, CAR.  The LRA forces explained in Acholi and with gestures that they wanted his help to defect. The man initially agreed, but then became afraid and fled to alert local authorities.

A man traveling with companions was abducted by LRA forces near Ngoumanbere, CAR on Sept. 4th, 2012. While in captivity he was beaten and forced to carry looted goods. He also witnessed LRA members raping women.
As reported on March 13th, 2008, LRA forces looted Mboki, CAR before crossing the Mbomou river into DRC.
On  May 25th, 2009, LRA forces attacked Mboki, CAR, for the first time. Following this event the local population organized auto-defense groups.
Fulani tradesman killed 3 LRA fighters in Mboki, CAR, in the month of July 2009.

The LRA members who had abducted earlier in the day began to loot a market in Mboki, CAR. 6  civilians were killed, including a young boy, and 5 abductees from earlier escaped. 3 LRA members died from the retaliation and 3 later died in the bush.

LRA members abducted 7 civilians from Mboki, CAR, on July 24th, 2009. Later in the day several LRA were killed and all but 2 of the abductees were able to escape. The 2 that were not able to escape were killed.
Sometime in August 2009, a woman escaped LRA forces near Mboki, CAR. She had been abducted 4 months earlier in Banda area, DRC.
On August 19th, 2009, LRA forces killed the 3 civilians they had abducted 10 days earlier near Mboki, CAR on August 10th, 2009.

3 days after her abduction from an NGO truck, a girl managed to escape at night from LRA forces. She encountered a group of Mbororos with whom she stayed 3 days and then walked 4 days before reaching Mboki, CAR.
About 17 days after her abduction in Djemah, CAR, a girl escaped from the LRA and arrived in Mboki, CAR.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians from Mboki, CAR, during the month of February in 2010.
Early in the morning of March 20th, 2010, LRA forces attacked Mboki, CAR, abducting 6 civilians, killing 1, and injuring 2 Mbororos.

Of the 6 civilians abducted in Mboki, CAR, on March 20th, 2010, a woman and her 3-month-old baby as well as the daughter of the man who was killed returned. The exact date and place of their return is unknown.
Fulani tradesman thwarted an LRA attack in Mboki, CAR, on March 21, 2010.
LRA forces attempted to attack Mboki, CAR on March 21st, 2010 but were repulsed by Fulani tradesmen.

On April 9th, 2010, 9  LRA forces defected in Mboki, CAR, with the help of a local civilian defense group. 8 LRA were Ugandan and the remaining 1 LRA was recognized as a Central African youth who was abducted on March 20, 2010.
LRA forces abducted 1 farmer near Mboki, CAR.

Caesar Achellam's bodyguard, an LRA lieutenant, defected near Mboki, CAR along with 5 other LRA officers. Achellam's bodyguard reportedly left the LRA because of threats on his life from fellow members who accused him of allowing Achellam to be captured.
An LRA officer peacefully surrendered to the local police force in Mboki, CAR, citing hunger and defection messages as his reasons for leaving.
5 people, 2 men and 3 girls, defected from the LRA and surrendered in Mboki, CAR. They reported having seen defection fliers while in the bush.

An LRA 1st Lieutenant of Ugandan nationality defected on Christmas Day at Mboki, CAR. He cited seeing defection fliers and hearing helicopter loudspeaker messages during his time with the LRA. He was in the LRA for 16 years.
Suspected LRA forces attacked 2 hunters near a river in the vicinity of Mboki, CAR. 1 hunter was killed and 1 managed to escape and inform community members of the attack.

8 LRA soldiers attacked Mboki, CAR, and attempted to abduct 25 people, but were prevented when security forces and local defense forces opened fire. The assailants were able to loot several households.
3 older Central African men, who were abducted by LRA forces 3 days earlier during an attack at a field northwest of Mboki, CAR, returned to Mboki.

A man was abducted while fishing on the river Kerre, north of Mboki, CAR. He was abducted by the same LRA group that abducted 4 civilians from Maboussou, CAR, on February 2nd, 2014, and that attacked Kpabou on January 29th, 2014.

Security forces clashed with a LRA group on February 4th, 2014. A man previously abducted managed to escape and was brought back to Obo, CAR. There are reportedly 11 men and 2 women  in this LRA group, all armed with AK47s.
A 14-year-old boy who had been abducted between Djemah and Derbissaka, CAR, on January 6th, was able to escape from LRA captivity.
The 31-year-old man abducted by 5 LRA forces near Mboki, CAR, was released 3 hours after his abduction. Before releasing him, the LRA forces left a message expressing their  desire to defect.
LRA forces attacked twice southeast of the border town of Source Yubu, S. Sudan. During the attacks, 1 person was killed, 3 injured and 2,100 were displaced as they fled for safety.

Along the main road in Banzigbire, CAR, the LRA killed 5 people and looted goods from the town. This caused many people to flee east toward Source Yubu, South Sudan. When the report was taken two years later, some victims of the attack remained displaced.

A refugee originally from Banzigbire, CAR tried to return home from Source Yubu, South Sudan. He was killed by suspected LRA forces and his body was later recovered by other refugees escorted by security forces, which they found had been stripped naked.
Suspected LRA forces released 9 of the 10 people they had abducted near Guyanga, CAR. The remaining person was killed.
Armed suspected LRA forces abducted 10 people near Guyanga, CAR.
A group of 10 LRA men ambushed security forces in a convoy in the bush 35 km northeast of Zemio, CAR near Kitesa, CAR. Some LRA forces were reported as killed, but the number is unknown.
LRA forces killed 3 civilians north of Mboki, CAR, on February 23rd, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 Chadian trader while looting the Reserve de Faune Mbomou Orientale in CAR near the DRC border. This location is an estimate.

7 LRA members attacked an NGO truck on September 20th, 2009, on the Obo-Mboki road in CAR. the driver was killed and 2 severely injured. 5 others were abducted, including 2 boys. 2 others were later killed and 1 released. The combatants also stole goods.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian as they looted a truck on  the main road west of Mboki, CAR on March 14th, 2011. The LRA forces fled when security forces arrived and opened fire.

In response to security forces capturing 4 LRA along to Zemio-Mboki road, suspected LRA forces attacked the community of Ngadia, CAR. 5 people were abducted and a large amount of food was stolen. The location of this attack is an estimate.
Security forces on patrol along the Zemio-Mboki road captured 4 LRA near the town of Kerre, CAR.

A 31-year-old man was abducted by 5 LRA forces in a  field 2 km from Mboki, CAR. The assailants asked the man questions about the location and movement of former LRA returnees. They also asked questions about Obo and Kpabu, but the man refused to answer.
LRA forces attacked the community of Kpabou, CAR, and abducted 9 people on December 30th, 2012.

About 20 LRA forces looted almost half of the households in the community of Kpabou, CAR. Food and non-food items were looted and a motorcycle was destroyed. The assailants abducted 7 civilians to carry their loot. They were all let go the next day.
At least 7 LRA members attacked a NGO vehicle east of Zemio, CAR. 1 civilian was killed.
3 LRA forces attacked a group of people in a field NW of Mboki, CAR. They abducted 3 men and raped a young woman, as well as looted various goods. The young woman was not abducted.
LRA forces abducted 5 civilian in Bule, CAR on February 17th, 2010. 1 civilian was released shortly after the incident.
1 of the 5 civilians abducted by LRA forces on Feb. 17th, 2010 near Bule, CAR was released on Feb. 18th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and abducted 1 other person at Bule, CAR, on April 29th, 2010.
LRA forces stole goods from two Mbororo in the town of Babougou, just east of Mboki, CAR. The exact location of Babougou is unknown.
LRA forces killed one person just outside Bambouti, CAR.
LRA forces attacked the town of Bambouti, CAR, killing 15 people and abducting 65.
LRA combatants killed 1 civilian and abducted 5 others in an attack on Bambouti, CAR, on September 28th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian on the road to Bambouti, CAR, on December 25th, 2009. The exact location of this incident is unknown.
Ugandan security forces captured a top LRA commander, Ceasar Achellam, along the Mbomou River in CAR. He was accompanied by his Ugandan wife, their young child and a Central African teenage girl.
LRA forces attacked Bassigbiri in CAR. Approximately 60 civilians were abducted and forced to march south into the DRC, specifically Garamba National Park.
Of the 60 people abducted from Bassigbiri, CAR by the LRA, 6 were killed shortly after their abduction.
Near Bassigbiri, CAR, suspected LRA forces killed 5 Chadian traders traveling from Sudan. The bodies were found two weeks later, with the motorcycles.
LRA forces were seen in Bassigbiri, CAR, on June 19th, 2009.
LRA soldiers attacked Bassigbiri, CAR, and stole goods from the locals.
On March 7th, 2010, a very large group of heavily armed LRA forces was sighted by by local civilians. The LRA group was crossing into DRC through Bassigbiri, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Bassigbiri, CAR. There were reported injuries and abductions, but no specific numbers given.
LRA forces killed 1 man by Bassigbiri, CAR on June 5th, 2011. It was reported that the LRA were fleeing security forces when they arrived in Bassigbiri.
Ugandan LRA officer 2nd Lieutenant  Oloya, defected near Balia, CAR, which is near the South Sudan border.
1 person, abducted with 10 other civilians by LRA combatants in Bazi, South Sudan, escaped from captivity.
LRA forces attacked the village of Bazi, South Sudan, near the CAR border. An unknown number of people were killed and 11 people were abducted.
On July 21st, 2009, LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Agbosi, CAR.
LRA forces killed 3 civilians in Agbosi, CAR on September 27th, 2009.
A suspected LRA group attacked and looted Mbororo herders between Derbissaka and Barawa, north of Dembia, CAR.
In the night between March 13th and 14th, 2014, 5 LRA forces reportedly looted food from multiple households in a community northwest of Mboki, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Kitesa, CAR, killing 11 people, abducting 3 others, and looting and burning several shops. 5 LRA members were killed during the attack.
On January 30th, 2011, LRA forces attacked the village of Kitesa, CAR and abducted 8 people, 1 of whom was a mother.
The 8 people who were abducted by the LRA from Kitesa, CAR a week earlier were released on February 6th, 2011.
The 4 civilians abducted by 5 LRA forces north of Mboki, CAR, were released after having transported the looted food.
The same 5 LRA forces who abducted a man near Mboki, CAR, attacked a community further north early the next day. They temporarily abducted 4 civilians including 2 men, 1 woman and a 4-year-old girl.
A group of traders were attacked by LRA forces in Bassangui, on the road between Obo and Bambouti, CAR.  Their goods were stolen.
A large group of LRA fighters were spotted crossing the Chinko river in CAR, heading east. Some reports said as many as 200 LRA, but that number is  unverified.
2 children, that were abducted by suspected LRA forces on August 12th, 2009 at Yubo, South Sudan, were able to escape the same day.
2 children were abducted by suspected LRA forces on August 12th, 2009 at Yubo, S. Sudan.

After hearing defection messaging over helicopter speakers, 4 Ugandan LRA elements defected to security forces. The defectors are composed of  a 25-year-old man, a 24 and a 22-year-old woman and a 6-year-old boy. They had been in captivity for 12 years.
Of the 9 people recently abducted from Karmadar, CAR, by the LRA, 2 were able to escape that same day.
LRA forces attacked Karmadar, CAR, and abducted 9 civilians.
LRA forces attacked the 2 nearby towns of Karmadar and Dinda, CAR, and abducted at least 13 people on February 15th, 2010.
Of the 13 people recently abducted by the LRA from Karmadar and Dinda, CAR, 6 were able to escape the same day.
LRA forces abducted 16 civilians from Karmadar, CAR, on March 14th, 2010.
6 of the 13 civilians abducted earlier in the day in Karmadar, CAR, were able to escape from LRA forces.
LRA forces attacked Karmadar, CAR, abducting 13 civilians.
LRA forces attacked Karmadar, CAR, abducting an unknown number of people.
LRA forces attacked Karmadar, CAR, and abducted an unknown number of civilians.
On June 28th, 2010, LRA members beat the chief in Karmadar, CAR.
LRA fighters abducted a man along the Dembia/Djemah road in Karmadar, CAR.

A group of 10 LRA forces, consisting of men, women, and children, attacked Karmadar, CAR, and injured 2 civilians. The combatants then looted various goods from the community. The LRA forces also abducted 1 boy as they fled the area.
An LRA corporal was apprehended by security forces near Karmadar, CAR. He said that he heard helicopter loudspeaker messages and saw fliers during his time with the LRA.

LRA forces attacked the town of Source Yubu, southern Sudan. They clashed with security forces and killed one government official. They also looted and burned multiple homes and reportedly abducted 17 civilians, mostly women.
LRA forces attacked the town of Source Yubu in South Sudan. The result of this attack is unknown.
LRA forces attacked the community of Source Yubu, which borders CAR in S. Sudan. 1 man was killed, 2 were injured, and 2 young girls were abducted.
6 people were found mutilated and tortured to death by the LRA near Source Yubu, South Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces attacked near the village of Source Yubu, S. Sudan. 1 person was injured and another killed.
On July 14th, 2009, LRA forces looted and burned homes in Dindiri, CAR, which is very close to Obo, CAR.

Between June 5th and June 8th, local hunters reported the movement of approximately 20 LRA soldiers traveling toward Djemah, CAR, near Guirigui, which is along the Zemio-Obo axis. This location is an estimate.
Suspected LRA forces were reportedly sighted 5 km from Obo, CAR, creating panic in the local population.

A large group of LRA members attacked a local church, abducting 73 civilians on the night of March 5th into the morning of March 6th, 2008 at Obo, CAR. Many of the abducted are believed to be children. By the time of the report, 29 abductees had returned.
13 civilians who had been abducted 2 days earlier in Obo, CAR, returned from the LRA on March 7th, 2008. The exact location of return is unknown.
About two weeks after being abducted in Obo, CAR, 1 male escaped from LRA forces as he went to fetch water. Exact location and date of return are unknown. His brother and mother were also released.
In May 2009 LRA forces killed 10 civilians at Kouroukou, CAR which is near Obo.
Sometime in June 2009, one man arrived in Obo, CAR, after escaping from LRA forces. He had spent over a year in captivity.
About 6 days after her abduction in Ligoua, CAR, 1 woman escaped and arrived in near Obo, CAR, following a clash with security forces near the Mbomou river.  Her son also returned on an unknown date.
The increase in LRA attacks in the communities around Obo, CAR, has led to a massive displacement of the population into Obo.
On September 7th, 2009, suspected LRA forces killed 2 civilians 20 km (in an unknown direction) from Obo, CAR.
LRA members killed 2 civilians in an attack on the road near Obo, CAR.
LRA forces killed 1 man 10 km from Obo, CAR, on February 17th, 2010. The 2 men who were with him escaped and came back with security forces. The dead body was found 15 km away from the attack site.
1 former LRA member defected on March 16th, 2010, near Obo, CAR.
The 4 men and women reportedly abducted by the LRA in the area of Obo, CAR, were released sometime in the month of October 2010.
LRA forces reportedly abducted 4 men and women in the area of Obo, CAR, sometime in the month of October 2010. The victims were used to carry goods.
7 abducted children were able to escape LRA forces and flee to Obo, CAR.
LRA forces abducted an unknown number of people near Obo, CAR.
LRA forces abducted an unknown number of people near Obo, CAR.

An 18-year-old Congolese woman returned to Obo, CAR after being in LRA captivity for four years. After initially escaping in July 2011, she lived alone in the forest until her return on 11 December 2011.

As reported on October 6th, a woman came out of the bush at Obo, CAR. She had been abducted by the LRA from Nzako, CAR, 2 years earlier and was forced to be a wife of an LRA officer. She escaped from the LRA on September 27th.
A man, whose son was killed when he was abducted earlier in the week, escaped LRA captivity and returned to Obo, CAR. He planned to guide security forces in pursuit of his assailants.
A 15-year-old boy escaped from the LRA after a battle with security forces and arrived northeast of Obo, CAR. He cited that he saw defection fliers and heard messages from helicopter loudspeakers.
LRA forces abducted a man near a river in the bush near Obo, CAR.
Security forces rescued 2 Congolese boys, both 15-years-old, from LRA captivity near Obo, CAR.
LRA forces killed a 51-year-old man during an exchange of fire with security forces near Obo, CAR.
4 LRA fighters defected over the course of the day in Obo, CAR. 2 in the morning and 1 in the afternoon who led security forces to the fourth man. All 4 are Ugandan males.

1 boy and 1 young man out hunting near Obo, CAR, were abducted by a LRA group reportedly composed of 50 men, children and women. They were brought back to a camp and asked questions about security forces and the movement of civilians around them.

Sometime between January 27th and 29th, 2014, a large LRA group abducted a man near Obo, CAR, and asked him questions about  the location of the town. They then looted a community nearby and abducted a woman, while she attempted to run away.

2 men fishing at the river Boko near Obo, CAR, were ambushed by 3 LRA forces. The assailants were all men, 2 of which were armed and dressed in military uniforms.One of the fishermen fell from his pirogue and was eventually able to escape.

2 boys on a motorcycle got stuck at a water crossing, about 3 km out of Obo, CAR.  5 armed LRA men appeared, all wearing civilian and military clothes and speaking an unknown language. While the men were tying up one of the boys, the other escaped.

About 18 armed LRA forces looted food and non-food items from at least 9 households in Obo, CAR.  They then moved towards the center of town and injured a civilian with 3 bullets. A boy and a man who had been previously abducted escaped during the attack.

3 young men and 1 woman were released by the LRA group that looted Obo, CAR, on the previous day. 1 of the returnees had been in captivity for 4 days, 2 of them for 2 days and another for 1 day. The LRA group leader was reportedly named Pascal.
The 2 hunters managed to escape from LRA forces during the night of their abduction. One of them reached Obo, CAR, the next day, while the second hunter came back 2 days after his abduction.
Of the 5 people abducted from the NGO truck on Sept. 20th, 2009, near Mboki, CAR, 1 young boy was released and 1 man was killed in captivity the next day.

Of the 5 people abducted from the NGO truck in Mboki, CAR on Sept. 20th, 2009, 1 more person was killed in captivity. He was a young boy and tried to escape, but was caught and killed. This happened 2 days after his initial abduction.
As reported on July 9th, a group of LRA were spotted 70 km east of Obo, CAR near the Gur river.
3 suspected LRA members, 2 of whom were armed, were spotted by hunters east of the Kerre river in CAR. The location and date of this sighting are an estimate.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in the forest west of the Chinko River in CAR.
Over a 10 day period, LRA forces killed 4 people and abducted 19 others between the CAR towns of Zemio and Mboki.
On June 13th, 2011, outside Obo, CAR along the road to Djemah, suspected LRA forces abducted 15 people, including 3 children.
Shortly after the initial abduction near Obo, CAR, the LRA released 12 adults, but kept the 3 children in captivity.
2 weeks after their initial abduction, the LRA released the 3 children who had been abducted with 12 adults just outside of Obo, CAR. 1 of the children released was injured.
2 weeks after their initial abduction, the LRA forces released the 3 children who had been abducted with 12 adults just outside of Obo, CAR.
LRA forces abducted 4 men near Obo, CAR.
2 of the 4 men LRA forces abducted near Obo, CAR escaped shortly after their abduction.
Of the 4 men who were abducted by the LRA near Obo, CAR, the remaining 2 in LRA captivity were released 2 days later.
2 LRA combatants attacked the community of Biagora near Tambura, S. Sudan. They abducted 8 people and stole food. Security forces pursued the LRA after they left the village.
Suspected LRA abducted 3 people in an attack on Banima, CAR.
Suspected LRA abducted 2 civilians in Banima, CAR, on March 14th, 2012.
There were multiple LRA sightings between Gougbr and Obo in CAR.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in Gougbr, CAR, on July 3rd, 2009.
LRA combatants abducted 2 civilians in Gougbr, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Gougbr, CAR, killing 1 civilian and abducting at least 5 others.
LRA combatants killed 1 civilian in Gougbr, CAR.
Security forces bombed a known LRA camp near Gougbr, CAR on September 9th, 2009.
LRA forces killed 4 civilians in an attack on Gougbr, CAR, on March 16th, 2010.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian in an attack on Gougbr, CAR, on March 28th, 2010.
LRA forces were sighted and 3 abductees were freed near Gougbr, CAR on September 4th, 2010.
Security forces captured 7 LRA members at Gougbr, CAR on February 15th, 2011.

LRA forces abducted 2 women from a field before demanding a father and son give them food to eat. After they had eaten, the LRA forces killed the boy and abducted his father, as well. This incident occurred in Gougbere, CAR, which is 7 km from Obo, CAR.

A 33-year-old Ugandan man and LRA combatant peacefully surrendered in Gougbr, CAR. He came out of the bush after being found by a hunter, and was carrying a defection flier. He had been in captivity for 17 years.

4 suspected LRA forces attacked a community 48 km north of Rafai, CAR.They looted money and other items from the Chef de localit. The assailants were reportedly wearing "SS" badges which stand for "Scurit du Seigneur." They fled north after the attack.
LRA forces were sighted traveling towards Mboki from Banangui near the CAR/DRC border on December 12th, 2010.
Security forces launched an attack against 50-60 LRA killing 1 LRA member and capturing another in a raid on Dominic Ongwen's camp, near the Vovodo and Chinko rivers in CAR.
3 armed LRA members (2 men and 1 woman) were seen heading south in Mapoi, South Sudan.
2 people were killed and 1 woman abducted when the LRA attacked near the community of Mapoi, S. Sudan.

LRA members attacked Maboussou, CAR, between August 27th and 28th, 2009. The LRA members killed 3 people, injured 1 man seriously, raped 1 woman, and abducted 14 others, including a 12-year-old boy. 2 men abducted the previous day managed to escape.

Of the 14 people abducted on August 27th, 2009, 7 of them have escaped in Maboussou, CAR, the next day. Of the 3 who remained in captivity, the 12-year-old boy was killed in the bush at an unknown date.
LRA forces attacked the village of Maboussou, CAR on March 20th, 2011, looting food stores and abducting an unconfirmed number of people.
LRA forces attacked Maboussou, CAR, killing 2 and abducting at least 5 people.

An unknown number of LRA forces, speaking Acholi and a poor Pazande abducted 4 central Africans, including a pregnant woman, her 2-year-old daughter, a 12-year-old boy and a 35-year-old woman. They looted food and non-food items as well as valuable goods.
3 women abducted by LRA forces in the week prior were released and came back to Maboussou, CAR. The boy who had been abducted with the 3 women is still in captivity.
LRA forces raided Gouete, CAR on April 18th, 2010. They killed at least 6 civilians, abducted 3 civilians, and looted several shops and houses.
Security forces killed 25 LRA forces around Obo, CAR on September 8th, 2009. Specifically, Lt. Col Santos Alit and 5 other LRA were killed 15 km northeast of Obo, CAR.
Of the 21 civilians abducted in Fode, CAR, on June 7th, 7 have returned. LRA forces released 4 civilians and 3 additional civilians were able to escape.
21 civilians were abducted and 1 was killed in an LRA attack on Fode, CAR.
A group of LRA were spotted heading south from Fode, CAR.
A Ugandan male combatant was killed in a clash in Fode, CAR, sometime in 2013.

On March 3rd, 2013, 6 suspected and armed LRA forces, comprised of 5 men and 1 woman,  ambushed 3 men near Fode, CAR, as the men were on their way to a gold quarry. 2 of the 3 men were shot dead, the third managed to escape and report the news.
As of August 30, 2013, LRA forces reportedly have a camp in or near Fode, CAR, making the nearby villages of Ouanda, Balifondo, and Bamara too dangerous to enter due to the LRA presence.

After almost 4 years in captivity, an 18-year-old woman from Fode, CAR, escaped from LRA forces and returned in her community of origin. She came out of the bush with her 2 boys, the youngest of which is 9 months old.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian at Bondji, CAR, on April 21st, 2010.
LRA forces killed 3 civilians on the road from Derbissaka to Dembia, CAR. The date and location are accurate estimates.
LRA commander Okello Kalalang was killed during a clash with security forces north of Obo, CAR, on September 13th-14th, 2009. There are no further details on the precise location.
About 29 LRA fighters killed 3 civilians and burned a car in an attack on the village of Mabia, South Sudan.  This was part of a series of attacks in the area over 2 days.
A man, abducted by LRA forces 5 days earlier, was able to escape on Sept. 9th, 2012 near Fode, CAR. In captivity, he was beaten and witnessed LRA forces raping captive women.

A 25-year-old male and at least 1 other male were abducted by 12 LRA forces when their camp was attacked between Bakouma and Ouanda, CAR. Their captors met up with other LRA and abductees, who were then forced to cut a path with machetes to Lengo, CAR.
LRA members released the 2 men and 1 girl they had abducted from Ngilingili, CAR, earlier that same evening of February 9th, 2011.

12 armed LRA forces, including 1 woman, attacked and looted fish and meat from 2 hunters. The assailants asked specific questions about the movement, number and position of security forces in Obo, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Guembou, CAR and killed 3 people.
LRA forces attacked Guembou, CAR.
2 days after the attack at Ngouyo, LRA forces attacked Banagui, CAR, killing 1 woman and looting supplies, before security forces ran them out of the town.

Between September 19 and 21, 2011, 20 LRA forces reportedly killed 2 and abducted 7 civilians total in the communities of Sangarigou, Angou, and Barraoua, CAR. Security forces arrived in Sangarigou and engaged the LRA. This report has been split into 3.
6 members of the LRA killed a boy near Bazande, S. Sudan.
A group of armed LRA abducted 2 people, burned 4 houses, and looted food from Bazande, South Sudan.  Security forces from Tambura pursued the attackers.

LRA forces clashed with the Arrow Boys near the CAR/South Sudan border. 2 women, aged 19-20, and a 6-year-old boy, who is a son of Kony, were rescued from the LRA during the battle. At least 1 of the women is suspected to have been a "wife" of Kony.

About 29 armed LRA fighters attacked civilians near Zangria, South Sudan, which is 5 miles east of Tambura county. They abducted 2 boys and 1 girl, looted food, and burned down 11 houses. This location is an estimate.
Suspected LRA forces released 2 people who had been abducted earlier that same day to transport looted goods. They were released near Louagba, CAR, which is near Rafai.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 2 people and forced them to transport looted goods near Louagba, CAR which is near Rafai.
LRA members killed 3 local government agents in Tambura, South Sudan, on May 17th, 2010.
LRA members attacked Tambura, South Sudan killing 3 civilians.

1 LRA member surrendered or was taken into custody by security forces in Tambura, S. Sudan on or around May 13th, 2011. Some reports indicate surrender to a priest, some say capture by security forces. Unclear whether surrender was on the 13th or earlier.
A businessman from Togo, who had been abducted by LRA forces on March 17, 2009, managed to escape to Tambura, South Sudan with the help of a group of Mbororo.
A male of unknown age escaped from LRA forces and fled to Tambura, South Sudan.

Between September 19 and 22, 2011, 20 LRA forces reportedly killed 2 and abducted 7 civilians total in the communities of Sangarigou, Angou, and Barraoua, CAR. This report has been split into 3 to show the locations of each attack.
Suspected LRA abducted 1 person in Angou, CAR.

The same LRA forces that attacked Denguiro, CAR a week earlier released everyone they had abducted near the Mbari River. The captives had been used to carry looted goods. At least 8 people were released, but the true number is likely slightly higher.

LRA forces ambushed 2 men and 2 women who were fishing 45 km north of Obo, CAR, near the Mandiri River along the road to Djemah. 1 of the men was killed, the 2 women were abducted. The other man managed to escape and fled to Obo.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and abducted 24 others at Barraoua, CAR, on November 20th, 2009.
Sometime in early December 2009, a young girl escaped from the LRA in Barraoua, CAR. She had been in the bush for 4 months and was beaten while in captivity.
LRA forces attacked Barraoua, CAR injuring 3 people.
LRA forces killed 3 civilians and abducted 3 others at Barraoua, CAR on January 5th, 2010.
LRA forces attacked Barraoua, CAR, killing 3 people.
Security forces clashed with the LRA near Barraoua, CAR. As a result of the clash, 1 woman was released from LRA captivity.
Of the 10 people abducted from Barraoua and Sangarigou, CAR, 1 was able to escape the same day.
LRA forces abducted 10 civilians from Barraoua and Sangarigou, CAR, on September 9th, 2010.
18 of the 19 people abducted by the LRA from Barraoua, CAR, by the LRA were released or escaped from captivity.
LRA forces attacked Barraoua, CAR, and abducted 19 people.
The LRA attacked Barraoua, CAR and killed 3 people.

Between September 19 and 22, 2011, 20 LRA forces reportedly killed 2 and abducted 7 civilians total in the communities of Sangarigou, Angou, and Barraoua, CAR. This report has been split into 3 to show the locations of each attack.

A civilian reported that LRA forces killed 3 people in Barraoua, CAR on September 21st. Security forces engaged the LRA resulting in the release of 6 LRA captives as well as the death of an unknown number of LRA combatants.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians from Barraoua, CAR.

As reported on March 19th, a group of civilians in Barraoua, CAR, pursued and killed 3 LRA combatants in response to an abduction that happened on March 14th. The exact date of this incident remains unclear.

A woman escaped from LRA captivity near Barraoua, CAR. After spending a few days traveling alone in the bush, she reached security forces in Djemah, CAR. She reported that many others in her group wished to escape, as well.
A girl escaped from the LRA and fled to Barraoua, CAR. She cited seeing defection fliers and hearing helicopter loudspeaker messages during her time in the LRA.
After the LRA attack on Derbissaka on November 7th, the residents of nearby Barraoua, CAR, fled to Dembia on November 19th. By November 25th, all the homes in the community were burned.

LRA forces attacked the village of Denguiro, CAR abducting 7 people and looting food from the village, which the new captives were forced to carry. An additional, unknown number of people were abducted as the group headed east toward Mbari.
Between June 21st & 25th, 2012, LRA forces abducted 10 civilians from Ouanda and Denguiro, CAR.
On June 26th, 2012, LRA forces looted Denguiro, CAR, and abducted 3 men and 1 pregnant woman.
The same LRA forces that attacked Denguiro, CAR a day earlier abducted a man on who came upon the group while he was riding a bicycle.
LRA forces attacked the village of Banzua, S. Sudan causing people to flee toward the town of Tambura. It is unknown how many people were injured, killed, or abducted during this attack.

LRA forces attacked the town and gold mine at Ammoungombi, CAR with guns and machetes. They abducted 48 people including 3 girls aged 8, 10, and 11, and killed 6 people who resisted being abducted. They looted foodstuffs and burned bicycles.

Approximately a week after their abduction at Ammoungombi, CAR, 39 of 48 abductees were released or had escaped from LRA captivity. The exact location is unknown.  1 other man escaped, but is recorded in a related incident, bringing the total to 40 of 48.

1 person who had earlier been abducted by a group of 29 LRA in Nabaria, South Sudan, was able to escape. The escapee reported that the group was well organized, had new AK-47s, and one was speaking Arabic.
A group of about 29 LRA members abducted 6 people from Nabaria, South Sudan, and looted medicine from a local clinic.  This was part of a series of attacks in the area over 2 days.
6 men escaped from LRA captivity shortly after their abduction from Nabaria, South Sudan. The fate of the 3 women abducted with them remains unknown.

LRA forces attacked people at Nabaria between Tambura and Namutina, South Sudan. 1 man was killed, 6 men and 3 women abducted and food was looted. A local militia group known as the Arrow Boys pursued the assailants.
A Ugandan girl escaped from the LRA near the Vovodo and Chinko rivers in CAR.

Security forces clashed with a group of LRA, led by Dominic Ongwen, near the Vovodo and Chinko rivers in CAR and rescued a 6-year-old boy and a 19-year-old man. 2 LRA combatants were killed in the clash, and their weapons and equipment were recovered.
A group of 6 individuals, composed of 3 children and 2 adults and 1 other, escaped from LRA captivity near the Vovodo and Chinko rivers in CAR.
On January 20th, 2013, a young Congolese girl was rescued from LRA captivity near where the Vovodo and Chinko rivers meet in CAR. She had spent 2 years in LRA captivity.
On approximately March 1st, LRA forces reportedly killed a pastor and his grandson along the road between Zemio, CAR and Djemah, CAR.
On June 22nd, 2012, LRA forces abducted 6 civilians, 3 of which were adults, from Bandiji, CAR.
LRA forces attacked Bouete, CAR, abducting 2 people and killing 2 others. Multiple houses were looted and then burned.

On June 23rd, 2012 in Lengo, CAR, LRA forces killed an elderly man and a fisherman, and abducted 4 others, including the elderly man's wife, and looted at least 1 home. The abducted persons were forced to carry the looted goods.
A woman who was abducted with 3 others from Lengo, CAR on June 23rd. 2012, managed to escape. The exact date and location of her escape are unknown.
LRA forces attacked Bakouma, CAR on February 11th, 2010. This is the same group that had recently attacked Nzako, CAR.
LRA forces clashed with security forces at Bakouma, CAR. As a result, 4 LRA were captured.

A group of 30+ LRA forces attacked and looted portable computers and food from a uranium plant in Bakouma, CAR on June 24th, 2012. Security forces defending the area retreated after the attack began and reported that they ran out of ammunition.

Most of the civilians abducted by the LRA forces from Lengo, Ouanda, and Denguiro, CAR between June 21-25 were released on June 29th, 2012. It is unclear how many people were released or escaped, but there were 2 confirmed returnees.
On June 27th, 2012, 3 men escaped from LRA forces and arrived two days later in Bakouma, DRC. 2 of them had been abducted a week earlier and all took part in the Areva attack on June 24th, 2012.
A man, who was abducted by LRA forces during an attack on a gold mine at Ammoungombi, CAR, escaped near Bakouma, CAR.

3 LRA soldiers ambushed 7 hunters 47 km northeast of Obo, CAR, and looted dry meat, clothing and other goods. The assailants were armed with AK-47's, wore tattered military uniforms and spoke Acholi. The victims were all Central African men.
6 LRA forces battled with security forces between Sangu, South Sudan and the CAR border. 1 LRA member was killed. This was the same group of LRA that had abducted people from Sangu a week earlier.

After a clash, the 5 surviving LRA fighters from a group  that had abducted people from Sangu, S. Sudan a week earlier were again attacked by security forces. This time the remaining 5 abductees from Sangu were freed. 1 LRA fighter was wounded.
Between July 8th and July 11th, 2010, LRA members killed 2 civilians and abducted a "few" civilians near Ngouyo, DRC.
LRA forces attacked Ngouyo, CAR, and killed 3 civilians.

At least 30 LRA forces attacked Ngouyo, CAR, killing 1 person and abducting 4 more people. Regional security forces were nearby and fired warning shots because the LRA was intermingled with civilians. 35 houses were also burned.
Suspected LRA members abducted an estimated 15 people from Ngouyo, CAR, on December 18, 2011.

5 LRA combatants released 2 women and 3 children near Ngouyo, CAR. They declared that their fellow combatants in the bush only have a few weapons remaining. The women and children are currently with security forces.
Suspected LRA attacked a woman and her son, beating her and abducting him, in Ngouyo, CAR.
Suspected LRA forces abducted a woman on the night of March 10, 2013, from Ngouyo, CAR.  They reportedly "abused" her overnight.
A woman who had been abducted by suspected LRA forces the previous day from Ngouyo, CAR, was released by her attackers on March 11, 2013.

Between March 1st and 6th, 2013,  security forces found the body of a woman who had been abducted with another woman a couple of weeks earlier. The body was found 60 km away from Obo, CAR, on the Obo-Djemah road. The body had bullet holes in it.
A man, who was abducted the previous day by 13 LRA soldiers south of Djemah, CAR, managed to escape approximately 80 km north of Zemio. 2 days after his escape, he arrived in Ngouyo.

LRA commander, Samuel Kangul, and at least 3 other LRA were killed in an ambush by UPDF forces as they were crossing the Vovodo river, 15-20 km northeast of the Vovodo-Chinko river confluence, CAR.  A 17-year-old girl was shot before escaping.

10-15 LRA disguised as SPLA soldiers abducted 7 people from the village of Sangu, S. Sudan while the civilians were attending a funeral on May 9th, 2011. Local police forces pursued the LRA as they fled west towards CAR.
The day after the abductions at the funeral procession in Sangu, South Sudan, various security forces pursued the LRA, but were ambushed. 2 abductees managed to escape during the battle.
Armed and suspected LRA members killed 1 hunter and abducted 3 others between Tambura county and Namutina Payam, South Sudan.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and abducted 5 others in an attack on Takipandi, CAR, on May 1st, 2010.
LRA combatants abducted 2 people near Ouagou, CAR.
LRA forces killed 1 civilian and abducted 14 others in an attack on Derbissaka, CAR.
LRA forces abducted 3 civilians from Derbissaka, CAR, during the month of February in 2010.
LRA forces attacked the town of Derbissaka, CAR and killed 2 people.
LRA forces attacked the village of Derbissaka, CAR and killed 2 people.
More than 500 civilians fled southwest toward Dembia, CAR from Derbissaka, Sango Rigo, and Kossa, CAR as a result of LRA attacks.
A boy, a girl, and a young woman escaped from the LRA and arrived in Derbissaka, CAR, on roughly January 16th.
A Ugandan woman escaped from the LRA and fled to Derbissaka, CAR. She cited seeing defection fliers and hearing radio messages during her time in the bush.

Security forces came across a woman who had escaped from LRA captivity with her 8-month-old baby near Derbissaka, CAR. She reported that other LRA combatants are interested in surrendering, but are frightened of being punished by security forces.
On December 6th, 2012, a Ugandan LRA combatant defected near Derbissaka, CAR. He cited defection fliers as a reason for his escape.
A woman, who had been a "wife" in the LRA for 4 years, defected at Derbissaka, CAR. She reported seeing defection fliers during her time with the LRA.

An 18-year-old woman escaped with her baby from LRA forces and fled to Derbissaka, CAR. She was raped while in captivity. Security forces reunited the woman with her parents. She had been abducted in March 2008.
LRA forces abducted 13 hunters in Derbissaka, CAR, and forced them to carry goods for the group.
13 hunters, who were abducted by LRA forces from Derbissaka, CAR, on April 11th, 2013, returned after several weeks in captivity.

The same LRA group that attacked Mbororos the previous day attacked and looted the population of Derbissaka, CAR. An exchange of fire with the population led to 2 wounded civilians, both Central African men. 700 people were displaced to Djemah.
LRA forces abducted 3 fishermen along with their belongings near Mabuse, CAR.

LRA forces attacked Ngogola, S Sudan on July 29th, 2009. The attack lasted until the next morning. The LRA looted the town, including the church and health center. 2 civilians were killed and 2 civilians were abducted. Most of the town was burned.
LRA forces abducted 22 civilians at Simango, CAR, on October 29th, 2011.

Sometime around February 23rd, 2010, 2 women, one of them pregnant, and 1 man were attacked by the LRA as they went fishing and hunting  approximately 80 north-east of Obo, CAR. The 2 women were killed and the man managed to escape.
LRA forces released 5 women who had been abducted near the Ouara River in CAR earlier in the day.
Suspected LRA forces abducted 5 women and 1 man who were fishing in the Ouara River in CAR and looted their goods.
David Lakwo's group reportedly halted somewhere between Obo and Djemah, DRC, to wait for another LRA group. These groups were on their way to meet Kony.

21 displaced civilians encountered 4 suspected LRA forces as they were going from Djemah to their fields in Derbissaka, CAR. The assailants made gestures towards the civilians, who then fled in various direction. A  14-year-old boy was abducted.
LRA forces attacked Namutina, South Sudan, killing 1 person and abducting 3 others.
A large group of LRA forces ambushed 5 hunters north-east of Maboussou, CAR. The men were forced to accompany the LRA group and spent the night 5 km away from Maboussou.

13 LRA armed LRA soldiers attacked 11 men who were refining palm oil. 10 of the men escaped, but 1 was briefly abducted. The abducted man later said the assailants spoke Acholi, Pazande and Sango and that 3 officers were among the group.

Two Ugandans, one man and one woman, defected in the Chinko Basin area of CAR. They had escaped with 3 other civilians from their LRA group about a year ago. Their group was reportedly commanded by 2nd Lt. Richard and was composed of 34 members.
Civilians from Goudr, CAR fled southeast toward Obo, CAR after LRA forces were spotted by local hunters in the area.

From Oct. 22-23, 2009, LRA forces attacked civilians on the road to Derbissaka, CAR. 1 civilian was killed and 21 civilians were abducted. It is reported that this was Kony's group and that it was fleeing from security forces.

Sometime between September 1st and October 31st, 2009, 1 man escaped from the LRA around Djemah, CAR. The man was severely beaten during his time in captivity. Security forces brought him back to Obo, CAR.

LRA members were traveling near Djemah, CAR, when 2 abductees escaped and alerted security forces who responded. An estimated 25 LRA members were killed, at least 2 LRA women captured, 7 children abducted, and 11 civilians killed over 3 days.
Of the 7 people abducted from Djemah, CAR on October 2nd, 2009, 3 of the abducted boys were killed at Joseph Kony's command in retaliation for the LRA fighters killed by security forces.

According to the report, LRA Brigadier Okedi was killed after his group was cited by civilians who reported their presence to security forces on October 16th, 2009. 1 LRA force was reportedly wounded and died later of his wounds.
LRA forces killed 11 civilians in the Djemah, CAR area.
A 15-year-old boy escaped from LRA forces in Djemah, CAR. He was in captivity for a year and reported that Joseph Kony is currently located in CAR.
2 people escaped from the LRA and fled to Djemah, CAR. They cited seeing defection fliers and hearing helicopter loudspeaker messages during their time with the LRA.
A group of LRA clashed with security forces in the Djemah region in CAR.  During the clash a Ugandan LRA sergeant and another soldier defected from the LRA.
3 children escaped from LRA captivity and fled to Djemah, CAR.
An 11-year-old boy escaped from the LRA and fled to Djemah, CAR. He had spent 2 years in LRA captivity.
A 22-year-old girl, who had escaped from LRA captivity during a clash with security forces a week earlier, arrived in Djemah, CAR with an injured left arm.
A 22-year-old woman escaped from LRA forces on December 28th when security forces attacked them. Two days later she arrived in Djemah, CAR.

A 38-year-old male LRA combatant who had spent 20 years in captivity defected on the bank of the Ngouangoua river in Djemah, CAR, after having walked 6 days in the bush. He reported listening to radio defection broadcasts.

A group of hunters saw a unknown number of suspected LRA forces, including women and children, along the river Bili, west of Djemah in CAR. This armed group spoke Acholi and was headed towards Obo, CAR.
Security forces heavily bombarded the LRA north of Djemah, CAR, in January 2010. The precise date and location of this assault are unknown.
LRA commander Senior Brigadier Bok Abudema and 1 other LRA member was killed north of Djemah, CAR by security forces. 2 women traveling with them were freed. This location is an estimate.

LRA forces released 9 men, who had been abducted on December 23, 2012, from Bani, CAR. The men were picked up by employees of Central African Wildlife Adventures on January 10, 2013 and driven to Bakouma. The coordinates for this event are an estimate.

5 LRA forces temporarily abducted 6 hunters, 19 km northeast of Djemah, CAR. They took all the food of the hunters and released them a few hours later. The assailants forbid them to talk to local security forces about what had happened to them.
LRA forces attacked Nzako, CAR, killing 6 people and abducting 7 others.
2 people were killed and 15 abducted when 10-20 LRA forces attacked the town of Nzako, CAR. The LRA also stole food and clothes.
LRA forces attacked Nzako, CAR, and abducted an unknown number of civilians.
Of the 46 children abducted by the LRA from Nzako, CAR, 32 were able to escape shorty thereafter.

Reportedly over 200 LRA forces attacked the village of Nzako, CAR, killing 9 people and abducting 46 children. They looted the police station and many homes in the town. The exact number of LRA who attacked remains unclear, but it was a large force.

After the attack on Nzako, CAR, some LRA forces remained in the area and reportedly raped some of the children they abducted, one as young as 10-years-old. They were also pursued by CPJP rebels who reportedly killed 8 LRA.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Nzako, CAR, on May 2, 2013. Several people were killed, an unknown number abducted and multiple homes looted. No further details on the attack is known.

An undetermined number of armed suspected  LRA forces went to pray in the church with the population of Nzako, CAR. They then bought food and non-food items. The LRA forces said that they are scared of the Seleka, which is why they have not defected.
A 12-year-old boy who was abducted 1 year earlier reportedly defected from LRA forces in Nzako, CAR.
