1 Ugandan man, 1 Ugandan woman, 3 children and 1 Central African boy defected from the LRA near Nzako, CAR. The boy reported recognizing previous defectors pictured on fliers. The group also listened to shortwave radio Come Home messaging.

On February 7th, 2013, a former LRA Lieutenant,  who defected in June 2012, led security forces to an LRA cache near Ragada, CAR, where uniforms, condiments and 6 pieces of  ivory were found buried in the ground.
6 suspected and armed LRA forces made contact with Seleka forces and civilians and expressed a desire to peacefully defect near the mining site of Banal, CAR.

1 man escaped from suspected LRA forces at Bamara, CAR, shortly after he was abducted with 6 other men near Nzako, CAR. The abducted man abandoned the wounded LRA member he was helping and escaped. Bamara also suffered burning and looting by LRA forces.
40 armed and suspected LRA forces set up a camp at Bamara, CAR. There were other reports of LRA activity along the Nzako-Bria axis, which is the axis that Bamara is located on.

A group of 49 armed LRA attacked the communities of Yangoussi, Bamara and Zouangadji, CAR. They abducted approximately 34 people and killed 2 others. Buildings were burned and goods looted. Security forces responded and killed 1 LRA while wounding others.
Three days after their abduction by LRA forces from Yangoussi, CAR, and other nearby communities, 24 people were released from captivity. However, 6 boys and 4 girls were not released.
LRA forces clashed with security forces in the bush relatively close to Dedoumou, CAR. 4 people were released in the clash, including 2 Ugandan girls and 1 Sudanese girl.

5 LRA forces ambushed a group of civilians 35 km north of Djemah, CAR. The LRA forces systematically looted them of their belongings including the clothes they were wearing. An abducted teenage child translated between Acholi and Pazande during the attack

In the week of March 20th, LRA forces brutally beat to death 13 gold miners in the CAWA Safari Camp which is northeast of Bakouma, CAR. The  victims were beat to death with pieces of wood and stripped of their clothing.
LRA and Seleka forces clashed at a small village along the road between Bria and Yalinga, CAR. Several LRA and 4 Seleka rebels were killed, while 3 more Seleka soldiers were seriously injured.
LRA forces attacked the town of Yalinga, CAR, abducting 26 people and looting several buildings on February 28th, 2010.

LRA forces attacked the communities of Ahou and Doungou, CAR, which are west of Yalinga. They killed 6 people, including the chief of Ahou. They also abducted 11 people, looted various goods, and set fire to both communities.
4 LRA forces attacked Aza, CAR, which is along the road to Yalinga, and abducted 15 people, including a woman. A 5-year-old child was reportedly burned by the assailants, as well.
Seleka forces clashed with LRA forces in the Bria, CAR, area. 5 Seleka soldiers were killed, while the casualties on the LRA side remains unknown.

Suspected LRA forces reportedly attacked Seleka positions at Dangbatro, CAR, killing 6 soldiers. Reportedly, several people were injured including a pregnant woman and a  baby who was burned alive by the assailants. At least 1 mother was also killed.
2 LRA members surrendered north of the river near Matafa in the Djemah region of CAR on May 14th, 2011.
LRA forces killed 5 civilians and abducted 45 more people from Bani and Nzako, CAR. They also looted a large amount of money from one of the abducted individuals, who was a diamond collector.

12 LRA forces comprised of 10 armed men, a woman, and a child abducted 12 people, comprised of 11 men and an 11-year-old girl, from Bani, CAR.  The assailants looted a large quantity of goods including food, which the men were forced to carry.
Reportedly a large number suspected LRA forces attacked the community of Bani, CAR, on May 8, 2013. They burned the community and abducted 16 people.

Suspected LRA forces attacked the community of Mouka, CAR. 11 civilians were killed, 6 of whom where decapitated. 15 houses were also burned, while 4 assailants were reportedly killed. An unspecified number of locals were displaced.
LRA forces reportedly clashed with security forces 35 km south of Koro, South Sudan.
LRA forces abducted a man from his fields outside of Deim Zubeir, S. Sudan.
At least 5 LRA forces attacked Yubulu, S. Sudan, abducted 2 girls and 1 boy, killed an old man, and looted various goods from the town.
A Congolese girl escaped from LRA forces near the CAR/South Sudan border. She had been abducted 3 months earlier from Banda, DRC.
LRA forces reportedly attacked and kidnapped 16 people in Akocho, CAR, following the attack on their base in Nzako, CAR. 7 Seleka members were reportedly killed.
Two days after LRA forces abducted a man near Deim Zubeir, the same group attacked Sopo, S. Sudan, and abducted approximately 4 people.

Vincent Okumu Binansio, a top LRA commander and overall commander of LRA operations in the Congo, was killed during a clash with security forces near the CAR/South Sudan border. Binansio's bodyguard was wounded during the fight and later died.

LRA forces attacked the community of Ouada-Maikage, CAR, which is near Ouadda, and abducted an unknown number of people, while the remainder of the population fled into the bush. Seleka soldiers were deployed in pursuit of the assailants.
Suspected LRA forces released 33 of the 37 people they had recently abducted along the road between Ouadda and Sam Ouandja, CAR.

Suspected LRA forces carried out two attacks along the road between Ouadda and Sam Ouandja, CAR, that resulted in 37 people being abducted and 5 people being killed, including a man and a mother who were decapitated. The mother's child was abducted.
Security forces clashed with LRA resulting in 4 LRA casualties and 2 LRA captured outside of Raga, S. Sudan.

In response to the local populations of Akosso and Pipidemotro, CAR, killing 4 suspected LRA during an attack on the towns, the assailants killed 6 more civilians in a reprisal attack. They decapitated the victims and displayed their heads on tree trunks.

Suspected LRA forces attacked the gold & diamond mining towns of Akosso and Pipidemotro, CAR. 6 people were killed, 10 wounded and 12 abducted. Houses were burned & looted. The local population pursued the fleeing rebels and killed 4 of them.

Suspected LRA forces attacked the town of Kotto 2 in CAR and abducted 4 people, including 3 children. They also burned 40 houses, looted food and money, destroyed the town's granaries, beat people and displaced the population.

37 individuals, mostly women and young people, were reportedly abducted by LRA forces overnight from Kotto 3, CAR. The assailants shot rounds in the air and abducted anyone who stepped out of their households. They looted food and non-food items.
An unknown number of suspected LRA forces killed 1 Seleka member and abducted 8 civilians near Kotto 3, CAR. The assailants then burned and looted communities as they passed through.
During the month of August, 2011, a month after his initial defection from the LRA, an LRA soldier defected to security forces. He had been abducted as a teenager in 1997 from Uganda.
During the month of September 2009, LRA forces looted Boro Medina, S. Sudan.
During the month of September 2009, after LRA forces looted Boro Medina, S. Sudan, security forces tracked the group and killed 3 LRA members. The exact location of the clash is unknown.
Security forces clashed with suspected LRA forces after they abducted 13 people from Boro Medina, S. Sudan. 10 of the abducted people were freed, 2 were killed, and 2 more injured.
Suspected LRA forces attacked Boro Madina, S. Sudan. 13 people were abducted to carry the goods that were looted from multiple shops.
A male of unknown age escaped from the LRA and fled to Boro Medina, S. Sudan. He cited radio messages as a reason for escaping.
2 young men who were abducted from Deim Jallab, S. Sudan managed to escape LRA captivity the same day. 2 others who were abducted at the same time are still held in captivity.

A large group of LRA attacked a police station, clinic, and several households in Deim Jallab, S. Sudan, on September 4th. They looted food, household goods, 3 AK-47s, and abducted 4 people. Last month, the LRA attacked this community 3 times.
During the month of July, security forces clashed with LRA forces, near Raga, S. Sudan.
Security forces clashed with suspected LRA combatants at their hideout near Boro Medina, South Sudan.
The 2 brothers who were abducted from Raga, S. Sudan, escaped from the LRA a few hours later.
2 brothers were abducted by LRA forces in Raga, S. Sudan.
Suspected LRA forces released 1 person shortly after they were abducted along the road between Sam Ouandja and Ouadda, CAR.

Suspected LRA forces carried out an attack 14 km from Sam Ouandja, CAR, along the road to Ouadda that injured 2 people and killed 1 other. They also abducted 4 people. Security forces reportedly intervened and killed 5 LRA.
8 civilians, who were reportedly abducted by LRA forces in Kotto 3, CAR, were released after traveling over 50 km from their abduction location.

A large group of LRA forces clashed with sec. forces just south of Sam Ouandja, near Djemah, CAR. 4 civilians escaped during this attack and reportedly the LRA commander Bok Abudema was killed. Other victim details are unknown.
Security forces attacked LRA forces at Ouandja, CAR on October 4th, 2010. Four LRA were killed.
During the week of January 9th, 2014, LRA forces attacked a community 45 km away from Sam Ouandja, CAR, and abducted around 10 civilians.

A week after their abduction, around 10 civilians returned from the bush in a community 45 km away from Sam Ouandja, CAR. These returnees reportedly walked over 55 km in the bush, carrying goods looted by LRA forces.

Of the 30 civilians abducted by LRA forces sometime between February 17th and 24th near Sam Ouandja, CAR, 20 were released a few hours after their abduction. The remaining 10 carried the looted goods to a location a few kilometers away.

LRA forces abducted 2 civilians near Sam Ouandja, CAR, and asked them questions about the position of ex-Seleka forces in the area. While retreating, they encountered ex-Seleka forces and exchanged fire, which led to the death of a LRA force.

Sometime between February 17th and 24th, LRA forces invaded a mining site near Sam Ouandja, CAR, reportedly abducting 30 civilians. 20 were released a few hours later, while the rest carried  the looted goods to a location a few kilometers away.

The day following an attack on a nearby mining site, LRA forces looted civilians 20 km from Sam Ouandja, CAR, and abducted 1 girl and 3 boys. They then reportedly turned around and spent the night 45 km from Sam Ouandja.

In response to the attack on Ouanda Djalle, CAR, security forces and local self defense group members pursued LRA combatants on September 11th, 2010. These combined forces fell into an ambush, but inflicted many casualties upon the LRA.
LRA forces attacked Yangou-Pndr, CAR. 36 people were abducted and 3 killed. 2 girls were released, as well.
LRA forces attacked the village of Yangou-Pandere in CAR and looted goods from the population. 4 LRA were killed during the attack.
LRA forces attacked Yangou-Pendere, CAR, and abducted 44 people. They then fled northwest toward Ouanda Djalle while being chased by another rebel group.
LRA forces abducted 1 civilian, shot another in the arm, burned 9 homes, and displaced 300 civilians in an attack on Yangou-Pndr on March 8th, 2012.
All but 1 of the 13 people who were abducted the day before were able to escape from  LRA captivity on March 8th, 2012. They were abducted from Yangou-Pndr, CAR.
LRA forces abducted 13 civilians after ambushing and looting them along the road to Yangou-Pndr, CAR on March 7th, 2012. The abductees were tied together with rope and forced to carry looted goods.
37 civilians who had been abducted in Kotto 3, CAR, were reportedly liberated the same day about 50 km from Sam Ouandja, CAR.

LRA forces attacked Ouanda Djalle, CAR. They burned 97 houses and abducted 36 people. The local militia responded and 9 LRA were killed. The next morning the LRA returned and killed 2 civilians and exchanged fire w/ local militia. 2,000 people displaced.

Security forces engaged the LRA the day after LRA forces abducted 36 people from Ouanda Djalle, CAR. During the clash, a large number of the abductees were able to escape, and the security forces captured 5 LRA members.
2 days after their initial attack on Ouanda Djalle, CAR, LRA forces returned, but were pushed out of the town by security forces and local defense forces.
UFDR forces found 2 abductees who had escaped from the LRA while they were tracking LRA combatants who had recently attacked Ouanda Djalle, CAR.
Of the 52 people who were abducted in an LRA attack on Soungou, Aftina, and Kpengbele in CAR, 10 were released the same day, September 3rd, 2010.
52 people were abducted in an LRA attack on Soungou, Aftaina, and Kpengbele in CAR, during which the LRA also looted food and money.
LRA forces attacked Mandoua, CAR, and abducted 3 people.
Several days after their abduction by LRA forces from Mandoua, CAR, 2 of the 3 abducted civilians were able to escape between October 7th and 8th, 2010.
LRA members reportedly attack Koumbal, CAR and abducted 7 people.
2 days after their abduction from Koumbal, CAR, 3 people were able to escape from LRA captivity.
LRA forces attacked Koumbal, CAR, and abducted 4 people. The LRA also looted goods from the community.

LRA forces reportedly attacked Tiroungoulou, CAR. Multiple people were abducted, but an exact number is unavailable. 1 person was beaten to death by the LRA. Security forces counter attacked killing 2 LRA and wounding 10 more.
LRA fighters attacked the a local militia base in Tiroungoulou, CAR. 4 LRA were killed.
Reported LRA forces attacked security forces in Dafak, Kafia Kingi.
